Title: Analyst, Reporting & Analytics
Description:
At Revlon, we create beauty innovations for everyone that inspire confidence and ignite joy every day.

Breaking beauty boundaries is in our company’s DNA. Since its game-changing launch of the first opaque nail enamel in 1932 (and later, the first long-wear foundation), Revlon has provided consumers with high-quality product innovation, performance, and sophisticated glamour. Elizabeth Arden made waves as a woman-led beauty company in the 1920s. In 1931, Almay became the original hypoallergenic, fragrance-free beauty brand.

Today, Revlon resiliently continues its legacy as a leading global beauty company. Our diverse portfolio—which consists of some of the world’s most iconic brands and product offerings in color cosmetics, skin care, hair color & care, personal care, and fragrances—is sold around the world through prestige, professional, mass, and direct-to-consumer retail channels. These brands include Revlon, Revlon Professional, Elizabeth Arden, Almay, American Crew, CND, Cutex, Mitchum, Sinful Colors, Creme of Nature, Britney Spears, Christina Aguilera, John Varvatos, Juicy Couture, Ed Hardy and more.

We honor our heritage, embrace change, and applaud diversity. We champion our employees and celebrate our consumers.

We are Revlon, together, transforming beauty.

Position Overview

Revlon’s growing Analytics, Insights, & Business Intelligence team has an opening for a deeply curious and self-motivated Analyst, Reporting and Analytics. The Analyst, Reporting and Analytics will serve as Revlon’s syndicated data expert & will provide reporting support for the organization. This role involves collaborating with cross-functional leaders across all Revlon brands and functions.

We want you to take initiative, think strategically, and foster intellectual curiosity throughout the team and organization. This role reports to the Director of Analytics, Insights, & Business Intelligence and will be on-site (NYC) 3 days a week (remote Mondays and Fridays).

Job Responsibilities


Syndicated data review & analysis (Circana, Euromonitor, Mintel)
Drive reporting solutions adoption and trainings
Support reporting and insights across the organization
Assist on strategic projects
Anticipate business and research needs resourcefully, understanding both the big picture and the nuances of the business.
Turn data into actionable insights, cutting through data clutter to deliver unique insights that drive our growth agenda.
Work with cross-functional stakeholders across all Revlon brands.
Integrate data from multiple sources (primary, secondary, and syndicated) to drive ideation of brand strategy and executional tactics.


Experience


1-3 years of experience in research, trends, or analytics
Advanced proficiency working with syndicated datasets (Circana or Nielsen) - required
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and provide actionable insights.
Proficiency, or aptitude to learn, PowerBI
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel & Powerpoint
Self-motivated, hard-working, and strategic thinker with strong time management skills and the ability to prioritize competing deadlines. Ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment to drive brand and financial goals.
Self-starter – able to meet with teams on their own
Current authorization to work in the United States on a full-time basis


Education

Bachelor’s degree required

The base pay range for this position in New York City is $70,000 - $95,000; however base pay offered may vary depending on skills, experience, job-related knowledge, and location. Certain positions may also be eligible for short and/or long-term incentives as part of total compensation.

Employees (and their families) are eligible for medical, dental, and vision benefits. Employees are covered by the company-paid basic life insurance policy. Other benefits offered to employees include but are not limited to the following: long-term disability, supplemental life insurances, flexible spending accounts, critical illness insurance, group legal, identity theft protection, etc. Employees are also able to enroll in our 401k Retirement Savings Plan.

Employees are also enrolled in our company-paid short-term disability insurance (the benefit commences upon hire and allows for a portion of base salary for up to 26 weeks if you are disabled).

Employees will also receive 3 weeks of vacation, pro-rated based on date of hire for the 1st year of employment and twelve paid holidays throughout the calendar year.

This role is eligible for an annual bonus based on company performance.

  • Current authorization to work in the United States on a full-time basis

Employees (and their families) are eligible for medical, dental, and vision benefits. Employees are covered by the company-paid basic life insurance policy. Other benefits offered to employees include but are not limited to the following: long-term disability, supplemental life insurances, flexible spending accounts, critical illness insurance, group legal, identity theft protection, etc. Employees are also able to enroll in our 401k Retirement Savings Plan.

Employees are also enrolled in our company-paid short-term disability insurance (the benefit commences upon hire and allows for a portion of base salary for up to 26 weeks if you are disabled).

Employees will also receive 3 weeks of vacation, pro-rated based on date of hire for the 1st year of employment and twelve paid holidays throughout the calendar year.

This role is eligible for an annual bonus based on company performance.

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Zest AI has been perfecting AI for consumer lending decisions since 2009. Our mission is to broaden access to equitable lending and our AI-enabled software creates some of the most inclusive risk models in the industry. Our Model Management System helps lenders make better decisions and better loans — increasing revenue, reducing risk, and automating compliance — while expanding credit access to deserving people with no added risk!




Our technology teams at Zest AI thrive on solving challenging problems that have a big impact on people's daily lives. We build tools to improve consumer lending by meeting the needs of financial institutions and their customers around the world. By leveraging a combination of machine learning and vast amounts of data, we seek to challenge traditional credit scoring models, while expanding the use of our proprietary technology across the fintech industry. Our team is committed to continuously leveraging and adapting the latest advances in AI/ML to benefit those we serve.




As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for interpreting and analyzing complex data sets, developing insights to help drive business strategies, and communicating your findings to both technical and non-technical team members. You will also be involved in project management, ensuring that data-driven projects are completed on time and within scope. In this role, you will work closely with Data Scientists, Engineers, and our Client Success team to ensure our data solutions meet and exceed client expectations. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to drive your own research projects under the guidance of senior team members.




Responsibilities:

- Analyze and interpret complex data sets and machine learning model results using advanced statistical techniques.

- Translate model results to business impact.

- Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality

- Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets

- Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs

- Communicate findings to company through standard and ad hoc reports

- Promote and support data-driven decision making within the organization




Requirements:

- Expertise in data wrangling and manipulation in Python and SQL

- Solid understanding of machine learning and statistical analysis

- Excellent business acumen and ability to understand and solve complex business problems

- Strong coding skills, comfortable with Object-Oriented Programming

- Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex data in a clear and concise manner

- Good project management skills, with a proven track record of delivering projects on time and within scope

- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field




Perks and benefits:

All Zestys experience:

The opportunity to join a mission-focused company
People – the best part of Zest
Robust medical, dental and vision insurance plans
Annual bonus plan participation
401(k) with generous match
Employee Awards and Recognition
11 company holidays
Winter break (office closed between Christmas and New Year's Day)
Unlimited vacation time
Employee Resource Groups
Generous family leave policy (12 week maternity leave / 6 week paternity leave)
Phone, internet, wellness, and professional development allowances
Employee gatherings, including Town Hall meetings




Additionally, our Burbank, CA area, hybrid model Zestys enjoy:

Beautiful, modern, dog-friendly office with lounge areas, video games, and gigantic jigsaw puzzles
Daily catered lunches from LA’s best restaurants and a fully stocked kitchen
Complimentary manicures, pedicures, and mindfulness sessions
Company happy hours, social events, outings, and much more!




About Zest AI:

Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where all are welcomed, valued, and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are and where we’re headed in the future. We know that unique backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation, and succeed together. Zest is committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion and encourages professionals from underrepresented groups in technology and financial services to apply.




Our core values are Communication, Collaboration, Bias for Action, Client-centricity, and Heart. Learn more at Zest.ai, follow us on LinkedIn (linkedin.com/company/zest-ai/) or Twitter @Zest_AI, or check out our Insights blog (https://www.zest.ai/cms/insights).

Title: Data Analyst II
Description:
About Flexport:

At Flexport, we believe global trade can move the human race forward. That’s why it’s our mission to make global commerce so easy there will be more of it. We’re shaping the future of a $8.6T industry with solutions powered by innovative technology and exceptional people. Today, companies of all sizes - from emerging brands to Fortune 500s - use Flexport technology to move more than $19B of merchandise across 112 countries a year.

The recent global supply chain crisis has put Flexport center stage as we continue to play a pivotal role in how goods move around the world. At a valuation of $8 billion, we’re experiencing record growth and are proud to have the support of the best investors in the game who believe in our mission, solutions and people. Ready to tackle global challenges that impact business, society, and the environment? Come join us.

Creating insights to revolutionize an industry!

The opportunity:

Fast, accurate insights are integral in allowing us to fulfill our mission of fixing the user experience in global trade. At Flexport you’ll conduct analyses that are at the forefront of reshaping the entire logistics & supply chain industries. You’ll work alongside self-starters interested in solving real-world problems and streamlining the inefficiencies in the complex global trade industry. You’ll have the opportunity to improve an industry by analyzing the new operating system for global trade.

You will:


Flexport is a company that runs on data - you'll be transforming data into action by working cross-functionally with the entirety of Flexport.
Meet with stakeholders - from business and product - to understand OKR requirements and convert them into analytical solutions
Model new product analytics datasets built on our proprietary operations software to optimize growth strategies and cost reductions
Improve operational and financial productivity across our business and software
Rapid prototype new functionality via dashboards to enable new ways of working and discover best practices for workflow management across all of Flexport's departments;
Contribute and grow the culture of excellence on our team by bringing processes and best practices to our group.
Drive highly visible projects for Flexport
Influence the roadmap for both the Data Analytics department and the stakeholders we support


You should have:


2-5 years of experience in a Data Analyst, BI Engineer, Product Analyst, or similar role
Strong SQL fluency required – from building entire ERDs of tables containing complex logic to analyzing those datasets into consumable insights for the business.
Professional familiarity with applied statistics and scripting languages like Python or R (python preferred)
Experience ELT data modeling, especially with dbt (data build tool) is a plus; building analytical narratives using data visualizations (Looker is a plus)
Executive communication skills and empathy to understand and discover business pain points and build solutions to improve the user experience at all levels of the global trade process
Interest in optimizing operational productivity and measuring automation across our software and business processes
A "compliance first" attitude to keep our regulators happy and enthusiastic about Flexport since we operate in a heavily regulated industry.


Worried about not having any logistics experience?

Don’t be! Our mission is to make global trade easy for everyone. That’s why it’s important to bring people from diverse backgrounds and experiences together with our industry veterans to help move the global logistics industry forward.

We know this industry is complex. That’s why we invest in education starting day one with Flexport Academy, a one week intensive onboarding program designed specifically to set every new Flexport employee up for success.

The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range displayed, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education and / or training.

The US base salary range for this position: (exclusive of bonus, equity and benefits.) $89,550 - $107,000 USD

At Flexport, our ability to fulfill our mission of making global commerce easy and accessible relies on having a diverse, dedicated and engaged workforce. That is why Flexport is committed to creating and nurturing an environment where anyone can be their authentic self. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, health status, marital and family status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

per year

That is why Flexport is committed to creating and nurturing an environment where anyone can be their authentic self. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, health status, marital and family status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Global Technical Talent, an Inc. 5000 Company
Description:
Contract Duration 6 Months
Pay rate up to $51.07/hr


Job Description:


The Data Analyst is responsible for pulling data to support the trending of product complaints and medical device reports utilizing data that resides in the complaint handling database for all product lines.
This will include detailed data reports (e.g. graphs, charts, tables) prepared for routine trending, senior management reviews, ad-hoc requests, and cross-functional requests as needed (e.g. Regulatory, Quality Engineering, R&D).
The Data Analyst will establish and maintain complex reporting formulas and templates using reporting tools such as Excel and other databases (e.g. Business Objects).


Benefits:


Medical, Vision, and Dental Insurance Plans
401k Retirement Fund


About The Company:


Our client is a globally diversified healthcare company with a central purpose of helping people live their healthiest possible lives. They offer a broad portfolio of market-leading products that align with favorable long-term healthcare trends in both developed and developing markets. Working with this company, you'll tackle a wide array of problems including some of the world's greatest healthcare challenges while experiencing myriad cultures, geographies, and technologies. They are creating the future of healthcare through life-changing technologies and products that make you healthier and stronger, quickly identify when you have a medical need, and treat conditions to help you get back to doing what you love. It serves people in more than 160 countries with leading medical devices, diagnostics, nutrition products, and branded generic medicines.
If you are looking for a great company to work for, look no further because our client has received an average of a four-star rating from its thousands of employees that have written positive reviews on Glassdoor and Indeed.

Title: Data Analyst (Business Intelligence)
Description:
As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will join a driven, collaborative team within an ambitious, entrepreneurial global organization. You will work collaboratively within the Data & Analytics team supporting internal reporting for Global Client Services. This role requires a proactive individual who takes ownership of all assigned work and thrives in a collaborative team environment.

We pride ourselves on being a positive work environment, and place value on a work/life balance. This means thoughtful, sustainable workloads, as well as professional development opportunities to help you reach your career goals.

We are currently hiring out of the following office location(s):


Cherry Hill, NJ
Downers Grove, IL


This role may be eligible for voluntary work-from-home consideration. In order to be considered for this position, you should live within a commutable distance to one of these office locations, even if you plan to request a work-from-home arrangement, as there may be times when in-person meetings, training sessions, social events, or similar activities are held onsite.

This key position reports to the Director, Source-to-Pay Data & Analytics within our Advisory team. We're a dedicated, down-to-earth group in a growing organization offering plenty of opportunity. We look forward to adding you into the mix!

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will:


Handle diverse data inputs and transform them into valuable insights, demonstrating strong data organization and cleansing skills, ensuring that data is presented in a format that is clear and accessible to team members.
Utilize tools and techniques to clean and standardize data, ensuring accuracy and consistency.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and identify key outcomes for reporting.
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders (technical and non-technical) in clear and concise formats
Demonstrate exceptional communication skills, documenting and articulating findings and action items



Requirements

You'll need to have:


Bachelor's or Master's in Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics, Business Information Systems, or a related field.
Proven experience with business intelligence software such as Power BI, Tableau, Qlik.
Excellent communication skills, written and verbal (English).
Knowledge in Programming Languages (SQL, Python) for querying and manipulating data stored in databases
Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Excel skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high quality reporting
A strong work ethic, self-motivation and progressive thinking, thriving on new challenges.
Ability to self-manage and prioritize workload across multiple projects.


(We want to make sure you're set up to succeed, and we view these as the critical skills you'll need to achieve great things at Corcentric!)

As we continue to grow our Advisory practice, we are looking for the right people to join us on our mission. If you are interested in being part of our team, we would like to communicate the following:


We are energized by challenges and the effort needed to solve them
We like working with people who are positive, adaptable and growth minded
We prioritize both the process and outcome of work, demonstrating a strong commitment to the success of our customers and colleagues. Exceptional quality work is an essential standard for us.
We operate within a voluntary work-from-home framework, yet we uphold the same level of accountability and responsibility as in a traditional office setting



About Us

Corcentric is a global provider of business spend management and revenue management software and services for mid-market and Fortune 1000 businesses. Corcentric delivers software, advisory services, and payments focused on reducing costs, optimizing working capital, and unlocking revenue.

We achieve success by exemplifying our core values in the way we work, communicate, and collaborate:


Do the Right Thing
Embrace + Drive Change
Be Empowered
Be Relentlessly Focused on the Customer



Benefits

At Corcentric, we know that the hard work of our employees is what drives the success of our organization. We care about who you are and what you value, both inside and outside of work.

Within our organization, you will have the opportunity to work with smart, collaborative team members and approachable leaders. Our down-to-earth, solutions-oriented culture means you'll have the opportunity to get hands-on with interesting work projects and be able to draw a short line from your contributions to business impacts. We prioritize professional development and encourage cross-functional promotional opportunities to enable you to reach your career goals. We have been in business for over 25 years and are thrilled to be actively growing and scaling our teams accordingly - it's an exciting environment and a great time to join.

We also recognize the importance of work-life balance and want to support your efforts to take care of your health and well-being and the health and well-being of those who depend upon you. In support of this, we are proud to offer a comprehensive benefits package to our full-time team members, including:


Generous annual paid time off program that increases with tenure
Nine paid holidays plus an annual personal holiday to recognize or celebrate an occasion that is important to you
An annual paid day off to volunteer for causes that are near and dear to you
Paid maternity, paternal/secondary caregiver, and adoptive parent leave
Company-paid life and disability insurance
401k program with a company match
Medical insurance plan options ranging from a traditional PPO to High Deductible Health Plan options that feature a company HSA contribution
Dental plan - including orthodontia coverage
Vision plan - including discount for LASIK surgery
All medical, dental, and vision insurance plans are available from the first of the month following your start date - no extended waiting period to be eligible!
A no-cost Employee Assistance Program - 24/7 access to confidential counseling services and a wide range of additional support and professional services


Our roles require routine use of standard office equipment, such as computers, keyboards, printers, phones, and filing cabinets. You may need to type, reach, and lift office materials of a reasonable weight. Travel may also be required based on job responsibilities and business needs.

Corcentric does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Key Responsibilities:

Collect, organize, and analyse large sets of data from various sources.
Develop and implement data analyses, data collection systems, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Interpret data, analyse results using statistical techniques, and provide ongoing reports.
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
Work closely with the ETL / DE team to ensure data integrity, quality and security.
Create visualizations and reports for requested projects.
Perform data mining and analyse data to identify opportunities for improvement.

Qualifications:

Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst.
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data flow, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc.), databases (SQL etc.), programming (ETL frameworks or Python).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting findings.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Prior experience of working with Finance data is good to have.

Title: Jr. Data Analyst
Description:
We are UMG, the Universal Music Group. We are the world’s leading music company. In everything we do, we are committed to artistry, innovation and entrepreneurship. We own and operate a broad array of businesses engaged in recorded music, music publishing, merchandising, and audiovisual content in more than 60 countries. We identify and develop recording artists and songwriters, and we produce, distribute and promote the most critically acclaimed and commercially successful music to delight and entertain fans around the world.

Universal Music Group Nashville (UMGN) is currently seeking an Junior Data Analyst. This position will work within the Data & Research Team to build practical and creative data engineering solutions to fulfill business requests. This role will work closely with the Dir, Data & Research to provide precise reporting and necessary business tools for Universal Music Group Nashville. The position requires a strong skill set in mining, testing, and analyzing data.

How We LEAD


Own the creation of key data sets that drive existing and future internal reporting tools within Universal Music Group Nashville (UMGN).
Provide practical and creative data engineering solutions on large sets of data.
Support the Data & Research Team on data initiatives, ensuring optimal data delivery for all projects.
Communicate data-driven insights and recommendations within the Data & Research Team.
Liaison with Corporate Data team to stay informed and up to date on latest data and analytic tools available internally and externally.
Other additional duties and responsibilities as needed.


How You'll CREATE


Coding experience with SQL or a similar product suite is required.
Experience extracting data from data lake is required.
A direct background and current position with a heavy use of data analytics.
A passion for data, especially for creating efficient and scalable models
Advanced user of Microsoft Office Suite with heavy Excel work required.
A rabid desire to acquire knowledge from anywhere, whether related parallel industries to highly unlikely sources, and apply it to our situation with constant trial and error.
A relaxed and confident approach to all business relationships internally and externally.
Familiarity with music industry consumption (music streaming partners) is a plus.


Bring Your VIBE


Ideally, 2 years of experience using databases and analytic tools to build business solutions
Undergraduate or technical degree with highly relevant background required.


Perks Playlist


Be part of an entrepreneurial, global organization that values authenticity, drive, creativity, relationships, and a competitive spirit
Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and FSA options, as well as:
100% coverage for out-patient mental health services
Wellbeing reimbursements for fitness classes, spa treatments, meal services, travel, and so much more (up to $720/year)
A lifetime fertility support allowance of $30,000 to plan participants
Student Loan Repayment Assistance and Tuition Reimbursement
100% immediately vested 401(k) match on the first 5% of your contribution on eligible compensation


Variety of ways to prioritize much-needed time away from work including:
Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) for exempt employees
3-weeks PTO for non-exempt employees
2-weeks paid Winter Break
10 Company Holidays (including Juneteenth and Wellbeing Day)
Summer Fridays (between Memorial Day and Labor Day)
Generous paid parental leave for every type of parent

Check out our full overview of benefits on the Perks Playlist page of the career site.

Disclaimer: This job description only provides an overview of job responsibilities that are subject to change.

The actual base salary offered depends on a variety of factors, which may include, as applicable, the qualifications of the individual applicant for the position, years of relevant experience, specific and unique skills, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, and the location in which the applicant lives and/or from which they will be performing the job. Foundational experience in business intelligence, data analytics, reporting and basic project management
Strong excel skills

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: North Metro Atlanta area (Hybrid)

Reports to: Chief Investment Officer

OVERVIEW:

Flock Financial, LLC is seeking a dynamic Data Analyst to join our analytics and acquisitions teams. This role is pivotal in enhancing efficiency and communication in financing our clients. Through in-house mentoring and hands-on experience, you will develop expertise in underwriting and data analysis within the alternative financing space.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Underwriting & Analytics:

Gain a comprehensive understanding of underwriting in alternative financing through in-house mentoring.
Cleanse and standardize data files to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Evaluate inbound portfolio data, creating detailed account breakdowns using Flock’s proprietary tools.
Analyze data files using statistical tools to create visual representations (tables, histograms, choropleths, box-and-whisker plots).

Financial Analysis:

Navigate and understand financial waterfalls that support deal preparation and performance tracking.
Prepare preliminary cash flow and cost waterfalls for new investments, including scenario analysis at various performance levels.
Upload and manage incoming data within our database system.
Maintain links between Estimated Remaining Net Collections (ERNC) and supporting waterfalls.

Reporting & Compliance:

Support the Accounting and Finance department in preparing and distributing Quarterly
Investor Reports and Annual Reports.
Assist with data extraction for audits, field exams, and compliance reviews.
Develop, maintain, and update Power BI dashboards for senior management and clients.
Identify and investigate data and performance anomalies to enhance investment performance.

Client Data Management:

Utilize in-house AI/ML tools to identify areas for client performance optimization.
Conduct initial reviews of incoming client data files for accuracy and completeness.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Proficiency in Microsoft Office, in particular advanced Excel skills.
Proficiency in statistical analysis and data visualization tools.
Strong understanding of financial concepts and performance metrics.
Experience with database management and data extraction.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a hybrid work environment.
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
Familiarity with PowerBI and AI/ML tools is a plus.

BENEFITS:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
Collaborative and supportive work environment.

RELOCATION ASSISTANCE NOT AVAILABLE

Join Flock Financial, LLC and be part of a team that drives innovation and excellence in alternative

financing. Apply today to make a significant impact on our clients and our company’s success.

Show more

  • Investor Reports and Annual Reports.
  • Assist with data extraction for audits, field exams, and compliance reviews.
  • Develop, maintain, and update Power BI dashboards for senior management and clients.
  • Identify and investigate data and performance anomalies to enhance investment performance.

Client Data Management:

  • Utilize in-house AI/ML tools to identify areas for client performance optimization.
  • Conduct initial reviews of incoming client data files for accuracy and completeness.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office, in particular advanced Excel skills.
  • Proficiency in statistical analysis and data visualization tools.
  • Strong understanding of financial concepts and performance metrics.
  • Experience with database management and data extraction.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a hybrid work environment.
  • Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
  • Familiarity with PowerBI and AI/ML tools is a plus.

BENEFITS:

  • Competitive salary and benefits package.
  • Opportunities for professional growth and development.
  • Collaborative and supportive work environment.

RELOCATION ASSISTANCE NOT AVAILABLE

Join Flock Financial, LLC and be part of a team that drives innovation and excellence in alternative

financing. Apply today to make a significant impact on our clients and our company’s success.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Como nuestro próximo Data Analyst desempeñarás un papel crucial dentro del equipo de Content Strategy and Analysis, contribuyendo a la generación de insights que guiarán las decisiones estratégicas de la empresa. Esta posición es fundamental para analizar las tendencias de la industria musical y el performance de nuestros artistas en las diversas plataformas digitales.

 

Principales responsabilidades:




Análisis de datos para extraer insights que respalden decisiones estratégicas.
Identificar tendencias emergentes y oportunidades de crecimiento dentro del repertorio musical de Sony Music.
Monitorear y analizar el desempeño de nuestros artistas en plataformas digitales como Spotify, TikTok, Apple Music, Amazon Music, YouTube, etc.
Evaluar la efectividad de las campañas de marketing digital, integrando métricas de publicidad con patrones de consumo.
Desarrollar presentaciones y visualizaciones impactantes para comunicar insights complejos de manera efectiva y comprensible.
Comunicarse estrechamente con los equipos de Marketing y A&R en la recopilación y aplicación de insights.




Requisitos:

Título universitario en Ingeniería Industrial, Ciencia de Datos, Análisis de Negocios, un campo relacionado, o experiencia práctica equivalente.
Experiencia mínima de uno a dos años en análisis de datos.
Inglés avanzado

(Indispensable)

Dominio avanzado de Microsoft Excel
Buen dominio de SQL
Lenguaje de programación: Python
Herramientas de visualización de datos como Tableau, Power BI
Microsoft Office: PowerPoint avanzado




Cualidades:

Pasión profunda por la música
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación verbal y escrita
Capacidad para comunicar ideas técnicas a audiencias no técnicas
Proactividad y trabajo en equipo
Fuertes habilidades analíticas y de resolución de problemas.
Sólida capacidad de visualización de datos.
Curioso y automotivado.




Ofrecemos:

Contrato directo con Sony Music México
Salario competitivo y paquete de beneficios atractivo
Prestaciones superiores de ley (Fondo de ahorro, vales de despensa, Gastos médicos mayores, Seguro de vida, Bono de productividad)




¡Únete a nosotros y conviértete en parte de un equipo innovador!

Title: Consumer Insights Analyst
Description:
In order to be considered for this role, after clicking "Apply Now" above and being redirected, you must fully complete the application process on the follow-up screen.

If you are interested in sports jobs with the New Orleans Saints and Pelicans, you’re in the right place!

Who We Are

The mission of the New Orleans Saints and New Orleans Pelicans is to be #1 in everything we do and to be a global brand to all of our fans. We take pride in the growth and success of the entire Gulf Coast region and are committed to leveraging our resources and goodwill to foster meaningful change for the greater good of society and our community. We celebrate individuality and value all identities and experiences, and value the perspectives of our team members. Our team members are integral to our success, and we stand beside them through success and hardship. We make it a priority to make all team members feel included and their opinions be heard. Together, we win!

Who You Are

You want to be part of a team that values community, integrity, excellence, and an organization where people come first and are celebrated. You love the industry of sports, and are excited by the potential of working for two major leagues, the NFL and the NBA. You understand and appreciate that New Orleans is a unique city with so much to offer, and you want to be a part of the vibrant community that wants to see it’s teams be the best. You are passionate, driven, and ready to work hard and have fun.

Position Summary

The Saints and Pelicans’ Consumer Insights department is looking for a talented analyst who is passionate about designing, crafting, and operating automated analytical solutions that will drive scientific data-driven decision making and have direct and measurable positive impact to both the New Orleans Saints and the New Orleans Pelicans, as well as other Benson Businesses and their customers.

As a Consumer Insights Analyst, you will play an important role in the Business Intelligence function and support Ticket Sales, Marketing, Digital Media, Corporate Partnerships, and other related departments and business units. This position will take the lead in providing key metrics, insights and recommendations for pricing analytics and forecasting as well as be responsible for specific reports and dashboards to be distributed across departments and senior executives.

As a key member of the team, you will own and manage projects, use advanced and evolving methods to solve business problems, and meet business leaders across the company to deliver actionable insights and tangible business value.

What You Will Be Doing

Specific duties include, but are not limited to:


Build and maintain reports and dashboards to measure, monitor and analyze demand, supply, elasticities, and other metrics
Assist with pricing analytics, revenue forecasting, and competition analysis in the market
Work closely across the Consumer Insights department to acquire and integrate data from various businesses and data sources
Analyze local and regional market data from Bloomberg, Moody’s Analytics, Census, Bureau of Labor Statistics, Nielsen, and YouGov to forecast demand and assess pricing trends for various products
Build and maintain reports, dashboards, and data visualizations that are focused on local and regional trends
Support the analysis of digital/social content assets, pricing strategies, and customer / fan behaviors across digital channels
Design and build datasets and statistical models for pricing analytics, revenue projections, etc.
Build reports and dashboards to monitor and analyze data warehouse performance to provide insight to front-end users
Build reports and dashboards to monitor and analyze the quality of data in the data warehouse to support sales and marketing campaigns
Support ETL projects that integrate various data sources into the data warehouse
Document and build visuals of conceptual architecture for each database in the data warehouse
Other projects and duties as assigned


What You’ll Bring


Bachelor’s degree in in Economics, Business Analytics, or a related field
Proven data analytics experience is required
Highly analytical person with strong problem-solving skills
Exceptional attention to detail
Knowledge and experience with Microeconomics concepts and strategies, and experience with pricing and forecasting analytics
Minimum 2 years’ experience with SQL and PowerBI
Proven strong Mathematics capabilities
Strong communication and organization skills required
Highly self-motivated individual with excellent teamwork


Preferred Qualifications


Project management experience is a plus
Advanced Excel skills is a plus
Advanced PowerBI, SQL and Python experience is a plus
Statistical Analysis and Modeling experience is a plus
Experience within the sports industry is not required, but is a plus


Working Conditions


Typical office environment
Working schedule/hours will ebb and flow with NFL/NBA schedule, and will include working some late hours, holidays, nights, and weekends


What We Offer


Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance options
401K with employer contributions
Paid parental leave
PTO and paid holidays
Wellness Program


Applications must be submitted online. Please do not mail or email resumes to the Saints/Pelicans. All qualified candidates will be contacted by phone and/or by email. Please do not contact the Saints/Pelicans Human Resources or Hiring Manager to check the status of your application. When applying, please be sure your updated contact information is provided.

The New Orleans Saints and New Orleans Pelicans ("Teams") are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for candidates and employees regardless of their membership in any protected classifications. The Teams will not discriminate in violation of the law on the basis of race, color, age, national origin, sex (including sexual orientation, gender identity, transgender status, and pregnancy), religion, physical or mental disability, genetic information, marital status, veteran status, familial status, status as a victim of domestic violence, and/or any other legally protected class under applicable federal, state, or local laws. This anti-discrimination policy applies with respect to all employment decisions, including but not limited to hiring, promotion, discipline, and discharge. The Teams are committed to equal opportunity for persons with disabilities in compliance with the Americans Disabilities Act and state law. If you feel you need an accommodation for a disability, please inform us. Requests for accommodation will be evaluated on a case-by-case basis. If you request an accommodation, it is essential that you participate fully in the interactive process.

  • Paid parental leave
  • PTO and paid holidays

Title: Excel Data Analyst
Description:
Duration: 6+ months

Compensation: up to $35-45/hr (W2 only!)

Location: 5 days/week in Brooklyn, NY


U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time. ***


Responsibilities/Requirements


Must be the Excel SME where you will be primarily responsible for running analytics on a large scale inventory management project.
Must be very well versed on Excel macros and formulas and how to manage large files with multiple data points.
Should have some SharePoint experience.
Excellent communication and organization skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Ability to work standard business hours, on-site, 5 days per week.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Overview

PCI requires support in data analytics and visualization supporting a large and dynamic Federal procurement organization.

We are looking for a Data Analyst who can support and meet the qualifications below.

Responsibilities

Obtains data through advanced computerized models using a variety of software, including Tableau, PowerBI and Excel.
Extrapolates data patterns through advanced algorithms.
Develops graphs and charts to explain how mathematical information will influence the specific project or business.
Develops, maintains, innovates, and enhances workload tracking visualizations and make recommendations based on industry best practices how to display procurement workload and resource management data to guide the process for assigning working, managing work, managing workload, and identifying risk early on.
Develops and maintains an executive landing page where dashboards for leadership.
Develops dashboards focused on business processes and management levels to guide leadership at all levels in making data driven decisions;
Defines, develops, and documents future measurement framework reporting/visualization;
Defines, develops, and maintains governance plan for maintaining dashboards
Develops and implements a business process for receiving, evaluating, developing, tracking, and maintaining report requests to support reporting needs.
Streamlines activities to maximize efficiencies and reporting.
Develops and maintains a data catalog of available automation, reports, and dashboards to guide transparency and improve customer experience.
Presents to managers how to best alter their business models to generate profitable future trends.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree from an accredited school.
At least (8) years of experience on contracts of similar size or scope with experience in Federal acquisition and contract management.
Must have experience with Excel, Tableau, M365 Power Apps, PowerBi Power Automate, and all elements of Power Platform expertise in utilizing and developing work products that aid in data-driven decision-making.
Proven ability to solve problems creatively.
Strong familiarity with software tools, methodologies, and best practices.
Excellent analytical skills.




PCI Federal Services (PCIFS) and it's subsidiaries is an equal-opportunity employer. PCIFS does not discriminate on the basis of age, sex, race, national origin, religion, marital status, sexual orientation or identity, Veterans or Disability status.

Preference may be extended to qualified Native American Indian candidates

in accordance with applicable federal law.

Title: Data Analyst - Digital - New York
Description:
Description
Key Activities:


Independently conduct analysis in SQL & Tableau, sharing results and collaborating with clients, Efficio’s client facing teams, and Efficio’s technical experts
In addition to execution, proactively look for ways to build on the product. Some key skills we expect you to master are: streamlining the process (reducing time to delivery), increasing generalizability (via robust modular coding & design practices), and improving usability for our clients.
Present confidently to both internal and client teams about the analysis in a way that is persuasive to people of varying seniority and technical skill level. Develop knowledge and expertise in your focus area so you can become a trusted adviser to our clients.


Essential Requirements - Exemplary academic background in STEM or demonstrated excellence in analytics via independent project work


Proficiency in at least one of: Python, SQL, Matlab, R, or Java as demonstrated through coursework or independent work. This role will mainly be working with Python and SQL, however any proficiency in the other 3 languages will be acceptable as long as you are willing to learn
Expert in research, problem-solving, communication, & analysis
Record of leadership


Desirable Requirements - Strong visual & oral communicator with experience independently leading presentations on complex analytical topics


1+ Years in Python, SQL
Solid academic background in or independent understanding of fundamental programming concepts
Experience working in a high pressure environment


Please note applications for this role will close on 8th August 2024.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Spot Pet Insurance is the fastest growing pet insurance company in North America. Our commitment to an exceptional end-to-end customer experience and our data-driven approach have quickly established us as a leading pet insurance provider. We're dedicated to providing pet parents with peace of mind by offering accessible and comprehensive coverage so their furry companions can lead happier, healthier lives. To demonstrate this, we recently joined forces with MrBeast to find homes for 100 homeless pets and committed to giving each of them pet insurance for life! Along the way, we’ve created a company culture that allows our employees to thrive, with perks like daily free meals, a pet-friendly office, and ridiculously fun company events every quarter. Our dedication to fostering a positive and rewarding work environment for our team has even earned us a Great Place to Work certification.

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our dynamic team! The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users. We are looking for someone who is high energy, willing to run through walls, and has a great ability to collaborate.


This job is in office only at our Downtown Miami Office. No remote work offered*


Responsibilities:


Work directly with management to help drive strategy and execute experiments to improve company efficiency across sales and marketing channels
Build full-cycle experiments, reports, dashboards that help the business achieve its goals and enable better decision-making
Capture our stakeholders' data needs and identify the primary output metrics that measure success. Regularly report on those metrics
Investigate new data sources and work on adding, automating, and updating data pipelines responsible for delivering data
Explore data correlations to refine the relationships between metrics
Align data handling practices with data privacy in mind
Build data governance with a single source of truth
Ensure data integrity and observability across all data


Technologies:


SQL Databases (Postgres, MySQL)
Data Studio and Tableau
Google Analytics
GCP
BigQuery
Segment CDP
Python Programming
R Studio


Nice to haves:


Experience in analytics & visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI
Experience with data engineering tools such as BigQuery
Experience with machine learning, advanced modeling, or market mix modeling
Experience with advanced statistics


Requirements


2-3 years working as a data analyst, business analyst, or data engineer
Strong experience using SQL to turn datasets into metrics
Experience with the ELT pattern
Experience in managing databases, including relational database architecture, query optimization, and database schema design
Empathy and creativity to understand and solve stakeholders' problems
Passion for data origins, integrity, accuracy, and storytelling


Benefits


The opportunity to work on challenging and impactful projects at the intersection of design and data
A collaborative and supportive work environment, recognized as a Great Place to Work
Cell phone allowance of $100
Benefit package
Dental, and visions benefits
Life insurance
Unlimited PTO
Bring your pet to work
Your pet insurance is covered (Up to $100)
401k with Company match
Annual performance-based bonus
Show more

  • The opportunity to work on challenging and impactful projects at the intersection of design and data
  • A collaborative and supportive work environment, recognized as a Great Place to Work
  • Cell phone allowance of $100
  • Benefit package
  • Dental, and visions benefits
  • Life insurance
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Bring your pet to work
  • Your pet insurance is covered (Up to $100)
  • 401k with Company match
  • Annual performance-based bonus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
eNGINE builds Technical Teams. We are a Solutions and Placement firm shaped by decades of interaction with Technical professionals. Our inspiration is continuous learning and engagement with the markets we serve, the talent we represent, and the teams we build. Our Consulting Workforce is encouraged to enjoy career fulfillment in the form of challenging projects, schedule flexibility, and paid training/certifications. Successful outcomes start and finish with eNGINE.




eNGINE is hiring a Data Reporting Analyst for a client of ours, in the pharmacy space, who will be responsible for assisting a massive reconstruction of a data warehouse. This person will be proficient in SQL, and has the ability to analyze, interpret, and clean data sets.




Job duties:

Develop, deploy, and maintain regular reports.
Define data needs for specific departments and contractual compliance in collaboration with the analytics team.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity verification.
Cleanse and mine data from various sources, ensuring integrity pre-deployment.
Deploy, test, and develop standard and custom reports and analytics for strategic and operational analysis to internal and/or external users.
Interpret, identify, and analyze trends in data sets.




What we're looking for:

2+ years of SQL experience
2+ years of Azure Data Factory and/or Databricks
Ability to analyze massive data sets.
Preferred experience in speciality pharmaceuticals and/or healthcare




No C2C. Reach out to me for more details!

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary:

We are looking for a driven, early career individual, with a passion for analytics and innovation to join us in turning the largest cardiovascular database in the US into meaningful and impactful insights. As an Associate Data Analyst, your success will be measured by the quality and actionable nature of our analytics deliverables to hospital customers. Your contributions will have the ability to save real patients’ lives and propel egnite to the next state of evolution.




The ideal candidate has at least 2 years of experience in an analytics role, has an eye for detail, and a quantitative and creative mindset. This individual will bring strong communication, strong work ethic, and team-player attitude to help tackle any task, executing on the nuts and bolts of our ‘get it done’ culture. The candidate should know SQL and be prepared to rapidly acquire new analytical and technical skills on the job including Kaplan Meir analysis and data manipulation using python in a big data environment (Databricks).




Duties and Responsibilities:




Strategic thinking to generate impactful insights that benefit patients and hospitals
Development of new analyses using python and SQL and presenting those results internally via PowerPoint Presentation
Clear communication of data to our customer reporting team, ensuring they're equipped with the necessary detail to support groundbreaking insights in customer meetings
Analyze large data sets to identify trends and patterns
Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
Stay up-to-date with new data analysis techniques and tools
Assist in data cleaning, preprocessing, and data wrangling
Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify key variables and insights




This role requires privileged access controls for critical systems or data, ensuring that only authorized employees have access to sensitive information to help prevent data breaches and unauthorized access to sensitive information.




Education and experience:

A bachelor’s degree in a business or quantitative field – Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Biology, Finance, or related field.
At least 2 years of experience in a data analytics role
Experience with SQL and databases required
A talent for data driven story-telling and executive message development
PowerBi, Databricks, pyspark, and/or R, preferred
A passion for making a difference in the world – in our case, helping patients
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Natural curiosity, eagerness to learning, and willing to self-study to gain expertise in cardiovascular clinical and hospital administration topics
Team player excited by the prospect of shared successes in collaboration with our clinical client success team and hospital customers
Strong attention to detail and organization skills
Comfortable with statistical concepts
Location flexibility within the United States, with occasional travel (up to 5%) to our headquarters in Orange County or to support customer presentations
Work authorization in the United States




egnite is a rapidly growing digital healthcare company dedicated to improving care for heart disease patients. Our vision is to create an evolved healthcare landscape in which data, technology, patients, and clinical expertise are at the intersection of healthcare transformation - simply put, we want to improve the care for every heart patient across the US.




At egnite, we take security seriously, and it plays a role in all jobs within our organization. We believe that every employee has a responsibility to help maintain a secure and safe work environment, protect our company’s assets and reputation, and safeguard our customers’ data and privacy. Therefore, all employees are expected to comply with our security policies and procedures, and to report any security incidents or concerns promptly.




Please note that some positions may require additional security clearances or certifications, depending on the nature of the job and the level of access to sensitive information. If such requirements exist, they will be clearly stated in the job description, and all applicants will be expected to meet these requirements as a condition of employment.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Supply Chain Data Expert







Work with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven strategies and measure their effectiveness.
Conduct detailed data analysis on various aspects of the supply chain including procurement, logistics, inventory management, and distribution strategies.
Translate complex data findings into understandable, actionable conceptual data products for supply chain optimization.
Work with Data team to Develop, refine, and maintain data models and simulations for demand forecasting and supply planning.
Conduct detailed data analysis on various aspects of the supply chain including procurement, logistics, inventory management, and distribution strategies, translating complex findings into actionable insights.
Collaborate with a team of Business Intelligence Analysts to design and standardize executive dashboards, ensuring continuous delivery of real-time insights into supply chain metrics and performance indicators.
Work closely with the Data Engineering team to formalize data into enterprise models, optimizing data flow and accessibility for efficient downstream consumption.
Engage with business stakeholders to align the data warehouse with strategic goals, understanding their needs and ensuring the analytics infrastructure addresses relevant business questions.
Prepare and present reports to management on supply chain performance metrics and identify opportunities for improvement.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your work days are brighter here.

At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.

About The Team

***APPLICANTS RESIDING OUTSIDE OF THE ATLANTA METRO OR SAN FRANCISCO BAY AREA WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED AT THIS TIME***

Join our team and experience Workday!

It's fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they're doing. At Workday, we're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business of enterprise applications. We work hard, and we're serious about what we do. But we like to have a good time, too. In fact, we run our company with that principle in mind every day: One of our core values is fun.

About Analytics At Workday

The Analytics Platform at Workday offers substantial benefits through advanced tools such as Core Reporting, Prism Analytics, Accounting Center, and People Analytics. These tools enable seamless integration, transformation, and analysis of data from diverse sources, ensuring accurate and insightful reporting. By using robust financial and people analytics capabilities, organizations can enhance operational efficiency, ensure compliance with regulations, and gain real-time insights into essential business metrics. This data-driven approach supports informed decision-making and drives critical initiatives, ultimately optimizing business performance and fostering innovation across the organization.

About The Role

Job Description

Workday is seeking an Analytics Analyst to join our Report Performance and Analytics organization, focusing on optimizing configurations, fixing performance issues, and refining customer designs for reports and integrations. We need a candidate passionate about driving performance improvements through meticulous analysis of log and application data. Your role ensures our Prism Analytics, integrated with other Workday analytics applications, delivers robust data insights for confident decision-making and accurate financial reporting. Your expertise in business intelligence, along with good communication and customer handling skills, will be essential for enhancing customer success and overall experience. Join us in shaping impactful data-driven strategies at Workday.

Key Areas of Responsibility:


Develop technical expertise in various Workday technologies, such as the reporting and analytics framework.
Solve issues in customer environments, analyze logs, investigate root causes, and collaborate with colleagues to address bugs.
Provide dedicated support to key accounts for both new and legacy Workday data analytics and reporting products.
Implement performance methodologies to resolve inefficiencies in reports, integrations, and custom configurations.
Collaborate with clients to define technical requirements, translate business needs into efficient reports and configurations, and ensure alignment to standard processes.
Track and prioritize performance improvement opportunities across Support, Operations, Product Management, and Development teams.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends and patterns.
Identify process gaps and collaborate with multi-functional teams to enhance system performance and reliability.
Understand sophisticated analytics use cases, assist customers in issue identification, provide workarounds, and collaborate internally for swift resolution.
Gain deep insights into customer use cases to deliver experienced solutions and support as required.


About You

Basic Qualifications:


2+ years of experience providing enterprise-level support in data analysis, system performance, or related roles
2+ years experience with Financial Reporting
Familiarity with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop ecosystems (HDFS, MapReduce, Hive, Spark)
Intermediate to advanced ability to read and write SQL queries
Ability to communicate data in actionable formats for various audiences, including functional end-users and executive collaborators.


Other Qualifications:


Excellent analytical skills with a proven ability to collect, organize, and analyze large volumes of data to drive product improvement initiatives.
Exceptional interpersonal skills for managing and raising customer escalations.
Effective teamwork skills, both verbal and written, with a track record of working across teams to resolve issues efficiently.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or Mathematics


Workday Pay Transparency Statement

The annualized base salary ranges for the primary location and any additional locations are listed below. Workday pay ranges vary based on work location. As a part of the total compensation package, this role may be eligible for the Workday Bonus Plan or a role-specific commission/bonus, as well as annual refresh stock grants. Recruiters can share more detail during the hiring process. Each candidate’s compensation offer will be based on multiple factors including, but not limited to, geography, experience, skills, job duties, and business need, among other things. For more information regarding Workday’s comprehensive benefits, please click here.

Primary Location: USA.CA.Pleasanton

Primary Location Base Pay Range: $114,700 USD - $172,100 USD

Additional US Location(s) Base Pay Range: $97,400 USD - $172,100 USD

Our Approach to Flexible Work

With Flex Work, we’re combining the best of both worlds: in-person time and remote. Our approach enables our teams to deepen connections, maintain a strong community, and do their best work. We know that flexibility can take shape in many ways, so rather than a number of required days in-office each week, we simply spend at least half (50%) of our time each quarter in the office or in the field with our customers, prospects, and partners (depending on role). This means you'll have the freedom to create a flexible schedule that caters to your business, team, and personal needs, while being intentional to make the most of time spent together. Those in our remote "home office" roles also have the opportunity to come together in our offices for important moments that matter.

Pursuant to applicable Fair Chance law, Workday will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Workday is an Equal Opportunity Employer including individuals with disabilities and protected veterans.

Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process!

,

Title: Predictive Data Analyst
Description:
Position Description

The Predictive Data Analyst will support stakeholders by defining data needs and ensuring data science projects meet business objectives across various levels. The role involves using statistical programming languages and tools for data manipulation, analysis, and visualization, including end-to-end predictive modeling from exploratory analysis to deployment and results interpretation.

Key Tasks


Managing data through querying, cleaning, merging, quality control, regular reporting, special project deliverables, and documentation.
Collaboration with IT staff to develop data pipelines, design and maintain reports and dashboards, and work with program staff to ensure analyses lead to actionable insights for decision-making and program improvement.
Strong background in predictive analytics and tool development is essential.
Customer experience working directly with a client-centric relational database and managing individuals.
Strong technical knowledge and comfortable doing analyses and building reports from an SQL database.
The analyst should be comfortable with various analytical tools and have taken the lead on projects where the best path forward is unclear. Customer service mindset.


Experience Required


4 years of experience with responsibility for planning, designing, conducting, and evaluating research projects involving the application of techniques of machine learning, predictive analytics, data management, and hypothesis-driven data analysis to complex experimental designs, leading to actionable findings and recommendations.


Education Required

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in a field of applied research such as Data Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Statistics, Business Analytics, Psychology, or Public Health that includes 12 semester or 18 quarter units of coursework in data science, predictive analytics, quantitative research methods, or statistical analysis.

Trinus Corporation, a leading provider of technology solutions and services with over 25 years of experience, is a certified WBE/MBE/SBE/SDB firm accredited by WBENC, NMSDC, and SBA.

Our mission is to shape the future of work by aligning the right mix of people, process, technology, and innovation to efficiently meet our clients' business objectives.

At Trinus, we understand that finding the right opportunity is pivotal in your career journey. Our staffing services go beyond mere placements; they are about matching your skills and aspirations with the perfect fit.

To learn more about us, please visit our website www.trinus.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Duluth, GA (preferred) or Atlanta, GA (windy hill road area)

Employment Type: 6-12 Contract (3 days per week in-office)




About the Role:

We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our customer intelligence team. This role is crucial for centralizing and managing customer data from independently owned, each with its own customer accounts. Your analysis will help shape a cohesive customer journey and enhance our digital marketing strategies.




Responsibilities:

Centralize and manage customer data from various stores.
Analyze and understand customer data to identify completeness, opportunities, and potential merges.
Work with five teams focused on customer data to ensure a unified customer understanding.
Perform complex SQL queries using Google BigQuery.
Create dashboards and reports using Power BI to support product teams.
Collaborate with product personnel to understand and fulfill data requirements.




Qualifications:

Proficient in Google BigQuery.
Advanced SQL skills are a must.
Experience with Power BI for dashboard creation desired
Strong analytical skills to understand and interpret complex data sets.
Ability to collaborate with multiple teams and support other customer domain teams.




If you are a data analyst with a knack for handling complex customer data and providing insightful analysis, we would love to hear from you!




The hourly pay rate range for this position is $50 to $65 / hour (dependent on factors including but not limited to client requirements, experience, statutory considerations, and location). Benefits available to full-time employees: medical, dental, vision, disability, life insurance, 401k and commuter benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by the Equal Pay for Equal Work Act (CO), NYC Pay Transparency Law, and sb5761 (WA)




Synergis is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, national origin, religion, age, gender, gender identity, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, military/veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law.




For immediate consideration, please forward your resume to christy.cifreo@synergishr.com




If you require assistance or an accommodation in the application or employment process, please contact us at christy.cifreo@synergishr.com




Synergis is a workforce solutions partner serving thousands of businesses and job seekers nationwide. Our digital world has accelerated the need for businesses to build IT ecosystems that enable growth and innovation along with enhancing the Total Experience (TX). Synergis partners with our clients at the intersection of talent and transformation to scale their balanced teams of tech, digital and creative professionals. Learn more about Synergis at www.synergishr.com.

Benefits available to full-time employees: medical, dental, vision, disability, life insurance, 401k and commuter benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by the Equal Pay for Equal Work Act (CO), NYC Pay Transparency Law, and sb5761 (WA)


Synergis is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, national origin, religion, age, gender, gender identity, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, military/veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law.


For immediate consideration, please forward your resume to christy.cifreo@synergishr.com


If you require assistance or an accommodation in the application or employment process, please contact us at christy.cifreo@synergishr.com


Synergis is a workforce solutions partner serving thousands of businesses and job seekers nationwide. Our digital world has accelerated the need for businesses to build IT ecosystems that enable growth and innovation along with enhancing the Total Experience (TX). Synergis partners with our clients at the intersection of talent and transformation to scale their balanced teams of tech, digital and creative professionals. Learn more about Synergis at www.synergishr.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Required Skills & Experience




- Bachelor's Degree in related field

- 1-3+ years of experience within Data Analysis

- Intermediate Excel Skills (Pivot Tables, Vlookups, Conditional Formatting)

- Experience identifying discrepancies in data, quality control management, and effective communication skills to stakeholders




Nice to Have Skills & Experience




- Any regulatory, emissions, energy background




Job Description




A large oil & gas company sitting in Downtown Los Angeles is looking to hire a hybrid Data Analyst reporting into the office (3) days a week. This person will be supporting the Emissions Strategy team. The team is looking for someone to identify accuracy of emissions data and handle discrepancies. This will require an understanding of heavy amount of data sets and previous utility or regulatory experience. This position is paying between ($25-45/hr) Monday - Friday 40 hours.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
En Viva estamos buscando personas apasionadas por lo que hacen y estamos seguros de que este es el mejor momento para sumarte a nuestro equipo. Viva Aerobus es la aerolínea de más bajo costo, preferida, divertida y rentable en las Américas, con la flota más joven de Latinoamérica y de mayor crecimiento en el mundo. Tenemos una cultura de inclusión, pasión y transparencia, rompemos con lo tradicional, replanteando la forma de trabajar y estamos comprometidos con la excelencia en nuestro servicio y la seguridad de nuestros pasajeros.




¡Únete a la #GenteViva y juntos volemos cada vez más alto!




Se parte de nuestro equipo como Data Analyst




Como Data Analyst serás responsable de extraer, analizar e interpretar datos utilizando técnicas estadísticas y herramientas de programación, desarrollo y explotación de bases de datos. Automatización de reportes mediante procesos de extracción, limpieza, transformación, carga y visualización de datos.




Funciones principales:

Análisis de datos con herramientas de programación y explotación de datos para reportar e interpretar datos e información a diversas áreas de la empresa
Visualización de datos uso de programas como Tableau, Looker, etc. para representar información de manera visual
Extracción, Limpieza y carga de datos mediante SQL, herramientas de programación, flujos de trabajo, etc. para el análisis
Automatización de procesos, mediante Programación y configuración de flujos de trabajo para automatizar reportes, envíos y transferencias de información
Desarrollo de modelos de data science, utilizando las técnicas de análisis y algoritmos correspondientes para identificar patrones, tendencias y anomalías en los datos para guiar análisis más profundos




Conocimientos o habilidades requeridas:

Conocimiento de Python / R
Manejo de SQL
Capacidad para diseñar y construir dashboards en Tableau
Competencia en interpretar y analizar grandes conjuntos de datos.
Deseable conocimientos en Google Analytics
Inglés Avanzado Indispensable







Beneficios que disfrutarás como #GenteViva

Horario Flexible / Home Office / Esquema hibrido.
Increíble ambiente de trabajo #ElMejorLugarParatrabajar.
Días ilimitados de vacaciones desde el 1er día.
Fondo de ahorro y caja de ahorro.
30 días de aguinaldo.
Staff Travel: Vuelos a cualquier destino Viva con precios inimaginables para ti y 12 de tus seres queridos.
MyIDTravel: Alianza con más de 20 aerolíneas para que puedas volar a un precio preferencial a destinos alrededor del mundo.
Seguro de gastos médicos mayores, Seguro de vida, Asistencia médica familiar en línea 24/7.
Serie de convenios que mejoran tu vida: Gimnasios, tiendas departamentales, restaurantes, universidades y muchas más.
Prestaciones superiores a las de la ley.




Acerca de Viva Aerobus:

Somos la aerolínea con el costo más bajo, con una de las flotas de aviones más moderna en Latinoamérica y la 1 en México, siendo de las aerolíneas con mayor crecimiento en el mundo.

En Viva Aerobus reconocemos que nuestro talento es diverso; respetamos las condiciones de vida de cada persona y promovemos la equidad de género y de oportunidades. Somos un gran equipo, fomentamos la innovación, colaboración y construimos un ambiente de respeto e inclusión que nos permite ser nosotros mismos.

Nos preocupamos por el bienestar de nuestra gente, cuidamos cada detalle para tener colaboradores siempre sanos, seguros y felices.

¡Súmate a este vuelo y tracemos juntos tu nuevo destino!
