Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Overview

Location: Must live 90 miles from Plano, TX PepsiCo Office Location. Role is hybrid with 2-3 days in office per week expected.

PepsiCo operates in an environment undergoing immense and rapid change. Big-data and digital technologies are driving business transformation that is unlocking new capabilities and business innovations in areas like eCommerce, mobile experiences and IoT. The key to winning in these areas is being able to leverage enterprise data foundations built on PepsiCo’s global business scale to enable business insights, advanced analytics and new product development. PepsiCo’s Data Management and Operations team is tasked with the responsibility of developing quality data collection processes, maintaining the integrity of our data foundations and enabling business leaders and data scientists across the company to have rapid access to the data they need for decision-making and innovation.

What PepsiCo Data Management and Operations does:


Maintain a predictable, transparent, global operating rhythm that ensures always-on access to high-quality data for stakeholders across the company
Responsible for day-to-day data collection, transportation, maintenance/curation and access to the PepsiCo corporate data asset
Work cross-functionally across the enterprise to centralize data and standardize it for use by business, data science or other stakeholders
Increase awareness about available data and democratize access to it across the company.


Job Description

As a member of the data engineering team, you will be the key domain expert overseeing PepsiCo's business process and drive a strong discussion for how Supply Chain, Financial, Consumer, Channel, Category business needs to be defined and prioritize by working very closely with business leads, data science team and data engineering team. You'll develop an in-depth understanding of business processes in and translate business requirements to data engineering team in technical way.

Responsibilities


Discover, analyze, and scope data requirements & representing them in conceptual and logical data models
Gather and analyze data pertaining to various business processes such as forecasts, capital requirements, inventory, logistic, manufacturing and production capacity to develop supply chain models. geographics, POS, pricing and promotion, store profile, e-commerce data to develop channel models.
Create high-level process models (system interface diagrams, workflow & swim lane diagrams, data flow diagrams) to represent processes for the area under analysis
Empower the business by creating value through the increased adoption of data, data science and business intelligence landscape.
Responsible to improve the quality of data in relation to defined expectations
Perform analysis of system data to identify patterns, exceptions, and erroneous data.


Compensation & Benefits:


The expected compensation range for this position is between $100,000 - $167,500 based on a full-time schedule.
Location, confirmed job-related skills and experience will be considered in setting actual starting salary.
Bonus based on performance and eligibility; target payout is 8% of annual salary paid out annually.
Paid time off subject to eligibility, including paid parental leave, vacation, sick, and bereavement.
In addition to salary, PepsiCo offers a comprehensive benefits package to support our employees and their families, subject to elections and eligibility: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Health and Dependent Care Reimbursement Accounts, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Insurance (Accident, Group Legal, Life), Defined Contribution Retirement Plan.


Qualifications


4+ years of experience with data analysis & data profiling in project, business requirements definition or data engineering in CPG or Manufacturing Industry. Profiling experience in SQL; python/pyspark is a plus
3+ years’ work experience in the areas of Demand Planning, Supply Planning, Integrated Business Planning (IBP), Distribution Network Analysis, Manufacturing, Production Network Optimization, Transportation, or other areas related to Supply Chain. Have working experience with Master Data (Procudt,Customer,Location etc).
2+ years of strong Data Profiling experience & ability to identify trends and anomalies in the data to inform data model build out.
Familiarity with SAP, SAP IBP, and/or O9 is a plus
Experience in working with Datasets from POS Aggregators such as IRI, Nielsen, Kantar etc. is a plus
Experience working with structured/unstructured datasets, ability to clearly document and communicate requirement to technical team members.
Experience with Business Intelligence tools, SQLTools.


Education


Bachelor’s Degree Required, Supply Chain and/or Operations Management focus is a plus, Masters Preferred.


EEO Statement

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

PepsiCo is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Female / Minority / Disability / Protected Veteran / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity

If you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please download the available EEO is the Law & EEO is the Law Supplement documents. View PepsiCo EEO Policy.

Please view our Pay Transparency Statement

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Mark Cuban Cost Plus Drug Company, PBC
Description:
As a Data Analyst, you will be a key contributor to our mission of making affordable medications accessible to everyone. You will use your analytical skills and expertise to uncover valuable insights from complex datasets. These insights will directly guide our strategies, help us measure the impact of our initiatives, and ultimately improve patient affordability. This role is ideal for someone with a strong analytical mindset, technical skills, and the ability to translate complex data into clear recommendations.




DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Data Cleaning and Preparation:

Collect, clean, and organize data from diverse sources.
Ensure data accuracy and completeness through validation.
Learn and apply data cleaning techniques to prepare data for analysis.




Data Analysis and Insights:

Assist in conducting analyses to identify trends, patterns, and key insights.
Support the creation of reports, dashboards, and visualizations that effectively communicate findings.
Translate complex data findings into actionable recommendations for stakeholders.




Data Quality:

Help identify and resolve data quality issues and discrepancies.
Learn about data quality standards and best practices in the healthcare industry.




Cross-Functional Collaboration:

Partner with various business units to support their data needs, including ad-hoc analysis and report generation.
Adapt your approach to meet the specific requirements of different teams.




Continuous Learning and Growth:

Actively participate in User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and System Testing to ensure data accuracy and system functionality.
Embrace opportunities to learn new skills and tools as our data landscape evolves.




EDUCATION AND/OR TRAINING:

Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.




WORK EXPERIENCE:

2+ years of experience in data analysis (healthcare or pharmaceutical experience is a plus).
Equivalent combination of education and industry experience will be considered.
“Power user” of Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets
Demonstrated ability to conduct ad hoc analyses under tight deadlines
Familiarity with SQL and data manipulation tools (Python or R is preferred)




ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:

Ability to work independently with little to no supervision.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Passion for using data to answer questions and drive decisions
Meticulous attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Enthusiasm for our mission of affordable medication access

Title: Analyst-Data Analytics
Description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.

With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.

At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.

Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.

The ‘Commercial Data Quality & Data Products Analytics’ Team is part of the Analytics, Investments and Marketing Enablement (AIM) team within Global Commercial Services Marketing, American Express. AIM team is responsible for targeting, acquiring, engaging, and retaining commercial customers over online and offline channels and delivering world-class analytics, insights and data products for the Global Commercial Services (GCS) business. In this role, you will be challenged with enriching the quality of commercial data elements for usage in targeting and creating world class data products by leveraging machine learning and other advanced methodologies. The person will perform data analysis, strategy, synthesize conclusions, and present insights to drive business outcomes. The position is part of a highly collaborative environment, interacting with and influencing partners across Global Commercial Services.

Responsibilities:


Create and implement analytical solutions on enriching data quality for usage across analytics and targeting.
Create innovative data products encompassing commercial prospect and customer targeting use-cases, to drive profitable acquisition and engagement strategy (few examples of data products include - Product/Channel Propensity, Best Time to Call or Lead Quality Index (LQI), identifying commercial expense categories etc.)
Work with external data vendors to evaluate external data for small businesses incl. signals, inflection points and establish the proof of concept on investing in purchasing the data to improve/enrich commercial targeting.
Collaborate with Decision Science and Capabilities teams to build analytical solutions to improve coverage & accuracy of key data elements which are critical inputs into models and marketing/Sales campaigns.


Minimum Qualifications


Master's Degree or MBA, in a quantitative field (e.g. Finance, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Economics)
Excellent SAS/SQL Skills and experience of working with large and unstructured data.
Strong programming skills (C, C++, JAVA, Python, R etc.)
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Familiarity with recommendation systems such as collaborative filtering, k-nearest neighbors, association rules, market basket analysis, SVD (singular value decomposition), and matrix factorization methods
Experience working with very large datasets using Big Data tools and platforms (Hadoop, PIG/HIVE/Mahout)
Strong working knowledge of data mining techniques, including regression analysis, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, SVM (support vector machines)


Preferred Qualifications


Familiarity with recommendation systems such as collaborative filtering, k-nearest neighbors, association rules, market basket analysis, SVD (singular value decomposition), and matrix factorization methods


Salary Range: $60,000.00 to $110,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits

The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we’ll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.

Depending on factors such as business unit requirements, the nature of the position, cost and applicable laws, American Express may provide visa sponsorship for certain positions.

We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:


Competitive base salaries
Bonus incentives
6% Company Match on retirement savings plan
Free financial coaching and financial well-being support
Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits
Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need
20+ weeks paid parental leave for all parents, regardless of gender, offered for pregnancy, adoption or surrogacy
Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)
Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program
Career development and training opportunities


For a full list of Team Amex benefits, visit our Colleague Benefits Site.

American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

US Job Seekers/Employees - Click here to view the “Know Your Rights” poster and the Pay Transparency Policy Statement.

If the links do not work, please copy and paste the following URLs in a new browser window: https://www.dol.gov/agencies/ofccp/posters to access the three posters.

Responsibilities:

  • Create and implement analytical solutions on enriching data quality for usage across analytics and targeting.
  • Create innovative data products encompassing commercial prospect and customer targeting use-cases, to drive profitable acquisition and engagement strategy (few examples of data products include - Product/Channel Propensity, Best Time to Call or Lead Quality Index (LQI), identifying commercial expense categories etc.)
  • Work with external data vendors to evaluate external data for small businesses incl. signals, inflection points and establish the proof of concept on investing in purchasing the data to improve/enrich commercial targeting.
  • Collaborate with Decision Science and Capabilities teams to build analytical solutions to improve coverage & accuracy of key data elements which are critical inputs into models and marketing/Sales campaigns.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Master's Degree or MBA, in a quantitative field (e.g. Finance, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Economics)
  • Excellent SAS/SQL Skills and experience of working with large and unstructured data.
  • Strong programming skills (C, C++, JAVA, Python, R etc.)
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Familiarity with recommendation systems such as collaborative filtering, k-nearest neighbors, association rules, market basket analysis, SVD (singular value decomposition), and matrix factorization methods
  • Experience working with very large datasets using Big Data tools and platforms (Hadoop, PIG/HIVE/Mahout)
  • Strong working knowledge of data mining techniques, including regression analysis, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, SVM (support vector machines)

Preferred Qualifications

  • Familiarity with recommendation systems such as collaborative filtering, k-nearest neighbors, association rules, market basket analysis, SVD (singular value decomposition), and matrix factorization methods

Salary Range: $60,000.00 to $110,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits

The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we’ll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.

Depending on factors such as business unit requirements, the nature of the position, cost and applicable laws, American Express may provide visa sponsorship for certain positions.

We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:

  • Competitive base salaries
  • Bonus incentives
  • 6% Company Match on retirement savings plan
  • Free financial coaching and financial well-being support
  • Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits
  • Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need
  • 20+ weeks paid parental leave for all parents, regardless of gender, offered for pregnancy, adoption or surrogacy
  • Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)
  • Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program
  • Career development and training opportunities

For a full list of Team Amex benefits, visit our Colleague Benefits Site.

American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

US Job Seekers/Employees - Click here to view the “Know Your Rights” poster and the Pay Transparency Policy Statement.

If the links do not work, please copy and paste the following URLs in a new browser window: https://www.dol.gov/agencies/ofccp/posters to access the three posters.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Requirements

Company Overview

ConcertAI’s mission is to accelerate insights, advance research, and improve patient outcomes in oncology and across life sciences. ConcertAI’s leading real-world evidence, AI technology and software-as-a-service solutions support healthcare decision-making across clinical research & development through commercialization. Top biopharma sponsors, clinical research organizations, healthcare providers and institutions rely on ConcertAI’s evidence-generation and digital transformation capabilities to advance precision medicine and medical innovation.

ConcertAI has emerged as one of the fastest growing AI health tech companies backed by industry-leading private equity companies: SymphonyAI Group, Declaration Partners, Maverick Ventures, and AllianceBernstein PCI.

Role Summary

We seek a highly proficient Data Analyst that will execute data quality scripts, generate production and ad-hoc reports as well as summary descriptive statistics. The ideal candidate will possess the ability to digest complex databases, have strong coding and data analytic skill sets and exhibit an adept ability for uncovering root causes of data errors and inquires. They will collaborate with business analysts and client service managers in providing quality, analytics, and business support for both internal stakeholders and our external clients.

Responsibilities


Research and develop analytical approaches for identifying, analyzing, and interpreting trends or patterns in complex data sets, particularly in healthcare data.
Query, structure, and validate data using MS SQL
Extensively understand the workflow and the ability to follow prescribed Quality Control measures to ensure accuracy of data deliverables.
Participate in User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Regression Testing.
Assess business needs, compile necessary data, and develop dashboards/reports to provide strategic insights for stakeholders.
Extract data directly from relational databases, data warehouses or other data sources using SQL to solve business problems.
Identify process improvement opportunities, develop, and implement optimized solutions, and educate stakeholders on new processes.
Communicating data analysis results to stakeholders for supporting their business inquiries.


Requirements


BA / BS in Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
2+ years of data analysis experience preferred
Pharmaceutical or Specialty Pharmacy experience is a plus
Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Experience in analyzing and drawing valuable conclusions from data profiling results
Exhibit a high level of organizational and time-management skills
Excellent analytical, verbal and communication skills
Must have strong SQL coding and database experience, Python is a plus
Advanced proficiency with MS Excel


Learn More About ConcertAI

Our team at ConcertAI is dedicated to transforming healthcare decision-making through the application of RWE and AI to improve patient outcomes. We work in a fast-paced, dynamic, high-performing culture where diversity, collaboration, and innovation are valued. Join us on our quest to create a world free of disease. Learn more about ConcertAI at www.concertai.com , or follow us on LinkedIn.

EEO

ConcertAI provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Title: PowerBI Data Analyst
Description:
Description:

One of Insight Global’s Financial Services clients is looking for an innovative Data Analytics Developer who has a knack for seeing solutions in sprawling data sets across loan and deposit products, building consistent business user experiences, and performing detailed analysis to produce genuine business insights that will find and fuel strategic opportunities. You will work directly with the line of business leaders – including Business Chief Information and Chief Financial Officers – to assess and interpret their reporting needs. You will identify and design reporting solutions based on their requirements. You will use various data query and visualization tools (SQL, Power BI, SAS, etc.) to access multiple data sources and design insightful products for our business partners. You will develop solutions that will have a real impact for the bank and for our customers by building, developing, and maintaining data models, dashboards, reports, data automation systems, and performance metrics support that support key business decisions




Requirements:

Ability and willingness to work onsite 5 days per week (Monday - Friday); no remote flexibility
1+ years of experience working in the Banking/Finanical Services industry
3+ years of experience in developing analytical reports and dashboards using PowerBI
3+ years of experience programming with querying languages: SQL, SAS, R, Python (SQL is a must-have)




If you are looking for an on-site position and have the above requirements, please apply! We look forward to connecting with you.




Compensation:

$45/hour to $65/hour




Exact compensation may vary based on several factors, including skills, experience, and education.




Benefit packages for this role will start on the 31st day of employment and include medical, dental, and vision insurance, as well as HSA, FSA, and DCFSA account options, and 401k retirement account access with employer matching. Employees in this role are also entitled to paid sick leave and/or other paid time off as provided by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Kforce has a client that is seeking a Data Analyst in Juno Beach, FL. Overview: The Data Analyst serves as a critical member of data integrity team within digital solutions group and supplies detailed analysis on key data elements that flow between systems to help design governance and master data management strategies and ensure data cleanliness.

Requirements


Significant data analysis/data integrity/data governance skills and proficiency/expertise in analytical tools including Power BI development, Python, coding, Excel, SQL, SOQL, Jira, and others
Must be detail oriented, focused on excellent quality deliverables and able to analyze data quickly using multiple tools and strategies including creating advanced algorithms


The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Position Summary

Founded in 2005, Value Partners Investments (VPI) is a Winnipeg-based investment firm that currently manages over $4.7 Billion in assets primarily through nine investment funds as well as through Value Partners Investment Counsel (VPIC) which provides discretionary investment management services to wealthy families across Canada.

Our mission is to build client wealth by investing wisely and communicating clearly. Over the past 18 years we have fulfilled that mission by creating over $1.8 Billion in investment gains for clients. This track record of success has enabled us to become one of Canada’s fastest growing companies as ranked by Profit Magazine and one of Canada’s fastest growing Private Investment Counsels by Investor Economics.

Reporting to the Director of Information Technology, the Data Analyst plays a crucial role in transforming raw data into actionable insights for our organization. Your work will empower decision-makers by providing clear visualizations and reports. You will collaborate with various stakeholders to bridge the gap between technical and non-technical teams.

The Data Analyst is a key member of the IT team who collaborates daily with various internal stakeholders of the business while understanding our products and services within the financial services industry and VPI’s place in it. Internally to VPI this also means living VPI’s investment philosophy, our products, our values and supporting our strategic direction.

, Job Description

Key Responsibilities:


Collaboration: Work closely with business teams to understand requirements and translate them into meaningful visualizations.
Metric Definition: Lead the process to define and document the definitions of key metrics required by stakeholders.
Data Analysis: Analyze data, identify trends, and uncover patterns to drive informed business decisions.
Power BI Development: Leverage Microsoft’s Power BI to create interactive dashboards and reports.
Data Modeling: Work with the Senior Data Architect to design and develop data models that effectively support business requirements.
Accuracy and Reliability: Ensure the accuracy and reliability of data presented in dashboards and reports.
Effective Communication: Clearly convey complex data insights to stakeholders.
Power BI Adoption: Train and support staff on the use of Power BI
Business Intelligence: Contribute to the organization’s data-driven strategy built on Microsoft Fabric.
Other miscellaneous duties and special projects as assigned.


, Qualifications

Education & Experience:


Diploma or degree in a related field.
A minimum of 2-3 years working with diverse BI tools, with expertise in Microsoft Power BI. Experience with other components of Microsoft Fabric considered an asset.
A combination of education and experience will be considered.


Technical Skills:


SQL, Nice -To-Have: Proficiency in programming languages such as R and Python.
Strong knowledge of DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) and M (Power Query) scripting languages.
Hands-on experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI).


Skills & Abilities:


Excellent time management and adaptability.
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Exceptional attention to detail
Ability to manage multiple tasks.
Proven analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills


Additional Information

Comprehensive health, dental and vision benefits

Health & Wellness Spending Account

4% Matching RRSP allocation

Great workplace culture!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DATA ANALYST

New York, US

Your Story:

We are seeking a sharp and highly analytical Data Analyst to join our dynamic and fast-growing company. As a key member of our data team, you will play a crucial role in driving data-driven decisions for optimizing performance across our organization. You'll collaborate closely with various departments, providing valuable insights that enable our business operations to focus effectively and steer the company in the right direction.

Our Story:

Our journey began in 2012 with a vision to revolutionize the publisher video platform industry. Leveraging cutting-edge machine learning and AI technology, we empower publishers worldwide to maximize revenue through comprehensive tools for video content ownership and monetization. Our platform offers leading global publishers unmatched capabilities in ad serving, monetization strategies, content automation, and personalized video recommendations.

Trusted by top publishers such as The Arena Group, CBSi, Hearst, Nasdaq, VICE, and others, our platform enhances audience engagement and drives revenue growth. Our success is driven by a dedicated global team and supported by visionary backers including The Walt Disney Company, Saban Ventures, Viola Group, 83North, and Firstime Ventures.

In short, You will:

Collaborate with managers across departments to understand their business insights needs, including metrics tracking, dashboard creation, and report generation.
Define and monitor KPIs, conduct deep data analysis to uncover opportunities, and deliver actionable insights to drive business success.
Develop, implement, and maintain impactful dashboards, reports, and metrics, ensuring data integrity and validity.
Present findings and recommendations clearly to key stakeholders across the company.
Manage multiple projects and clients simultaneously in a fast-paced, results-driven environment.
Work closely with operations, data, R&D, finance, and other teams within the organization.

It would be great if you have:

6+ years of experience as a Data/Business Analyst, specializing in quantitative and statistical analysis.
Extensive experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, etc.
Strong business acumen and proficiency in SQL and Excel for data manipulation and analysis.
Proven expertise in A/B testing methodology with a track record of impactful testing outcomes.
Ability to translate complex quantitative analyses into clear, precise, and visually appealing insights to support decision-making.
Strong problem-solving skills, quick learning ability, and a proactive approach to project completion.

It would be AMAZING if you have:

Background in a high-tech company environment.
Experience in the ad-tech industry with a focus on monetization optimization.
Knowledge of Python for data analysis and manipulation.
Familiarity with big data tools such as BigQuery, Athena, etc.

Show more

  • Strong business acumen and proficiency in SQL and Excel for data manipulation and analysis.
  • Proven expertise in A/B testing methodology with a track record of impactful testing outcomes.
  • Ability to translate complex quantitative analyses into clear, precise, and visually appealing insights to support decision-making.
  • Strong problem-solving skills, quick learning ability, and a proactive approach to project completion.

It would be AMAZING if you have:

  • Background in a high-tech company environment.
  • Experience in the ad-tech industry with a focus on monetization optimization.
  • Knowledge of Python for data analysis and manipulation.
  • Familiarity with big data tools such as BigQuery, Athena, etc.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title – Predictive Data Analyst

Location – Los Angeles, CA

Duration – 12 months

**Only on W2 and Local to CA**




JOB DETAILS:

Skills Preferred:

The Predictive Data Analyst supports stakeholders by defining data needs and ensuring data science projects meet business objectives across various levels.
The role involves using statistical programming languages and tools for data manipulation, analysis, and visualization, including end-to-end predictive modeling from exploratory analysis to deployment and results interpretation. Key tasks include managing data through querying, cleaning, merging, quality control, regular reporting, special project deliverables, and documentation.
Additionally, the analyst collaborates with IT staff to develop data pipelines, designs and maintains reports and dashboards, and works with program staff to ensure analyses lead to actionable insights for decision-making and program improvement.
A strong background in predictive analytics and tool development is essential. Customer experience working directly with a client-centric relational database and managing individuals.
Strong technical knowledge and comfortable doing analyses and building reports from an SQL database.
The analyst is comfortable with various analytical tools and has taken the lead on projects where the best path forward is unclear. Customer service mindset.




Experience Preferred

Four (4) years of experience with responsibility for planning, designing, conducting, and evaluating research projects involving the application of techniques of machine learning, predictive analytics, data management, and hypothesis-driven data analysis to complex experimental designs, leading to actionable findings and recommendations.




Education Preferred

A Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in a field of applied research such as Data Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Statistics, Business Analytics, Psychology, or Public Health that includes 12 semester or 18 quarter units of coursework in data science, predictive analytics, quantitative research methods, or statistical analysis.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Overview

PCI requires support in data analytics and visualization supporting a large and dynamic Federal procurement organization.

We are looking for a Data Analyst who can support and meet the qualifications below.

Responsibilities

Obtains data through advanced computerized models using a variety of software, including Tableau, PowerBI and Excel.
Extrapolates data patterns through advanced algorithms.
Develops graphs and charts to explain how mathematical information will influence the specific project or business.
Develops, maintains, innovates, and enhances workload tracking visualizations and make recommendations based on industry best practices how to display procurement workload and resource management data to guide the process for assigning working, managing work, managing workload, and identifying risk early on.
Develops and maintains an executive landing page where dashboards for leadership.
Develops dashboards focused on business processes and management levels to guide leadership at all levels in making data driven decisions;
Defines, develops, and documents future measurement framework reporting/visualization;
Defines, develops, and maintains governance plan for maintaining dashboards
Develops and implements a business process for receiving, evaluating, developing, tracking, and maintaining report requests to support reporting needs.
Streamlines activities to maximize efficiencies and reporting.
Develops and maintains a data catalog of available automation, reports, and dashboards to guide transparency and improve customer experience.
Presents to managers how to best alter their business models to generate profitable future trends.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree from an accredited school.
At least (8) years of experience on contracts of similar size or scope with experience in Federal acquisition and contract management.
Must have experience with Excel, Tableau, M365 Power Apps, PowerBi Power Automate, and all elements of Power Platform expertise in utilizing and developing work products that aid in data-driven decision-making.
Proven ability to solve problems creatively.
Strong familiarity with software tools, methodologies, and best practices.
Excellent analytical skills.




PCI Federal Services (PCIFS) and it's subsidiaries is an equal-opportunity employer. PCIFS does not discriminate on the basis of age, sex, race, national origin, religion, marital status, sexual orientation or identity, Veterans or Disability status.

Preference may be extended to qualified Native American Indian candidates

in accordance with applicable federal law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
SUMMARY

The Data Analyst role is responsible for furthering our data collections and analysis practice in support of the Datacenter Physical Security Operations program, which is a complex, multi $100M global client account providing physical security to datacenters around the globe. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for transforming data into actionable insights that inform business decisions. This role requires experience in data analytics, data analysis, requirements gathering, data sourcing, and data visualization (including Power BI, Excel, etc.). An ideal candidate will have expertise in Microsoft PowerBI to create and manage business insight and analytics solutions that turn data into knowledge. This role will also be to manage reporting projects and initiatives, communicating findings with various stakeholders which could include executive audiences. The successful candidate will be an intellectually curious, self-directed individual with excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. This role is collaborative in providing support for internal and client teams. The Data Analyst will report to the Business Analytics Manager.




ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Design, develop, and maintain business intelligence solutions using Microsoft PowerBI.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather, analyze, and translate business requirements into functional dashboards and reports.
Collaborates cross-functionally to support the growth of the Datacenter Physical Security program.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by implementing quality control measures.
Ensures stakeholder requirements are captured, agreed upon, communicated and measured.
Responsible for process of design, construction of reports and visualizations while ensuring long-term maintainability and scalability.
Builds custom Power BI reports and dashboards, ensuring a compelling, consistent, and accurate story across all audiences.
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into digestible and actionable format, all while balancing competing priorities.
Proactively analyze key reports to make recommendations on trends that should be investigated by teams responsible for the data.
Use of statistical methods to analyze data generate useful business reports to depict trends.
Automates and streamlines reports and daily tasks; continuously improving the team’s reporting capabilities.
Supports the program teams with essential reporting functions, compliance tracking, data analysis, and process documentation.
Maintains a “customer service” approach to problem solving and works with client to find solutions to questions or concerns.
At the direction of the Business Analytics Manager, delivers ad hoc reports and performs other duties as assigned to ensure the overall success of the Datacenter Physical Security program.




EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Data Science, or related field or equivalent experience and 5 years of demonstrated experience in this discipline, or equivalent combination of education and experience to perform the essential functions of the job, as determined by the company.
Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience in development, architecture, and analyst experience to support design of enterprise Business Intelligence Solutions.
3 years of experience developing dashboards, governed reports, embedded analytics, and visualizations using Power BI as a data analyst/data scientist.
1 year of experience in full data warehouse implementation and knowledge of developing a highly performance report and visualization.
Highly proficient with data visualization in Power BI, with experience implementing within SharePoint.
Advanced-level skill using Microsoft Office Suite including Power BI, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Visio and SharePoint.
Some understanding of Azure Data Services.




COMPETENCIES

Ability to present data to internal and external teams.
Ability to use problem solving skills to provide business insights and recommendations from data sets.
Able to focus on the details while thinking strategically.
Comfortable with ambiguity and able to work independently.
Excellent organizational skills and high attention to detail.
Manages assigned projects responsibly, completes tasks in a timely manner, and delivers on-time even under tight deadlines.
Able to thrive in a detail-oriented environment with quickly changing requirements.
Demonstrated ability to quickly learn unfamiliar areas of business.
Able to exercise independent judgment and decision-making skills, must have the ability to ask for clarification without prompting.
Ability to adapt to new and changing environments and quickly learn to use new resources and tools.
Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and statistics.
Strong analytical reasoning and critical and creative thinking.
Ability to exercise independent judgement and decision-making skills.
Ability to interact effectively at all levels and across diverse cultures.
Ability to be an effective team member and handle projects responsibility.
Ability to identify and rectify problems.
Strong presentation and communication skills, both verbally and written, and comfortable presenting in front of a large audience.
Interacts effectively at all levels and across diverse cultures.
Capable of working under pressure while maintaining a professional image and approach with both internal and external customers.
Thorough understanding of standard office procedures and practices.
Experience working in a fast-paced, detail-oriented workplace where judgement and professionalism were necessities.




MINIMUM HIRING STANDARDS

Must be at least 18 years of age.
Must have a reliable means of communication, such as cell phone.
Must have a reliable means of transportation (public or private).
Must have the legal right to work in the country the position is based out of.
Must have the ability to speak, read, and write English.
Must have a high school diploma, secondary education equivalent, or GED.
Must be willing to participate in the Company’s pre-employment screening process, including drug screen and background investigation

Title: Data Analyst - Digital - New York
Description:
Description
Key Activities:


Independently conduct analysis in SQL & Tableau, sharing results and collaborating with clients, Efficio’s client facing teams, and Efficio’s technical experts
In addition to execution, proactively look for ways to build on the product. Some key skills we expect you to master are: streamlining the process (reducing time to delivery), increasing generalizability (via robust modular coding & design practices), and improving usability for our clients.
Present confidently to both internal and client teams about the analysis in a way that is persuasive to people of varying seniority and technical skill level. Develop knowledge and expertise in your focus area so you can become a trusted adviser to our clients.


Essential Requirements - Exemplary academic background in STEM or demonstrated excellence in analytics via independent project work


Proficiency in at least one of: Python, SQL, Matlab, R, or Java as demonstrated through coursework or independent work. This role will mainly be working with Python and SQL, however any proficiency in the other 3 languages will be acceptable as long as you are willing to learn
Expert in research, problem-solving, communication, & analysis
Record of leadership


Desirable Requirements - Strong visual & oral communicator with experience independently leading presentations on complex analytical topics


1+ Years in Python, SQL
Solid academic background in or independent understanding of fundamental programming concepts
Experience working in a high pressure environment


Please note applications for this role will close on 8th August 2024.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Spot Pet Insurance is the fastest growing pet insurance company in North America. Our commitment to an exceptional end-to-end customer experience and our data-driven approach have quickly established us as a leading pet insurance provider. We're dedicated to providing pet parents with peace of mind by offering accessible and comprehensive coverage so their furry companions can lead happier, healthier lives. To demonstrate this, we recently joined forces with MrBeast to find homes for 100 homeless pets and committed to giving each of them pet insurance for life! Along the way, we’ve created a company culture that allows our employees to thrive, with perks like daily free meals, a pet-friendly office, and ridiculously fun company events every quarter. Our dedication to fostering a positive and rewarding work environment for our team has even earned us a Great Place to Work certification.

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our dynamic team! The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users. We are looking for someone who is high energy, willing to run through walls, and has a great ability to collaborate.


This job is in office only at our Downtown Miami Office. No remote work offered*


Responsibilities:


Work directly with management to help drive strategy and execute experiments to improve company efficiency across sales and marketing channels
Build full-cycle experiments, reports, dashboards that help the business achieve its goals and enable better decision-making
Capture our stakeholders' data needs and identify the primary output metrics that measure success. Regularly report on those metrics
Investigate new data sources and work on adding, automating, and updating data pipelines responsible for delivering data
Explore data correlations to refine the relationships between metrics
Align data handling practices with data privacy in mind
Build data governance with a single source of truth
Ensure data integrity and observability across all data


Technologies:


SQL Databases (Postgres, MySQL)
Data Studio and Tableau
Google Analytics
GCP
BigQuery
Segment CDP
Python Programming
R Studio


Nice to haves:


Experience in analytics & visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI
Experience with data engineering tools such as BigQuery
Experience with machine learning, advanced modeling, or market mix modeling
Experience with advanced statistics


Requirements


2-3 years working as a data analyst, business analyst, or data engineer
Strong experience using SQL to turn datasets into metrics
Experience with the ELT pattern
Experience in managing databases, including relational database architecture, query optimization, and database schema design
Empathy and creativity to understand and solve stakeholders' problems
Passion for data origins, integrity, accuracy, and storytelling


Benefits


The opportunity to work on challenging and impactful projects at the intersection of design and data
A collaborative and supportive work environment, recognized as a Great Place to Work
Cell phone allowance of $100
Benefit package
Dental, and visions benefits
Life insurance
Unlimited PTO
Bring your pet to work
Your pet insurance is covered (Up to $100)
401k with Company match
Annual performance-based bonus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Details

Job Location

Valley View, Buena Park, CA - Buena Park, CA

Salary Range

$70,000.00

Description

Job Description


Will be responsible for analyzing, collecting, and monitoring data on a recurring and ad hoc basis.
Will develop new reporting to support the Operations.
Assisting with operational workflow by timely and accurate loading of data into Operations systems to optimize and maximize the production calls.
Tracking overall production performance results and the key resource components, distribute substantive analysis, collaborating directly with Operations staff to evaluate the ongoing effectiveness of operating metrics and measurement methods and continually improve them as needed or directed.
Assist in generating reports for Sales and Client Services, evaluate and implement new tools to promote or analyze performance improvement and to contribute to financial reviews, proposals, pricing, and forecasting budget development.


Qualifications

Requirements


Analytical Skills: Data analysts work with large amounts of data: facts, figures, and number crunching. Need to see through the data and analyze it to find conclusions.
Communication Skills: Data analysts are often called to present their findings, or translate the data into an understandable document. Need to write and speak clearly, easily communicating complex ideas.
Critical Thinking: Data analysts must look at the numbers, trends, and data and come to new conclusions based on the findings.
Attention to Detail: Data is precise. Data analysts have to make sure they are vigilant in their analysis to come to correct conclusions.
Math Skills: Data analysts need math skills to estimate numerical data

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
eNGINE builds Technical Teams. We are a Solutions and Placement firm shaped by decades of interaction with Technical professionals. Our inspiration is continuous learning and engagement with the markets we serve, the talent we represent, and the teams we build. Our Consulting Workforce is encouraged to enjoy career fulfillment in the form of challenging projects, schedule flexibility, and paid training/certifications. Successful outcomes start and finish with eNGINE.




eNGINE is hiring a Data Reporting Analyst for a client of ours, in the pharmacy space, who will be responsible for assisting a massive reconstruction of a data warehouse. This person will be proficient in SQL, and has the ability to analyze, interpret, and clean data sets.




Job duties:

Develop, deploy, and maintain regular reports.
Define data needs for specific departments and contractual compliance in collaboration with the analytics team.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity verification.
Cleanse and mine data from various sources, ensuring integrity pre-deployment.
Deploy, test, and develop standard and custom reports and analytics for strategic and operational analysis to internal and/or external users.
Interpret, identify, and analyze trends in data sets.




What we're looking for:

2+ years of SQL experience
2+ years of Azure Data Factory and/or Databricks
Ability to analyze massive data sets.
Preferred experience in speciality pharmaceuticals and/or healthcare




No C2C. Reach out to me for more details!

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary:

We are looking for a driven, early career individual, with a passion for analytics and innovation to join us in turning the largest cardiovascular database in the US into meaningful and impactful insights. As an Associate Data Analyst, your success will be measured by the quality and actionable nature of our analytics deliverables to hospital customers. Your contributions will have the ability to save real patients’ lives and propel egnite to the next state of evolution.




The ideal candidate has at least 2 years of experience in an analytics role, has an eye for detail, and a quantitative and creative mindset. This individual will bring strong communication, strong work ethic, and team-player attitude to help tackle any task, executing on the nuts and bolts of our ‘get it done’ culture. The candidate should know SQL and be prepared to rapidly acquire new analytical and technical skills on the job including Kaplan Meir analysis and data manipulation using python in a big data environment (Databricks).




Duties and Responsibilities:




Strategic thinking to generate impactful insights that benefit patients and hospitals
Development of new analyses using python and SQL and presenting those results internally via PowerPoint Presentation
Clear communication of data to our customer reporting team, ensuring they're equipped with the necessary detail to support groundbreaking insights in customer meetings
Analyze large data sets to identify trends and patterns
Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
Stay up-to-date with new data analysis techniques and tools
Assist in data cleaning, preprocessing, and data wrangling
Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify key variables and insights




This role requires privileged access controls for critical systems or data, ensuring that only authorized employees have access to sensitive information to help prevent data breaches and unauthorized access to sensitive information.




Education and experience:

A bachelor’s degree in a business or quantitative field – Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Biology, Finance, or related field.
At least 2 years of experience in a data analytics role
Experience with SQL and databases required
A talent for data driven story-telling and executive message development
PowerBi, Databricks, pyspark, and/or R, preferred
A passion for making a difference in the world – in our case, helping patients
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Natural curiosity, eagerness to learning, and willing to self-study to gain expertise in cardiovascular clinical and hospital administration topics
Team player excited by the prospect of shared successes in collaboration with our clinical client success team and hospital customers
Strong attention to detail and organization skills
Comfortable with statistical concepts
Location flexibility within the United States, with occasional travel (up to 5%) to our headquarters in Orange County or to support customer presentations
Work authorization in the United States




egnite is a rapidly growing digital healthcare company dedicated to improving care for heart disease patients. Our vision is to create an evolved healthcare landscape in which data, technology, patients, and clinical expertise are at the intersection of healthcare transformation - simply put, we want to improve the care for every heart patient across the US.




At egnite, we take security seriously, and it plays a role in all jobs within our organization. We believe that every employee has a responsibility to help maintain a secure and safe work environment, protect our company’s assets and reputation, and safeguard our customers’ data and privacy. Therefore, all employees are expected to comply with our security policies and procedures, and to report any security incidents or concerns promptly.




Please note that some positions may require additional security clearances or certifications, depending on the nature of the job and the level of access to sensitive information. If such requirements exist, they will be clearly stated in the job description, and all applicants will be expected to meet these requirements as a condition of employment.

Title: PowerBI Data Analyst
Description:
Description:

One of Insight Global’s Financial Services clients is looking for an innovative Data Analytics Developer who has a knack for seeing solutions in sprawling data sets across loan and deposit products, building consistent business user experiences, and performing detailed analysis to produce genuine business insights that will find and fuel strategic opportunities. You will work directly with the line of business leaders – including Business Chief Information and Chief Financial Officers – to assess and interpret their reporting needs. You will identify and design reporting solutions based on their requirements. You will use various data query and visualization tools (SQL, Power BI, SAS, etc.) to access multiple data sources and design insightful products for our business partners. You will develop solutions that will have a real impact for the bank and for our customers by building, developing, and maintaining data models, dashboards, reports, data automation systems, and performance metrics support that support key business decisions




Requirements:

Ability and willingness to work onsite 5 days per week (Monday - Friday); no remote flexibility
1+ years of experience working in the Banking/Finanical Services industry
3+ years of experience in developing analytical reports and dashboards using PowerBI
3+ years of experience programming with querying languages: SQL, SAS, R, Python (SQL is a must-have)




If you are looking for an on-site position and have the above requirements, please apply! We look forward to connecting with you.




Compensation:

$45/hour to $65/hour




Exact compensation may vary based on several factors, including skills, experience, and education.




Benefit packages for this role will start on the 31st day of employment and include medical, dental, and vision insurance, as well as HSA, FSA, and DCFSA account options, and 401k retirement account access with employer matching. Employees in this role are also entitled to paid sick leave and/or other paid time off as provided by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Kforce has a client that is seeking a Data Analyst in Juno Beach, FL. Overview: The Data Analyst serves as a critical member of data integrity team within digital solutions group and supplies detailed analysis on key data elements that flow between systems to help design governance and master data management strategies and ensure data cleanliness.

Requirements


Significant data analysis/data integrity/data governance skills and proficiency/expertise in analytical tools including Power BI development, Python, coding, Excel, SQL, SOQL, Jira, and others
Must be detail oriented, focused on excellent quality deliverables and able to analyze data quickly using multiple tools and strategies including creating advanced algorithms


The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Position Summary

Founded in 2005, Value Partners Investments (VPI) is a Winnipeg-based investment firm that currently manages over $4.7 Billion in assets primarily through nine investment funds as well as through Value Partners Investment Counsel (VPIC) which provides discretionary investment management services to wealthy families across Canada.

Our mission is to build client wealth by investing wisely and communicating clearly. Over the past 18 years we have fulfilled that mission by creating over $1.8 Billion in investment gains for clients. This track record of success has enabled us to become one of Canada’s fastest growing companies as ranked by Profit Magazine and one of Canada’s fastest growing Private Investment Counsels by Investor Economics.

Reporting to the Director of Information Technology, the Data Analyst plays a crucial role in transforming raw data into actionable insights for our organization. Your work will empower decision-makers by providing clear visualizations and reports. You will collaborate with various stakeholders to bridge the gap between technical and non-technical teams.

The Data Analyst is a key member of the IT team who collaborates daily with various internal stakeholders of the business while understanding our products and services within the financial services industry and VPI’s place in it. Internally to VPI this also means living VPI’s investment philosophy, our products, our values and supporting our strategic direction.

, Job Description

Key Responsibilities:


Collaboration: Work closely with business teams to understand requirements and translate them into meaningful visualizations.
Metric Definition: Lead the process to define and document the definitions of key metrics required by stakeholders.
Data Analysis: Analyze data, identify trends, and uncover patterns to drive informed business decisions.
Power BI Development: Leverage Microsoft’s Power BI to create interactive dashboards and reports.
Data Modeling: Work with the Senior Data Architect to design and develop data models that effectively support business requirements.
Accuracy and Reliability: Ensure the accuracy and reliability of data presented in dashboards and reports.
Effective Communication: Clearly convey complex data insights to stakeholders.
Power BI Adoption: Train and support staff on the use of Power BI
Business Intelligence: Contribute to the organization’s data-driven strategy built on Microsoft Fabric.
Other miscellaneous duties and special projects as assigned.


, Qualifications

Education & Experience:


Diploma or degree in a related field.
A minimum of 2-3 years working with diverse BI tools, with expertise in Microsoft Power BI. Experience with other components of Microsoft Fabric considered an asset.
A combination of education and experience will be considered.


Technical Skills:


SQL, Nice -To-Have: Proficiency in programming languages such as R and Python.
Strong knowledge of DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) and M (Power Query) scripting languages.
Hands-on experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI).


Skills & Abilities:


Excellent time management and adaptability.
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Exceptional attention to detail
Ability to manage multiple tasks.
Proven analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills


Additional Information

Comprehensive health, dental and vision benefits

Health & Wellness Spending Account

4% Matching RRSP allocation

Great workplace culture!

Title: Data Analyst II
Description:
Assist in creating and driving business value and growth though the effective use of Sheetz’ most valuable resource: Data. Responsible for leading Sheetz’ data and information strategy through data analysis and visualization in order to facilitate and enhance organizational decision-making and data utilization across the company. Provides advanced data analytics support to the Senior Data Analyst while providing mentorship to the Data Analyst I around data analytics and information strategy.




RESPONSIBILITIES (other duties may be assigned)




Cultivate data-driven insights that help support exploitation of strategic and tactical business opportunities, and be a champion for a data-driven, decision-making culture.
Support data strategy leadership in the development, assessment, refinement and implementation of corporate strategy through effective use of data analytics.
Provide enterprise-wide data science and business intelligence services as well as recommendations to decentralized, embedded data scientists and analysts throughout the business.
Assist Senior Data Analysts and management in providing training for departmental and distributed data analysts.
Oversee and present robust ad-hoc reports, data models, and deep dive analysis to provide clear observations so that managers can make more informed decisions.
Develop and mentor future data-driven, analytical leaders and strategists within the team.
Assist with a wide array of analytical tasks and projects requested by other departments.
Supports the Senior Data Analyst position with ad-hoc advanced analytics.
Assist in the creation of policies and procedures for the access, analysis and visualization of data and associated business insights; partnering with IT and RISC.
Responsible for the documenting and classifying data assets and making accessible and discoverable across the organization.




QUALIFICATIONS




(Equivalent combinations of education, licenses, certifications and/or experience may be considered)







Education

Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial /Data / Computer Science or related field required

Experience

Minimum 3 years demonstrated experience in data modeling, optimization, and application to business strategies required.
Minimum 3 years demonstrated experience in integrating complex, inter-departmental processes and information strategies, and/or designing strategic metrics and scorecards required.
Thorough understanding of the latest data mining, machine learning and/or artificial intelligence techniques required.
In-depth experience with or coursework in designing and implementing information solutions required.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DATA ANALYST

New York, US

Your Story:

We are seeking a sharp and highly analytical Data Analyst to join our dynamic and fast-growing company. As a key member of our data team, you will play a crucial role in driving data-driven decisions for optimizing performance across our organization. You'll collaborate closely with various departments, providing valuable insights that enable our business operations to focus effectively and steer the company in the right direction.

Our Story:

Our journey began in 2012 with a vision to revolutionize the publisher video platform industry. Leveraging cutting-edge machine learning and AI technology, we empower publishers worldwide to maximize revenue through comprehensive tools for video content ownership and monetization. Our platform offers leading global publishers unmatched capabilities in ad serving, monetization strategies, content automation, and personalized video recommendations.

Trusted by top publishers such as The Arena Group, CBSi, Hearst, Nasdaq, VICE, and others, our platform enhances audience engagement and drives revenue growth. Our success is driven by a dedicated global team and supported by visionary backers including The Walt Disney Company, Saban Ventures, Viola Group, 83North, and Firstime Ventures.

In short, You will:

Collaborate with managers across departments to understand their business insights needs, including metrics tracking, dashboard creation, and report generation.
Define and monitor KPIs, conduct deep data analysis to uncover opportunities, and deliver actionable insights to drive business success.
Develop, implement, and maintain impactful dashboards, reports, and metrics, ensuring data integrity and validity.
Present findings and recommendations clearly to key stakeholders across the company.
Manage multiple projects and clients simultaneously in a fast-paced, results-driven environment.
Work closely with operations, data, R&D, finance, and other teams within the organization.

It would be great if you have:

6+ years of experience as a Data/Business Analyst, specializing in quantitative and statistical analysis.
Extensive experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, etc.
Strong business acumen and proficiency in SQL and Excel for data manipulation and analysis.
Proven expertise in A/B testing methodology with a track record of impactful testing outcomes.
Ability to translate complex quantitative analyses into clear, precise, and visually appealing insights to support decision-making.
Strong problem-solving skills, quick learning ability, and a proactive approach to project completion.

It would be AMAZING if you have:

Background in a high-tech company environment.
Experience in the ad-tech industry with a focus on monetization optimization.
Knowledge of Python for data analysis and manipulation.
Familiarity with big data tools such as BigQuery, Athena, etc.

Our platform offers leading global publishers unmatched capabilities in ad serving, monetization strategies, content automation, and personalized video recommendations.

Trusted by top publishers such as The Arena Group, CBSi, Hearst, Nasdaq, VICE, and others, our platform enhances audience engagement and drives revenue growth. Our success is driven by a dedicated global team and supported by visionary backers including The Walt Disney Company, Saban Ventures, Viola Group, 83North, and Firstime Ventures.

In short, You will:

Collaborate with managers across departments to understand their business insights needs, including metrics tracking, dashboard creation, and report generation.
Define and monitor KPIs, conduct deep data analysis to uncover opportunities, and deliver actionable insights to drive business success.
Develop, implement, and maintain impactful dashboards, reports, and metrics, ensuring data integrity and validity.
Present findings and recommendations clearly to key stakeholders across the company.
Manage multiple projects and clients simultaneously in a fast-paced, results-driven environment.
Work closely with operations, data, R&D, finance, and other teams within the organization.

It would be great if you have:

6+ years of experience as a Data/Business Analyst, specializing in quantitative and statistical analysis.
Extensive experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, etc.
Strong business acumen and proficiency in SQL and Excel for data manipulation and analysis.
Proven expertise in A/B testing methodology with a track record of impactful testing outcomes.
Ability to translate complex quantitative analyses into clear, precise, and visually appealing insights to support decision-making.
Strong problem-solving skills, quick learning ability, and a proactive approach to project completion.

It would be AMAZING if you have:

Background in a high-tech company environment.
Experience in the ad-tech industry with a focus on monetization optimization.
Knowledge of Python for data analysis and manipulation.
Familiarity with big data tools such as BigQuery, Athena, etc.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title – Predictive Data Analyst

Location – Los Angeles, CA

Duration – 12 months

**Only on W2 and Local to CA**




JOB DETAILS:

Skills Preferred:

The Predictive Data Analyst supports stakeholders by defining data needs and ensuring data science projects meet business objectives across various levels.
The role involves using statistical programming languages and tools for data manipulation, analysis, and visualization, including end-to-end predictive modeling from exploratory analysis to deployment and results interpretation. Key tasks include managing data through querying, cleaning, merging, quality control, regular reporting, special project deliverables, and documentation.
Additionally, the analyst collaborates with IT staff to develop data pipelines, designs and maintains reports and dashboards, and works with program staff to ensure analyses lead to actionable insights for decision-making and program improvement.
A strong background in predictive analytics and tool development is essential. Customer experience working directly with a client-centric relational database and managing individuals.
Strong technical knowledge and comfortable doing analyses and building reports from an SQL database.
The analyst is comfortable with various analytical tools and has taken the lead on projects where the best path forward is unclear. Customer service mindset.




Experience Preferred

Four (4) years of experience with responsibility for planning, designing, conducting, and evaluating research projects involving the application of techniques of machine learning, predictive analytics, data management, and hypothesis-driven data analysis to complex experimental designs, leading to actionable findings and recommendations.




Education Preferred

A Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in a field of applied research such as Data Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Statistics, Business Analytics, Psychology, or Public Health that includes 12 semester or 18 quarter units of coursework in data science, predictive analytics, quantitative research methods, or statistical analysis.
