Title: Predictive Data Analyst
Description:
Brief Description




Are you a predictive data analyst interested in growing with an industry leader? Are you eager to make a lasting impact by supporting some of the nation's most cherished nonprofit organizations?




If so, then check out this open role of Predictive Data Analyst at Simio Technologies, a division of Moore – the nation's leader in creating data-driven human connections.




Moore provides strategy, creative, production, media, data, and analytics services powered by an ongoing investment in next-generation artificial intelligence and machine learning. Check out www.WeAreMoore.com for more information.




As a Predictive Data Analyst, you'll prioritize client deliverables, collaborating with account managers to create project plans and ensuring critical deadlines are met while managing multiple projects. Your role will involve building and executing predictive models to aid nonprofits in donor attraction and retention, and expanding data products to align with client objectives, operating across diverse environments and languages. Additionally, you'll translate complex data analysis into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders and consult with various teams including developers and non-technical partners.




To excel in this role, you should possess business acumen, hands-on experience in data modeling, proficiency in database manipulation and query languages like SQL, familiarity with tools like Alteryx and data science toolkits such as R or Python, strong project management skills, and expertise in data visualization tools like Power BI.




This full-time, salaried position is remote and open to candidates in the US who are eligible to work without current or future sponsorship. The salary range is $70,000 to $100,000 annually, depending on skills and expertise.




Your impact:

Understand and prioritize incoming client deliverables.
Collaborate with account managers to develop project plans for each client.
Juggle competing projects and meet critical deadlines.
Build and execute predictive models to help nonprofits attract and retain donors.
Add to our suite of data products that support clients’ goals.
Operate between various environments and across various languages.
Translate data analysis and findings into insights and reporting for non-technical audiences.
Consult with developers and other data people as well as non-technical partners and clients.




Your profile:

A degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, data science, or other related fields.
3+ years’ experience in a professional analytics/predictive data modeling role.
The ability to comprehend the business applications of the data you manipulate.
3+ years’ experience in a business environment with an emphasis in consumer marketing.
Previous hands-on data work in data modeling.
Skills with database manipulation and writing query languages such as SQL.
Experience with data tools like Alteryx.
Experience with common data science toolkits, such as R or Python.
Exceptional project management skills and experience.
Experience with data visualization tools, such as Power BI.




You’ll be a top candidate if you:

Bring a lifelong love of learning and an intense curiosity for how and why things work.
Have exceptional multitasking skills
Love challenging questions and see them as opportunities to learn and grow.
Are willing to be innovative and are open to new approaches.
Are passionate about helping to drive nonprofit missions forward.




Joining Moore, you will:

Do meaningful, life-changing work every day by supporting the nation’s most beloved nonprofits and service organizations.
Join the largest marketing and fundraising company in North America serving the nonprofit industry where we prioritize innovation and professional growth.
Collaborate with industry subject matter experts among over 5,000 employees across the enterprise.
Earn a competitive salary and have access to comprehensive health, wellness, and retirement benefits.
Enjoy paid holidays and generous paid time off, ensuring you have the time and space to recharge and pursue your other passions.




Moore’s commitment to candidates:

Moore is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Moore is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Crexi

Crexi is reimagining commercial real estate, building industry-leading software for professionals to more effectively market, analyze, and trade commercial property. With a suite of due diligence tools, transaction services, deal pipeline support, and a dynamic listing marketplace, Crexi accelerates deal efficiency and has empowered millions of monthly users to close more than $615 billion in deals and market over $7 trillion in property value.

About the Role:

Crexi is looking for a Data Analyst to drive a deeper understanding of our users, product, and business. This role owns and leads analytical projects using various data sources and influence business outcomes by recommending cross-functional solutions. As a Data Analyst, you will be part of a broader operational team that will play a key role by: defining KPIs, analyzing growth strategies, owning the creation of dashboards that will highlight actionable insights, and serving as an expert on Crexi’s data.

What You’ll Do


Work cross-functionally with all departments including: Marketing, Product, Engineering, Sales, Operations, and Finance
Partner closely with the user acquisition team to analyze and optimize marketing campaigns based on actionable data insights
Own traffic reporting, attribution methodology, and acquisition forecasting
Maintain unit economic reporting for user acquisition (CPA, LTV, ROAS)
Analyze and interpret data from digital marketing channels (PPC, SEO, social media, email marketing, etc.)
Work closely with Product to gain a deep understanding of users, engagement, conversion, and retention through multivariate testing and exploratory analysis
Generate comprehensive reports and dashboards to communicate data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Work proactively to identify trends and provide actionable insights that will drive value for the company
Stay up to date on tooling and be willing to self-direct learning and development of new methodologies



Who You Are


4+ years experience in an analytical role, ideally with user acquisition experience
Proficiency in SQL
Framiliar with product analytics (e.g. Mixpanel, Amplitude)
Experience with a BI tool such as Tableau, Looker, Sigma
Experience with cloud data warehouses (Snowflake, Databricks)
Strong Excel, Powerpoint and Office Suite competency
Experience calculating marketing and unit economic metrics (CPA, LTV, ROAS)
Persuasive communicator and effective in soliciting and accepting feedback
Passionate about problem-solving, understanding trends, and forecasting, with a willingness to learn new tools/methodologies



Pluses:


Prior experience with programming using tools such as Python, R, Matlab, SPSS or SAS
Prior statistical modeling, data science, and predictive analytics experience
Prior CRM/Lifecycle Marketing experience (Salesforce, Iterable)
Experience with A/B testing and other optimization methods
Knowledge of SEO best practices and tools



Why Crexi:


Rapidly growing startup with a dynamic work environment
Flexible team structure with the ability to progress in career
Health, Dental, and Vision insurance
Collaborative culture and numerous team activities



The anticipated salary range for candidates who will work in our Playa Vista, California location is $102,000 to $145,000. The final salary offered to a successful candidate will depend on several factors, which may include, but are not limited to, the type and length of experience applicable to the role and within the industry, education, geographic location, etc. Commercial Real Estate Exchange, Inc (“Crexi”) is a multi-state employer, and this salary range may not reflect positions that work in other states.

Crexi is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Crexi will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Title: SQL Data Analyst
Description:
SQL Data Analyst

Employment Type: Contract-to-Hire (1-3 months CTH)

Workplace Type: Onsite

Location: Mission Hills, CA (91345)

Industry: Construction/Equipment Rentals

Compensation: $42-48 hourly

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Analyze and manipulate SQL data sets; test and debug issues with SQL reports; create and maintain SQL queries.
Assist in the development of monthly reports and visual dashboards of customer data, including billings, revenue, and transactions for C-Level executives and the finance team.
Manage, update, and maintain SQL databases.
Utilize statistical programming languages to create automation scripts for analyzing and reporting data
Extract, manipulate, and report data from financial and operations software systems.

REQUIREMENTS SKILLS:

Bachelor's or Associate's Degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related fields (Preferred)
3-5+ years of experience working in a Data Analyst role working in a fast-paced environment analyzing and reporting SQL data.
Ability to read, interpret, and created moderate to complete SQL query scripts.
Knowledge and expeirnece with SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)
Experiences using PowerBI or similar data visualization tools.
Familiarity Python scripting for data automation purposes
Strong skills with Microsoft Excel and experience using Pivot Tables and Formulas
Experience extracting, manipulation, and reporting data information from financial and operations systems.

BONUS SKILLS:

Certifications with SQL, Oracle, and Data Analytics
Experience and knowledge of Oracle databases and PL/SQL scripting.
Knowledge of Asset & Inventory Management and Sales/Rental Contract Management Software; familiarity with Basis Software is a huge plus!
Familiarity with Adobe products


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, age, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, or military or veteran status. We consider all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles' Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Overview:

ROR Partners is a rapidly growing, client-driven media marketing and data company. We offer proven marketing solutions to a variety of vertical industries on a nationwide basis. We are currently seeking an experienced Marketing Data Analyst to develop data driven media mix and overall business strategies, that lead to the development of strategic recommendations to support our clients in achieving all marketing and business objectives. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, marketing strategies, and proficiency in SQL to extract and manipulate data from our databases. As a Marketing Analyst, you will play a crucial role in helping us understand our market and industry trends, customers, and campaign performance to drive strategic decisions and optimize our marketing efforts. This position is 100% remote and salary expectations are $55k - $70k, determined by factors such as location, experience, and expertise.




Why you should join us!

Competitive salary, health and dental insurance, life and disability, 401K, supplemental insurance, FSAs, flexible paid vacation days/Holidays and much more!
Friendly, collaborative, and fun team!




Key Responsibilities:

Utilize SQL to extract, analyze, and interpret large datasets from our databases.
Develop industry trends and consumer insights leveraging our internal datasets and tools like Mintel, Placer. Ai, SEM RUSH, and our data visualization platform DOMO. 
Perform thorough data validation and ensure accuracy of all data used for analysis.
Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to track key performance indicators (KPIs) across various marketing channels.
Conduct in-depth analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement in marketing campaigns and client specific business objectives.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Media Operations, Client Services, Business Development, and Product to provide actionable insights and recommendations.
Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of media plans, and strategic initiatives.
Assist in developing integrated digital media strategies that may include some or all the following: Digital Display Paid Social, Paid Search, CTV, Digital OOH, Traditional OOH, Direct Mail, Paid Email, other Programmatic channels.
Demonstrate a strong understanding of the client’s business, the business problem-to-solve and the consumer experience.




Preferred Qualifications:

Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL).
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, or related field.
3-5 years of proven experience as a Marketing or Business Analyst or similar role.
Advanced proficiency in Excel or other data analysis tools.
Must be agile in using PowerPoint for client decks and simplified presentation of findings
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., DOMO, Tableau, Power BI)
Familiarity with Mintel, Placer. Ai and SEM Rush is a plus
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
Ability to communicate complex data findings clearly and effectively to stakeholders.
Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Experience in digital marketing or e-commerce is preferred.
Experience in the Fitness, Wellness, or Health Club space is preferred.
Fun to work with, embrace diversity and can be flexible.
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Excellent interpersonal skills
Strong at conducting research into consumer and industry trends
Approach responsibilities in the following way
Continuously drive innovation across the organization
Take ownership and drive results
Be eager to build and create when things are undefined
Build mutually supportive relationships across the organization
Demonstrate teamwork and humility in interactions with peers and entire organization




ROR Partners is an Equal Opportunity Employer. ROR Partners’ policy is not to discriminate against any applicant or employee based on actual or perceived race, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy), marital status, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, mental or physical disability, religion, creed, color, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (including transgender status), veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. ROR Partners also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these protected categories.




ROR Partners will provide accommodations to applicants as needed.

We are currently seeking an experienced Marketing Data Analyst to develop data driven media mix and overall business strategies, that lead to the development of strategic recommendations to support our clients in achieving all marketing and business objectives. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, marketing strategies, and proficiency in SQL to extract and manipulate data from our databases. As a Marketing Analyst, you will play a crucial role in helping us understand our market and industry trends, customers, and campaign performance to drive strategic decisions and optimize our marketing efforts. This position is 100% remote and salary expectations are $55k - $70k, determined by factors such as location, experience, and expertise.


Why you should join us!

  • Competitive salary, health and dental insurance, life and disability, 401K, supplemental insurance, FSAs, flexible paid vacation days/Holidays and much more!
  • Friendly, collaborative, and fun team!


Key Responsibilities:

  • Utilize SQL to extract, analyze, and interpret large datasets from our databases.
  • Develop industry trends and consumer insights leveraging our internal datasets and tools like Mintel, Placer. Ai, SEM RUSH, and our data visualization platform DOMO. 
  • Perform thorough data validation and ensure accuracy of all data used for analysis.
  • Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to track key performance indicators (KPIs) across various marketing channels.
  • Conduct in-depth analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement in marketing campaigns and client specific business objectives.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Media Operations, Client Services, Business Development, and Product to provide actionable insights and recommendations.
  • Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of media plans, and strategic initiatives.
  • Assist in developing integrated digital media strategies that may include some or all the following: Digital Display Paid Social, Paid Search, CTV, Digital OOH, Traditional OOH, Direct Mail, Paid Email, other Programmatic channels.
  • Demonstrate a strong understanding of the client’s business, the business problem-to-solve and the consumer experience.


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL).
  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, or related field.
  • 3-5 years of proven experience as a Marketing or Business Analyst or similar role.
  • Advanced proficiency in Excel or other data analysis tools.
  • Must be agile in using PowerPoint for client decks and simplified presentation of findings
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., DOMO, Tableau, Power BI)
  • Familiarity with Mintel, Placer. Ai and SEM Rush is a plus
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
  • Ability to communicate complex data findings clearly and effectively to stakeholders.
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Experience in digital marketing or e-commerce is preferred.
  • Experience in the Fitness, Wellness, or Health Club space is preferred.
  • Fun to work with, embrace diversity and can be flexible.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Strong at conducting research into consumer and industry trends
  • Approach responsibilities in the following way
  • Continuously drive innovation across the organization
  • Take ownership and drive results
  • Be eager to build and create when things are undefined
  • Build mutually supportive relationships across the organization
  • Demonstrate teamwork and humility in interactions with peers and entire organization


ROR Partners is an Equal Opportunity Employer. ROR Partners’ policy is not to discriminate against any applicant or employee based on actual or perceived race, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy), marital status, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, mental or physical disability, religion, creed, color, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (including transgender status), veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. ROR Partners also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these protected categories.


ROR Partners will provide accommodations to applicants as needed.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst




Type: Contract (3-6 months with Right-to-Hire)

Start Date: 9/30/24

Work Setting: Remote (AZ, FL, GA, IN, KY, NC, SC, TX)




The Jr. Data Analyst handles client exceptions and escalations, performs data analysis, and interfaces with peers and internal technical contacts. This role requires strong interpersonal and communication skills, a team-oriented and adaptable nature, and the ability to build and maintain strong working relationships. The Jr. Data Analyst contributes to company profitability through personal productivity and efficient resource use.




Primary Responsibilities:

Resolve data exceptions, validations, and field escalations from batch and API traffic.
Update patient and insurance information for accuracy.
Communicate technical issues and resolutions with team members and leadership.
Interpret, analyze, filter, and clean data.
Identify and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Collaborate with management on business and process improvements.
Adhere to program policies and procedures.
Analyze data to solve moderate scope problems within standard procedures.
Document and maintain business and functional requirements.
Maintain user confidence and protect business information confidentiality.




Minimum Requirements:

Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
Effective oral and written communication skills.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and demonstrate creative problem-solving.
Strong organizational and time management skills.
Adaptable and flexible.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Google Productivity Apps (Docs, Sheets, Slides).




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience auditing and reconciling records.
Quality monitoring and exception corrections.
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel (formulas, pivot tables, VLOOKUP).
Technological proficiency and ability to access data portals.
Strong critical thinking and analytical skills.
Knowledge of the healthcare industry, specialty pharma, and patient therapy methods.
Understanding of HIPAA regulations.
Bachelor’s Degree preferred.




Schedule:

Flexible schedule and hours.
Some travel may be required.




Kindly no C2C/C2H for this opportunity.

Title: Analista de datos (K-TIA)
Description:
¿Eres únic@?

Entonces eres KPMG Originals. Un modo de entender la vida y tu profesión diferente desde donde marcar la diferencia. Un modo de crecer en un ambiente profesional que busca cambiar las cosas, transformar las empresas y la sociedad.

Ven, alcanza tus metas, supera tus límites en un ambiente profesional único y únete a una firma que es más que una firma de Servicios Profesionales. Sé KPMG Originals.




En KPMG K-TIA (Tecnología e Innovación en Auditoría) contamos con un equipo excepcional, una amplia gama de servicios y de recursos tecnológicos adecuados, una potente red global y una clara estrategia para llegar al mercado. Por ello, nuestro equipo de Auditoría IT se encuentra en un proceso de expansión y captación de talento.

Actualmente, nos encontramos buscando un/a analista de datos para ampliar el equipo.




¿Qué podrás hacer?

Realizar pruebas de D&A en los trabajos de auditoría, siendo capaz de entregar un resultado de calidad y ajustado a los tiempos de ejecución esperados.
Desarrollo de soluciones en PowerBI en base a necesidades.




¿Qué necesitas saber?

Titulación: Grado en ADE (valorable especialización en D&A) o Ingeniería Industrial
Experiencia: 2-3 años de experiencia en análisis de datos contables
Conocimientos técnicos necesario: Excel avanzado, SQL básico, PowerBI avanzado
Valorable: experiencia en puesto similar, autonomía, capacidad para identificar necesidades y generar soluciones adecuada




¿Qué valor añadido te podemos aportar?

Un gran ambiente de trabajo, tanto dentro como fuera de la oficina
Oportunidades internacionales y red de contactos global
Formación continua y plan de carrera a tu medida
Salario competitivo y plan de remuneración flexible
31 días laborables de vacaciones
La tarde de tu cumpleaños libre
Flexibilidad y posibilidad de teletrabajo
Acceso a Kteam, nuestra plataforma de bienestar, servicios, solidaridad y promociones
Los beneficios pueden variar para programas de becas y/o prácticas

Nuestro compromiso en KPMG es promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género, religión, etnia, estado civil o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social. Y es que cada persona tiene un valor único y especial que aportar a la firma.

Nuestros valores marcan la diferencia. Marca la diferencia, impulsa tu talento.

Title: Data Analyst (Wait list)
Description:
Wait list

We have received an enormous amount of applications for this position. Therefore, new applicants will not be reviewed for now. We might open up review at a later moment.

In a nutshell.

You'll be a key person in unravelling complex analytical questions, from feature validation to fraud detection and more. Working together in a small team of data professionals, you'll transform raw data into actionable insights, present them to stakeholders and drive business change.

The role.

Check was founded to make cities more liveable by offering the easiest way around town. Our entirely in-house built platform offers more than half a million users in more than 15 Dutch cities access to thousands of mopeds and cars. To improve our offering, make our operations more efficient and to identify other opportunities to improve the value created at Check, we base our decisions on data.

As a Data Analyst you will be an essential actor in supporting and enabling these data-driven decisions, using various tools & techniques.

You'll be part of Check's Product Team. The Product Team builds and maintains Check's entire platform. This includes the user facing apps, internal tools and the Check Data Platform. You'll be working on analytical requests that are prioritised by the Product Owner. You'll work together with an experienced Data Engineer who will mentor and support you.

You're core responsibilities will be:


Identify, measure and report on key business metrics (KPIs) that help monitor performance of Check and support decision-making
Give actionable insights to complex problems, including statistical analyses for all business departments, such as Finance, Growth or Public Affairs
Present results in a comprehensive, attractive and understandable way
Improve data literacy at Check by sharing best practices and improving data quality and accessibility


Requirements.

What you will bring:


0-2 years experience as a Data Analyst or a comparable position
Experience with SQL is a prerequisite, working with a modern data warehouse (Redshift, BigQuery, Snowflake or similar)
Basic programming knowledge (Python)
Knowledge of statistical analysis
Knows how to present results using tools like Tableau, Superset, PowerBI or similar


Nice to haves:


Experience with Python-based dataframe libraries (Polars, Pandas, etc)
Knowledge of dbt or willingness to learn


Sponsorships & Remote work.

Check offers a visa sponsorship for non-EU applicants. This ONLY applies to applicants that are already residing in The Netherlands.

Permanent remote work is NOT an option.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (Junior 1-3 Years)
Description:
We are looking for a junior Data Analyst/Excel specialist that can help to create data input templates in Excel and Microsoft Forms in order to collect ESG data from different parties. The specifications for the templates and forms from and ESG perspective are clear, but we need help in developing the templates and forms. Besides developing the templates and forms, we want to create some automations with the use of MS Power Platform. The specialist needs deep knowledge on Excel, MS Forms, SharePoint, the MS Power Platform and experience in data collection.




Responsibilities:

Building the ESG data input templates & forms: using Excel, Microsoft Forms, Power Automate or similar readily available technologies to the specifications set by ESG Reporting and ESG Risk
Ensure the temporary data collection “tool” will be able to integrate with current and future Ingka Investments and /or Ingka Group, data platform(s), ESG Dashboard to be improved per specifications set by ESG Reporting and ESG Risk




Digital Skills Requirements:

Advanced Microsoft Excel. Able to create semi-advanced forms based on excel (e.g., with macros, protected sheets).
Microsoft Forms. Able to create (semi-advanced) MS forms
SharePoint.Able to design access control for shared document access in SharePoint
Power Platform. Able to create advanced review flows, logic to process incoming documents/forms, in integration with other Microsoft products, e.g., Forms, Outlook
Experience in data collection process
Show more

Title: Junior Insight Analyst
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT THIS JOB

The role will be analytical support for senior team members and Client Business Partners. A Junior Insight Analyst will be in support of 1 or several clients. This role will be part of an International Community with the expectation of being connected with other Support Centre Analysts and the broader International Analytical Community in order to encourage best practice sharing & collection.

Responsibilities


Assist with the execution of projects by compiling, analyzing, and interpreting sales data, writing client reports, and constructing presentations.
Analyze and interpret sales data and consumer data.
Summarize data in tables, charts, and graphs, review data for errors and inconsistencies.
Draft reports and presentations with simple data interpretation (category overview as well as issue-based).
Set up and refresh cyclical reports.
Support Client Business Partners and Nielsen Local Teams on quotations requested from Client
Connect as appropriate with the broader international analytic community for best practices approach understanding and sharing.


a Little Bit About You

Curiosity drives your interest in what moves the market. You find potential in percentages. Managing time and deadlines comes naturally to you.

Qualifications


University degree or a last year student in Business/Marketing/Economics or related field
Strong numerical, analytical and written presentation skills
Very good knowledge of Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint
Good written and spoken communication skills in English
Results-oriented personality and ability to work to tight deadlines
Strong interpersonal skills in a multicultural setting
Ability to work both independently and as an enthusiastic team player
Comfortable working in a virtual environment
Interest in the FMCG industry is an asset


Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

data coherence across systems due to the business requirements

stakeholder management

Title: Data Analyst @Mercedes-Benz Financial Services
Description:
Mercedes-Benz Financial Services is the brand finance company of the Mercedes-Benz Group. Our goal? To offer mobility and financing solutions to all customers and lovers of our star.




We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our Online Sales and Loyalty team. The objective is that through descriptive analytics and diagnosis, insights and recommendations can be generated that support better decision-making and help increase the conversion of the online channel.




For this reason you have to be able to work autonomously and that you like it. In addition, you have to be independent but in a highly collaborative environment. We are looking for a professional who is passionate and motivated by data and their work, ready to be challenged and challenged!




Responsibilities:




Perform a variety of analyses to discover audiences and behaviors in CRM, with the goal of finding and implementing new use cases.
Create audiences so that they can be used for A/B testing, CRM activations and even Paid Media.
Be able to define KPIs for the evaluation of marketing activations and verify that these measurements are technically possible
Evaluate the success of personalized actions and define the next steps due to learning.
Identification of Insights with clear commercial recommendations.
Be able to perform query Google Cloud.
Work as a team with the IT & BI areas to collaborate in the evaluation of data quality and build new data, tools, etc.




Qualification:




Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Economics or another degree with a strong analytical content
Total mastery of Excel, SAS and SQL (knowledge of other programming languages such as R or Python will be an asset)
English level B1.2 or above, with at least 3 years of experience in a comparable position, transforming data to extract key business insights using statistical/analytical concepts




Skills:




Independent, motivated, proactive and ready to take responsibilities to the next level
Be able to work in a team
Be an organized but adaptable and flexible person in the face of a dynamic and changing environment
Be eager to learn and understand the goals and needs of the business
Excellent communication skills, being able to translate the execution of technical data into insights and business recommendations
Customer-centric and problem-solving with communication skills that favor multidisciplinary work

Show more
HTML:
Mercedes-Benz Financial Services is the brand finance company of the Mercedes-Benz Group. Our goal? To offer mobility and financing solutions to all customers and lovers of our star.


We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our Online Sales and Loyalty team. The objective is that through descriptive analytics and diagnosis, insights and recommendations can be generated that support better decision-making and help increase the conversion of the online channel.


For this reason you have to be able to work autonomously and that you like it. In addition, you have to be independent but in a highly collaborative environment. We are looking for a professional who is passionate and motivated by data and their work, ready to be challenged and challenged!


Responsibilities:


  • Perform a variety of analyses to discover audiences and behaviors in CRM, with the goal of finding and implementing new use cases.
  • Create audiences so that they can be used for A/B testing, CRM activations and even Paid Media.
  • Be able to define KPIs for the evaluation of marketing activations and verify that these measurements are technically possible
  • Evaluate the success of personalized actions and define the next steps due to learning.
  • Identification of Insights with clear commercial recommendations.
  • Be able to perform query Google Cloud.
  • Work as a team with the IT & BI areas to collaborate in the evaluation of data quality and build new data, tools, etc.


Qualification:


  • Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Economics or another degree with a strong analytical content
  • Total mastery of Excel, SAS and SQL (knowledge of other programming languages such as R or Python will be an asset)
  • English level B1.2 or above, with at least 3 years of experience in a comparable position, transforming data to extract key business insights using statistical/analytical concepts


Skills:


  • Independent, motivated, proactive and ready to take responsibilities to the next level
  • Be able to work in a team
  • Be an organized but adaptable and flexible person in the face of a dynamic and changing environment
  • Be eager to learn and understand the goals and needs of the business
  • Excellent communication skills, being able to translate the execution of technical data into insights and business recommendations
  • Customer-centric and problem-solving with communication skills that favor multidisciplinary work

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are collaborating with a large Irish organisation seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst to join their analytics team. Leveraging your technical prowess and commercial insight, you will support a diverse range of stakeholders through top-notch reporting and insightful analysis.




Responsibilities:

Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to deliver impactful insights, reporting, and visualizations using Power BI.
Conduct deep-dive analyses to identify opportunities for revenue growth, operational efficiencies, and improved processes.
Engage in data governance activities, including data cleansing, consolidation, documentation, and process enhancement.
Facilitate training sessions for staff on Power BI to enhance their analytical capabilities.
Proactively address and resolve data issues across the organization.




What You Will Have:

A minimum of 3 years of experience in a data analyst role.
Strong proficiency in Power BI.
Experience with SQL; knowledge of Python or R is a plus.
The ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences.
A proven track record of driving actionable insights from data and presenting them to non-technical stakeholders.
Comfort working in a fast-paced environment and navigating ambiguity. You should be adept at problem-solving and confident in taking ownership of your work.




This position offers excellent exposure across the business within a collaborative team. To thrive in this role, you must possess a natural curiosity and a critical thinking mindset towards business challenges. If you are interested in learning more, please apply.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join a dynamic consultancy at the forefront of leveraging data to drive impactful insights and innovations across various sectors. As a Data Analyst at our client’s company, you will play a major role in transforming raw data into actionable strategies for some of the most influential organizations in banking, government, and non-profit sectors in the Netherlands. Their work spans from enhancing financial security to streamlining governmental processes and empowering non-profits to maximize their outreach.




Your Role




As a Data Analyst, you will harness your expertise in data analysis and visualization to uncover critical insights from customer data. Your responsibilities will include




Developing clear and insightful visualizations to facilitate decision-making.
Collaborating closely with clients to understand their needs and deliver tailored solutions.
Proposing enhancements to data quality and infrastructure to sustainably maximize data value.
Engaging with both business stakeholders and IT teams to ensure alignment and effectiveness of data initiatives.




Ideal Candidate




A minimum of 2 years in complex data environments.
Proficiency in tools like Tableau, Power BI, Oracle BI, Python, and/or R.
Strong familiarity with SQL and data-related concepts such as ETL, data modeling, and data visualization.
A degree in a relevant field and a passion for turning data into actionable insights.
Dutch speaker




The good part




A competitive salary starting from €3500 gross per month, depending on experience
Monthly & Annual performance bonuses
Pension plan.
Mobility allowance or company car
Up to 27 days of vacation annually
A lovely work environment where your ideas directly impact success of the company
Opportunities for career advancement and personal development in a flat organizational structure




Do you see yourself in the job description?




Apply directly or send your CV at g.apostolou@jeffersonfrank.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Investing.com, the leading global financial news & data platform, is on the search for a Data Analyst with a strong background in Tableau and Python to join our growing team.




What you’ll be doing:




Utilizing Tableau to develop interactive and informative dashboards as well as data visualizations
Leveraging Python for data preparation and construction of simple data pipelines.
Collaborating with various departments to support the end-to-end process of report building: gathering requirements, interpreting business issues, defining metrics and KPIs, and creating reports/dashboards
Perform Ad-Hoc data analysis for various departments
Analyzing large datasets to derive actionable insights, identify key trends, and inform decision-making
Constructing SQL queries for data extraction and performing advanced data analysis to meet business needs
Building, maintaining, and optimizing data pipelines to ensure accurate and efficient data flow into reports and dashboards
Engaging in User Acceptance Testing (UAT) with stakeholders to ensure the final product meets the intended goals
Effectively communicate insights and findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders




What you’ll bring:




Proven experience with Tableau for creating compelling and insightful data visualizations
Proficient in Python for data wrangling and preparation (no machine learning involvement)
Solid understanding of SQL and relational databases for report and dashboard data requirements
Demonstrated ability in conducting thorough data analysis and turning data into understandable insights
Experience in monitoring and reporting on key business metrics and performance indicators.
A bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field, or equivalent experience
Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and a data-driven mindset.
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a dynamic, fast-paced environment




Who we are:




Investing.com was founded in 2007 and has grown to a robust team of over 350 employees across the globe. With over 60 million monthly unique visitors and more than 4 billion page views, we are a leading voice in the global financial community. Our platform provides comprehensive coverage of a wide array of financial instruments and markets, offering top-tier tools and insights to our audience — at no charge.

What we offer:

The opportunity to join a premier platform for financial markets enthusiasts and professionals
Work that is both challenging and rewarding, with a chance to make an impact both locally and globally
A work culture that encourages creativity and innovation, while also emphasizing individual growth and team collaboration

If you are self-motivated, detail-oriented, and looking to join a high-energy team, check out our openings on our career website: https://www.investing-careers.com/

Our Privacy Policy: We take confidentiality seriously; rest assured that your resume and personal details will be kept private.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Posizione: Data Analyst

Luogo: Milano/Hybrid Work




Descrizione dell'azienda:

BDO Italia è in continua evoluzione e crescita, e recentemente ha annunciato la creazione di BDO InTech Srl, una nuova divisione dedicata alla Digital Transformation. BDO InTech si unisce alle altre divisioni di BDO in Italia con l'obiettivo di ampliare la gamma di servizi offerti per supportare la crescita delle aziende sia italiane che internazionali nel contesto macro-economico attuale. Questa nuova divisione si concentra su fornire soluzioni specifiche in aree come AI & Data Analytics, Retail Planning, Enterprise Performance Management, ERP e Enterprise Content Management. Tra i clienti di BDO InTech figurano già importanti brand dei settori fashion luxury, manufacturing e servizi.

Per il nostro Team di Milano siamo alla ricerca di un Data Analyst per contribuire alla nostra missione di guidare le principali realtà enterprise italiane e non verso la Trasformazione Digitale tramite l’Intelligenza Artificiale e la Data Analytics.




Descrizione del lavoro:

Il/la candidato/a ideale sarà un/una Data Analyst con una combinazione vincente di competenze tecniche e spiccato Business Sense.

Siamo alla ricerca sia di profili junior/intermediate (dai neolaureati a profili con almeno 2 anni di esperienza) sia profili middle-senior (dai 3 ai 6 anni di esperienza).

Il ruolo prevede la responsabilità di implementare processi ETL, creare modelli di reportistica e analisi in Power BI, definire KPI, scrivere script di automazione in Python e analizzare e riprogettare processi aziendali esistenti per aumentarne l'efficienza.




Responsabilità principali:

Implementazione processi ETL, sviluppo e gestione architettura BI per supportare processi aziendali data-driven e generare insight utili per prendere decisioni informate
Raccogliere, integrare e analizzare dati provenienti da varie fonti per identificare pattern, tendenze e insight per ottimizzare i processi aziendali
Definizione di KPI per monitorare la bontà di algoritmi/processi
Creazione di modelli di reportistica e analisi in Power BI (Dashboard interattive) e redigerne la relativa documentazione (manuali utente)
Scrittura di semplici script di automazione in Python o metodi alternativi per ottimizzare le operazioni di elaborazione dei dati
Implementazione di controlli qualità e integrità del dato
Collaborazione con altre funzioni aziendali e stakeholder interni ed esterni per identificare le esigenze e garantire che le analisi siano allineate agli obiettivi




Requisiti (Hard Skills):

Laurea in Economia, Ingegneria, Informatica, Matematica, Statistica o altre discipline affini;
Ottima conoscenza del Pacchetto MSOffice e tecnologie di Business Intelligence, in particolare Power Query e Power BI (DAX)
Buona conoscenza di SQL server/Python
Conoscenza strumenti ETL (Azure Data Factory)
Capacità di disegnare e progettare soluzioni di data modeling (E-R)
Conoscenza delle tecniche di Data Visualization




Requisiti (Soft Skills):

Hai una mentalità analitica che ti consente di approcciarti ai dati e alle situazioni in modo critico, identificando soluzioni e prendendo decisioni rapide e consapevoli
Eccellente comprensione del business e capacità di tradurre i requisiti aziendali in soluzioni tecniche
Esperienza lavorativa in società di consulenza direzionale o informatica sarà considerata un forte plus
Proattività, flessibilità, innovazione, determinazione, organizzazione
Sai lavorare in gruppo, collaborare, gestire progetti e compiti complessi
Ottime doti comunicative




Cosa offriamo:

Ambiente di lavoro dinamico e stimolante.
Opportunità di crescita professionale e formazione continua.
Collaborazione con un team di esperti nel campo dell’intelligenza artificiale e dell’analisi dei dati.
Progetti innovativi e sfidanti con clienti di rilevanza nazionale e internazionale.

  • Progetti innovativi e sfidanti con clienti di rilevanza nazionale e internazionale.

Title: Analista de Datos
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Somos una de las cadenas de alimentación y supermercados más importantes del mundo y creadores del Descuento. Nuestra historia se remonta a 1945, cuando los hermanos Theo y Karl Albrecht se encargaron del negocio de ultramarinos que su familia regentaba desde 1913 en Essen (Alemania). Desde nuestros inicios, siempre hemos tenido en cuenta lo importante que es conocer al cliente y darle lo que necesita al mejor precio. En España abrimos el primer supermercado en 2002 y ya tenemos más de 440 establecimientos




Nos importa el bienestar de las personas: nuestros clientes, nuestro equipo y nuestro entorno. En nuestra compañía, en pleno crecimiento, siempre hay oportunidades laborales para diferentes perfiles profesionales y oportunidades de desarrollo y crecimiento profesional.




Durante estos 100 años, hemos establecido con nuestros clientes una relación de confianza y hemos cubierto sus necesidades diarias. Llevamos el principio de sencillez en nuestro ADN, es nuestra ventaja competitiva y esto nos lleva al éxito como compañía y nos hace sentir orgullosos/as de seguir generando empleo en España. El camino no siempre es fácil, pero cada paso suma. Sabemos que el éxito llega del trabajo en equipo y estamos orgullosos/as de avanzar juntos/as.




Si tienes una mentalidad fuerte, eres tenaz, avanzas con firmeza, cuentas con cualidades para generar una experiencia positiva en las personas que acuden a comprar a nuestras tiendas y quieres alcanzar tus objetivos con un buen equipo... ¡Te invitamos a dar lo mejor de ti y a formar parte de este emocionante camino!




Sencillamente ALDI. Nuestra fuerza son las personas.




Misión del/de la Analista de Datos

Facilitar la toma de decisiones estratégicas y la mejora continua de nuestros procesos a través del análisis riguroso de datos, del desarrollo de herramientas de visualización y de la gestión eficiente de la información. Nuestra misión es convertir los datos en insights accionables que impulsen la eficiencia operativa, la innovación y el crecimiento empresarial, asegurando al mismo tiempo la calidad y la integridad de la información compartida en toda la organización.




Responsabilidades

Analista de datos: Utilizar técnicas estadísticas avanzadas para realizar análisis comparativos entre diferentes muestras de datos, identificar patrones significativos, tendencias, evaluar la correlación entre variables o llevar a cabo tests de impacto para medir el efecto de ciertas variables en los resultados analíticos.
Desarrollo de soluciones: Diseño, desarrollo e implementación de soluciones “end-to-end” para la recopilación, procesamiento y análisis de datos, con foco en la accionabilidad, pero también en la escalabilidad y la facilidad de mantenimiento.
Gestión de proyecto: Gestionar el ciclo completo de vida del proyecto, desde la toma de requerimientos hasta la entrega final, asegurando la calidad y cumplimiento de plazos.
Toma de requerimientos: Colaborar estrechamente con los distintos stakeholders y usuarios para entender las necesidades del negocio y traducirlas en soluciones técnicas efectivas, útiles y fáciles de mantener y escalar.
Optimización del rendimiento: Identificar oportunidades para mejorar el rendimiento de consultas SQL, procesos ETL y modelos analíticos, asegurando la eficiencia operativa del sistema y con foco en la facilidad de comprensión y mantenimiento.
Data governance: Colaborar en la implementación y cumplimiento de políticas y procedimientos de data governance para garantizar la calidad, integridad, seguridad y disponibilidad de los datos en toda la organización.
Data quality: Evaluar la calidad de los datos mediante la identificación y resolución de problemas como duplicados, inconsistencias o valores atípicos, aplicando técnicas y herramientas para mejorar la fiabilidad de los datos.
Mantenimiento y documentación: Documentar los procesos, modelos y decisiones tomadas durante el desarrollo, así como mantener actualizada la documentación técnica para facilitar el mantenimiento futuro.
Seguridad de la información: Asegurar en lo posible que sólo las personas autorizadas tengan acceso a las herramientas e informes compartidos desde Research & Analytics.







Requisitos

Formación Universitaria en Ingeniería, Matemáticas, Estadística, Economía o similar.
Formación complementaria en Análisis de Datos, Minería de Datos, Business Intelligence o áreas afines.
Al menos 2 años de experiencia en el desarrollo “end-to-end” de proyectos de Data & Analytics, desde la toma de requerimientos a la construcción y entrega de la herramienta final.
Experiencia previa en la gestión de proyectos, incluyendo la toma de requerimientos, planificación, seguimiento y comunicación con stakeholders.
Nivel avanzado de SQL y modelos de datos (índices, particiones, claves primarias y foráneas tipos de modelos de datos, normalización, etcétera).
Experiencia en el uso de lenguajes de scripting (R o Python) como ETL (creación de paquetes, refactorización de código, etcétera).
Fuertes habilidades analíticas y capacidad para interpretar datos complejos.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y capacidad para trabajar en equipo.
Nivel avanzado de PowerBi (o herramientas similares).
Conocimientos avanzados en técnicas estadísticas y análisis de datos, incluyendo la realización de pruebas de hipótesis y análisis multivariante.




Lo que ALDI ofrece:

📍 Ubicación en nuestras oficinas de Sant Cugat del Vallés.

🌍Posibilidad de formar parte de una multinacional en expansión.

🚀Posibilidades de crecimiento dentro de la empresa.

🏷Descuento en nuestros productos.

💳Plan de retribución flexible.

💻64 días de teletrabajo al año.

🕗Flexibilidad horaria.

📚Formación continua.

👩‍🏫Clases de Idiomas.

✔️ Contrato indefinido.

🙌 Buen ambiente de trabajo.

Show more

Llevamos el principio de sencillez en nuestro ADN, es nuestra ventaja competitiva y esto nos lleva al éxito como compañía y nos hace sentir orgullosos/as de seguir generando empleo en España. El camino no siempre es fácil, pero cada paso suma. Sabemos que el éxito llega del trabajo en equipo y estamos orgullosos/as de avanzar juntos/as.


Si tienes una mentalidad fuerte, eres tenaz, avanzas con firmeza, cuentas con cualidades para generar una experiencia positiva en las personas que acuden a comprar a nuestras tiendas y quieres alcanzar tus objetivos con un buen equipo... ¡Te invitamos a dar lo mejor de ti y a formar parte de este emocionante camino!


Sencillamente ALDI. Nuestra fuerza son las personas.


Misión del/de la Analista de Datos

Facilitar la toma de decisiones estratégicas y la mejora continua de nuestros procesos a través del análisis riguroso de datos, del desarrollo de herramientas de visualización y de la gestión eficiente de la información. Nuestra misión es convertir los datos en insights accionables que impulsen la eficiencia operativa, la innovación y el crecimiento empresarial, asegurando al mismo tiempo la calidad y la integridad de la información compartida en toda la organización.


Responsabilidades

  • Analista de datos: Utilizar técnicas estadísticas avanzadas para realizar análisis comparativos entre diferentes muestras de datos, identificar patrones significativos, tendencias, evaluar la correlación entre variables o llevar a cabo tests de impacto para medir el efecto de ciertas variables en los resultados analíticos.
  • Desarrollo de soluciones: Diseño, desarrollo e implementación de soluciones “end-to-end” para la recopilación, procesamiento y análisis de datos, con foco en la accionabilidad, pero también en la escalabilidad y la facilidad de mantenimiento.
  • Gestión de proyecto: Gestionar el ciclo completo de vida del proyecto, desde la toma de requerimientos hasta la entrega final, asegurando la calidad y cumplimiento de plazos.
  • Toma de requerimientos: Colaborar estrechamente con los distintos stakeholders y usuarios para entender las necesidades del negocio y traducirlas en soluciones técnicas efectivas, útiles y fáciles de mantener y escalar.
  • Optimización del rendimiento: Identificar oportunidades para mejorar el rendimiento de consultas SQL, procesos ETL y modelos analíticos, asegurando la eficiencia operativa del sistema y con foco en la facilidad de comprensión y mantenimiento.
  • Data governance: Colaborar en la implementación y cumplimiento de políticas y procedimientos de data governance para garantizar la calidad, integridad, seguridad y disponibilidad de los datos en toda la organización.
  • Data quality: Evaluar la calidad de los datos mediante la identificación y resolución de problemas como duplicados, inconsistencias o valores atípicos, aplicando técnicas y herramientas para mejorar la fiabilidad de los datos.
  • Mantenimiento y documentación: Documentar los procesos, modelos y decisiones tomadas durante el desarrollo, así como mantener actualizada la documentación técnica para facilitar el mantenimiento futuro.
  • Seguridad de la información: Asegurar en lo posible que sólo las personas autorizadas tengan acceso a las herramientas e informes compartidos desde Research & Analytics.



Requisitos

  • Formación Universitaria en Ingeniería, Matemáticas, Estadística, Economía o similar.
  • Formación complementaria en Análisis de Datos, Minería de Datos, Business Intelligence o áreas afines.
  • Al menos 2 años de experiencia en el desarrollo “end-to-end” de proyectos de Data & Analytics, desde la toma de requerimientos a la construcción y entrega de la herramienta final.
  • Experiencia previa en la gestión de proyectos, incluyendo la toma de requerimientos, planificación, seguimiento y comunicación con stakeholders.
  • Nivel avanzado de SQL y modelos de datos (índices, particiones, claves primarias y foráneas tipos de modelos de datos, normalización, etcétera).
  • Experiencia en el uso de lenguajes de scripting (R o Python) como ETL (creación de paquetes, refactorización de código, etcétera).
  • Fuertes habilidades analíticas y capacidad para interpretar datos complejos.
  • Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y capacidad para trabajar en equipo.
  • Nivel avanzado de PowerBi (o herramientas similares).
  • Conocimientos avanzados en técnicas estadísticas y análisis de datos, incluyendo la realización de pruebas de hipótesis y análisis multivariante.


Lo que ALDI ofrece:

📍 Ubicación en nuestras oficinas de Sant Cugat del Vallés.

🌍Posibilidad de formar parte de una multinacional en expansión.

🚀Posibilidades de crecimiento dentro de la empresa.

🏷Descuento en nuestros productos.

💳Plan de retribución flexible.

💻64 días de teletrabajo al año.

🕗Flexibilidad horaria.

📚Formación continua.

👩‍🏫Clases de Idiomas.

✔️ Contrato indefinido.

🙌 Buen ambiente de trabajo.

Title: Junior Data Analyst | Lisboa
HTML:
A Decskill nasceu em 2014 como uma Empresa de Consultoria em Tecnologia da Informação e com a premissa que o seu maior ativo são as suas pessoas. Com o propósito de criar valor através do conhecimento e do talento, a Decskill promove uma cultura de excelência e investe no desenvolvimento e bem-estar dos colaboradores. Com mais de 600 profissionais dedicados e escritórios em Lisboa, Porto, Madrid e Luxemburgo, a Decskill atua hoje em três áreas de negócio:


• Decskill Talent: Acreditamos que as nossas pessoas são fundamentais para o nosso sucesso de todos. Através da Decskill Talent, capacitamos e acompanhamos equipas em desafios da transformação digital dos nossos clientes. Colaboramos com os clientes na sua estratégia de transição digital e inovação, garantindo o sucesso do projeto e o crescimento do negócio.


• Decskill Boost: O nosso compromisso com o talento estende-se a novos modelos de desenvolvimento e colaboração. Dotando a nossa equipa com as mais recentes ferramentas, metodologias e melhores práticas, otimizamos o Time-to-Market e entregamos soluções inovadoras que superam expectativas do cliente.


• Decskill Connect: Na Decskill Connect, a equipa Decskill colabora de perto com os clientes para implementar e gerir infraestruturas de tecnologia da informação que geram valor a longo prazo.


O sucesso da Decskill é construído pelo foco nas nossas pessoas e pela capacidade de enfrentar os desafios da transformação digital com agilidade e flexibilidade. Criamos valor não só para os nossos clientes, mas também para todo o nosso ecossistema onde fomentamos uma comunidade digital dedicada ao crescimento dos negócios através da tecnologia.


Procuramos um Junior Data Analyst para um projecto híbrido em Lisboa.


Responsabilidades:

  • Recolha de informação e elaboração de relatórios de apoio à tomada de decisão;
  • Análise de dados provenientes de sistemas comerciais e/ou analíticos;
  • Estudos de mercado;
  • Modelação de dados no Data Warehouse;
  • Reportes e dasboards.


Requisitos:

  • Formação em dados ou engenharia;
  • Gosto por dados e análise;
  • Domínio do Excel;
  • Conhecimentos de inglês.


Se a oportunidade corresponde às suas expectativas envie-nos o seu CV para o e-mail catia.carvalho@decskill.com, com a referência “CC/DA”.


A Decskill assume um compromisso de igualdade e não discriminação com todos os seus talentos. Recrutamos e promovemos talento, com base na diversidade e inclusão, independentemente da idade, género, etnia, raça, nacionalidade ou qualquer outra forma de discriminação incompatível com a dignidade da pessoa humana.

Title: Analista business intelligence
HTML:
Per il nostro Gruppo cerchiamo una figura di Business Analyst che opererà all’interno della unità di Business Intelligence, a supporto in particolare del settore Retail Omnichannel.



About the Role


  • Elaborare e analizzare dati di business (come vendite, KPIs, ST%, coverage e altri parametri chiave) utilizzando i tools di analisi di dati;
  • Analizzare in modo proattivo e costante il trend per identificare punti critici / definire action plan;
  • Sviluppo di nuovi standard reports su base weekly e monthly per valutare performance vs target e per supportare i diversi team ed il personale dei negozi;
  • Fornire Executive summary e report ad-hoc in base ai trend del mercato, con informazioni rilevanti per il business e feedback qualitativi;
  • Monitorare livelli di stock e copertura per garantire il raggiungimento degli obiettivi di vendita e di sell-thru;
  • Supporto nel processo di Forecast;
  • Indagine delle attuali metriche utilizzate o mancanti, in funzione dello sviluppo del nuovo sistema BI;
  • Lavoro a stretto contatto con IT per l’implementazione del nuovo sistema di BI;
  • Ricerca di eventuali data issues in collaborazione con IT ed i relativi partner commerciali allo scopo di avere dati consistenti a tutti I livelli;
  • Gestire o creare le relazioni con i differenti stakeholders


Qualifications


Il candidato/a ideale ha conseguito una laurea ad indirizzo economico. Possiede una solida esperienza di almeno 2-3 anni in un ruolo analogo, preferibilmente nel settore Retail e/o in società di consulenza strategica.


Il candidato/a possiede ottime capacità di pensiero strategico orientato al business, problem solving, capacità di riconoscere le priorità e di gestire il tempo in funzione di queste, capacità di lavorare in team e di agire con proattività in contesti dinamici.

Richiesta elevata conoscenza di Excel; nice to have: Power BI.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description: In this role, you will be the key link between Commercial and Finance teams. You will be the Subject Matter Expert responsible for Sales Force Metrics and Performance & KPI tracking. You will also coordinate contract management in collaboration with Sales, Legal, and the EMEA contract management team. Your role involves providing sales, volume, and financial analysis to evaluate business opportunities and generate market intelligence presentations for internal and external use. Occasionally, you may join customer meetings as a consultant. You should possess strong business acumen, combined with analytical and local thinking, to translate data into actionable commercial strategies and reports.




Responsibilities:

Act as the local admin and champion for Salesforce (SFDC).
Gather and share market data and insights (GFK) to detect and share market opportunities.
Conduct commercial customer analysis on category, channel, distribution, and product.
Provide in-depth analysis for Strategic Partner Accounts.
Coordinate and follow up on contract management.
Process third-party sell-out data and update the Customer Performance Dashboard (Excel).
Collaborate closely with National Sales Managers (NSMs) to support SFDC KPI metrics and performance reporting.
Provide volume and financial analysis to evaluate financial results.
Create toolkits for field sales representatives to enhance business opportunities.
Analyze the market for new products and trends, identifying opportunities and potential threats.
Support and implement regional and local strategies with the Benelux commercial team.
Work with Marketing on campaign processes, registration, and tracking.
Handle customer contract administration with local Key Account Management and regional headquarters to ensure a smooth contract process.
Manage and maintain the CRM system as the admin for Salesforce (territory management, user setup, data validation, managing sales reps, reporting, and dashboards).
Handle customer segmentation from a finance perspective, in consultation with the regional manager.
Consult with the EMEA team about data quality and make necessary changes (Cognos, SFDC, Oracle).
Produce ad-hoc reports as needed.




Candidate Profile:

Start as soon as possible, with a one-year contract and potential for permanent hire.
36-40 hours per week.
1-3 years of experience;
Strong knowledge and experience with Excel are a must.
Experience with Salesforce, SQL, and/or Tableau is a plus.
Reports to the Business Controller.
Salary between €45,000 and €65,000 depending on experience, with an annual performance bonus of approximately 10%.
30 vacation days.
Background in economics/finance.
Team player who enjoys being in the office, proactive, good at data interpretation and presentation, and enjoys interacting with colleagues and stakeholders.
Fluent in Dutch.
Hybrid work model: 3 days in the office, 2 days at home.
Affinity with medical devices is considered a plus.




Qualifications:

Hard Skills:

Experience with Business and financial analysis
Superior Excel skills (pivot tables, macros, lookups, sum if, complex link files)
Database management (Cognos and preferably Tableau)
Project management
Computer skills (word processing, spreadsheet, database tools, design tools, and presentation/chart applications)
Salesforce
Forecasting and statistical modeling
Advanced database and Excel skills
Cognos reporting and Hyperion (training can be provided)
Relevant degree (business/management/economics/finance)

Soft Skills:

Effective communication across all levels
High accuracy and attention to detail
Fluent in Dutch and English
Commercial mindset
Excellent analytical skills
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Teamwork and collaboration
Proactive and self-motivated
Adaptability and flexibility




Desired Skills and Experience

Excel (pivot tables, macros, lookups)

Salesforce (SFDC)

SQL

Tableau

Cognos

Oracle

Hyperion

Title: Data Analyst - Departamento Financiero
Description:
🌍“Cuidar de las personas y empresas para hacer del mundo un lugar más seguro, manteniéndonos a la vanguardia de la innovación” es lo que nos motiva desde hace más de 40 años.

Y lo hacemos utilizando las tecnologías más punteras (IA, IoT, Data Science, Blockchange, etc.) para ofrecer soluciones disruptivas a través de nuestras cinco líneas de negocio: Security, Cash, Alarms, Cipher y AVOS.




Dentro de Movistar Prosegur Alarmas, queremos incorporar un Data Analyst para el departamento financiero.




Su principal misión será asegurar y garantizar la extracción y disponibilidad de los datos procedentes de:

· Impactos económicos asociados a la oficina de Revenue Assurance

· Optimización de los ingresos generados en el corto y largo plazo, para apoya el crecimiento del negocio

· Identificación de puntos de mejoras en los procesos operativos E2E del negocio para mejorar identificar capturas de ingresos

· Crear nuevos procesos e involucrarse en los proyectos de la compañía actuando como enlace entre los equipos de Sistemas y Procesos, la infraestructura IT, Data Architect y los BI Developers del departamento.




👨‍💻 ¿Qué responsabilidades vas a tener?

Preparar la extracción, presentación y normalización de los datos requeridos a partir de diferentes fuentes, formatos, proveedores y BBDD. Y con ello, analizar la información disponible para elaborar controles de seguimiento que permitan a la compañía identificar incidencias en el ciclo de vida del cliente.
Realizar el seguimiento diario de la carga de datos, que servirá para identificar la causa raíz de los principales errores a nivel de facturación que tengamos.
Participa, junto con el equipo de la Dirección Financiera en la medición de la consecución de los objetivos de revenue leaks, definiendo indicadores y realizando seguimiento de su consecución, analizando desviaciones y efectuando propuestas.
Colabora en el diseño de planes de acción y mejora, participando en el desarrollo e implantación de nuevos indicadores operativos y metodología para extraer y analizar datos significativos, concretos y fiable.
Estudia la evolución de las mejoras implantadas y su impacto en los resultados, poniendo en en marcha las acciones correctoras pertinentes.




🙋‍♀️¿Qué perfil estamos buscando?




Formación en Ingeniería Tecnica o Superior / Grado en Informática, Estadística, ADE, Computación o Sistemas de Información.
Uso avanzado de herramientas ofimáticas Excel, Power Point, Business Object
Conocimientos técnicos en base de datos, SQL, Plataformas Cloud, Business Intelligence.
Manejo de Cuadros de Mando e Indicadores.
Experiencia de 2 años en data.
Sería un plus si has trabajado con Salesforce
Inglés.




📑¿Qué te ofrecemos?




Contrato indefinido.
Salario según Valía del candidato: Fijo + variable
Formato Híbrido de teletrabajo.
Trabajar en un entorno dinámico con un excelente ambiente laboral
Participar en proyectos estratégicos y disruptivos
Crecer profesionalmente atendiendo a un plan carrera personalizado
Acceder a un plan formativo de primer nivel gracias a la Universidad Corporativa de Prosegur
Disponer de flexibilidad horaria y de interesantes beneficios sociales
Disfrutar de nuestro Programa Global de Bienestar
Colaborar con nuestra Fundación para crear una sociedad más justa.




🧑🏻‍🤝‍🧑Si quieres formar parte del equipo Movistar Prosegur Alarmas, ¡Aplica a esta vacante para comenzar tu aventura con nosotros! Estamos deseando conocerte.

  • Crecer profesionalmente atendiendo a un plan carrera personalizado
  • Acceder a un plan formativo de primer nivel gracias a la Universidad Corporativa de Prosegur
  • Disponer de flexibilidad horaria y de interesantes beneficios sociales

🧑🏻‍🤝‍🧑Si quieres formar parte del equipo Movistar Prosegur Alarmas, ¡Aplica a esta vacante para comenzar tu aventura con nosotros! Estamos deseando conocerte.

Title: Data & Insights Analyst
Description:
We are the Nestlé Nespresso SA Company and are proud to be one of the fastest growing operating unit of Nestlé. Our passionate, entrepreneurial-minded team has transformed Nespresso into the reference in portioned coffee and one of the world’s most trusted brands. Our growth comes from our commitment to research and development in order to pioneer and be the reference in the portioned coffee sector to provide the very highest quality coffees that could be enjoyed in the comfort of consumers' own homes and also savored at out-of-home locations, such as restaurants, hotels, offices and luxury retail businesses. We guarantee quality by taking a careful, thoughtful approach in how we source our ingredients, produce and market our premium coffee products. With corporate headquarters in Lausanne, Switzerland, Nespresso is present in over 60 countries and counts over 12,000 employees worldwide. To learn more visit www.nespresso.com.

We are looking for a Data & Insight Analyst to be part of our Customer Journey Analytics Team

Position Snapshot


Location: Esplugues de Llobregat
Type of contract: Permanent, Full time.
Team: Insights, Analytics and Data Science
Work Language: Business Fluent English


The Role

The Data & Insights Analyst plays a critical role in leveraging data to provide strategic insights, supporting decision-making processes and driving continuous improvement within the Customer Journey Analytics team.

What You´ll Do


Provide Reports and Ad-Hoc analysis on customer data sales such as monthly KPIs, markets performance, campaign pre and post analysis, channels and products performance.
Analyze complex issues and be able to significantly improve, change or adapt existing methods and techniques according to business needs (from different functions: Finance, CRM, Coffee, Retail, Consumer...).
Build and share with CRM team (marketes and HQ) insignts and recommendations based on customer centric activities.
Be responsible on guiding and supporting Markets and Zones with business decisions.


Minimum Qualifications


Min 2 years hands-on experience in Data Analytics / Business Analytics / CRM / Reporting, incluidng experience in data mining related activities.
Able to query databases and other information sources independently.
Excellent knowledge of at least one reporting / data mining tool: SQL, Snowflake, KNIME, Power BI.
Excellent Analytical Skills.


Bonus points if you


Have experience in reporting, retention activities, statical modelling, digital analytics.
International exposure or experience in working with international teams.


People are at the heart of our success - all 14,000 of them for Nespresso globally. We actively cultivate diversity, inclusion and belonging in the workplace. We celebrate individuality, believing that your authenticity and uniqueness can help us to grow and thrive together

#Nespresso
Show more

  • Provide Reports and Ad-Hoc analysis on customer data sales such as monthly KPIs, markets performance, campaign pre and post analysis, channels and products performance.
  • Analyze complex issues and be able to significantly improve, change or adapt existing methods and techniques according to business needs (from different functions: Finance, CRM, Coffee, Retail, Consumer...).
  • Build and share with CRM team (marketes and HQ) insignts and recommendations based on customer centric activities.
  • Be responsible on guiding and supporting Markets and Zones with business decisions.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Min 2 years hands-on experience in Data Analytics / Business Analytics / CRM / Reporting, incluidng experience in data mining related activities.
  • Able to query databases and other information sources independently.
  • Excellent knowledge of at least one reporting / data mining tool: SQL, Snowflake, KNIME, Power BI.
  • Excellent Analytical Skills.

Bonus points if you

  • Have experience in reporting, retention activities, statical modelling, digital analytics.
  • International exposure or experience in working with international teams.

People are at the heart of our success - all 14,000 of them for Nespresso globally. We actively cultivate diversity, inclusion and belonging in the workplace. We celebrate individuality, believing that your authenticity and uniqueness can help us to grow and thrive together

#Nespresso

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Como Business Data Analyst serás la persona responsable de liderar la transformación y digitalización de las herramientas de análisis de datos dentro del departamento financiero de OYSHO.




Buscamos personas proactivas, con capacidad para trabajar en equipo y excelentes habilidades de comunicación y presentación. Disponibilidad para trabajar de forma 100% presencial.




Tus responsabilidades:




Extracción, procesamiento y organización de datos.
Conceptualización, diseño y construcción de cuadros de mando en Power BI.
Junto con el departamento, definición y cálculo de KPIs avanzados aplicando las reglas de negocio.
Análisis de los modelos de datos financieros.
Participar en la elaboración de informes estratégicos.







Tu perfil:




Formación superior en Ingenieria o ADE.
Valorable Máster en Data Analytics for Business.
Experiencia de al menos 3-4 años como Data Analyst y digitalización de procesos.
Amplia experiencia con bases de datos, SQL. y Python.
Habilidades solidas en visualización de datos en Power BI.
Valorable experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos predictivos y machine learning.
Atención al detalle, garantizando precisión e integridad en todos los análisis.
Pasión por el mundo de la moda.
Excelente nivel de Excel.
Excelente nivel de inglés.




¿Qué ofrecemos?




Formando parte del equipo de Oysho, tendrás la oportunidad de trabajar con compañeros de más de 15 nacionalidades.
Cuerpo sano, mente sana. Disfruta de nuestro servicio de comedor subvencionado con una gran variedad de comida saludable, Fresh Coffee y fruta fresca gratuita todos los días.
En Oysho valoramos tu comodidad, por eso te ofrecemos un servicio de autobús con salida desde diferentes puntos repartidos por Barcelona, Mataró y Vallés para tus desplazamientos a la oficina. En caso de que vengas en tu propio coche, disponemos de plazas de aparcamiento y punto de carga subvencionado para coches eléctricos.
Saca partido a nuestro gimnasio, disfruta de la sala fitness y no te pierdas nuestras clases dirigidas.
La clave del éxito está en el constante aprendizaje. A través de TRAIN, nuestra plataforma de e-learning, podrás acceder a diferentes cursos formativos, charlas y contenidos que te permitirán crecer y desarrollarte.
Si ya te habíamos convencido, las ventajas no acaban aquí. Al formar parte del grupo INDITEX, disfrutarás de un 25% de descuento en todas nuestras marcas.




“En Oysho estamos comprometidos con la igualdad de oportunidades.”
