Title: Analista de datos
Description:
¡¡Acabamos de abrir una posición que va a ser de tu interés!!

Estamos buscando un Data Analyst especializado en PowerBI, SQL y Excel para una empresa final TOP enfocada en el sector de energías renovables. Además de ofrecerte un proyecto muy retador en uno de los mercados más importantes del momento, otorga buenos planes de carrera y de formación.

Te indico a continuación las características de la posición:

Mínima experiencia de 2 años realizando funciones de analista de datos.
Experiencia en PowerBI, SQL y Excel.
Inglés: B2

Si perfilas y quieres saber más sobre la posición y proceso, envía tu CV actualizado a victoria.basagoiti@hays.es.

Un saludo y nos vemos pronto,

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Haarlem/Hybrid




As a Data Analyst/Engineer, you work with customer data to uncover valuable insights. Your goal is to visualize and present these insights in the most comprehensible way, ensuring that even those unfamiliar with data can understand. Your contributions drive the success of strategies and aid companies in their growth and innovation.




You propose improvements to the data landscape and data quality, aiming to create sustainable value in both the short and long term. You foster connections within the client's organization, engaging with both business and IT sectors. You swiftly identify which data analyses will be valuable, producing realistic and actionable insights.




If you thrive in a data-rich environment and enjoy extracting value from vast datasets, this role will suit you perfectly.




You have:

At least 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst in complex data environments.
A keen eye for detail and a passion for accuracy.
Strong communication skills and the ability to understand customer needs.
Experience with data analytics and visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, Oracle BI, Python, and R.
Familiarity with ETL, data modeling, data quality, and data visualization.
Proficiency in SQL.
Fluency in Dutch.




We offer a career with growth prospects within a vibrant community of enthusiasts. Your work directly impacts both our organization and our clients, giving you significant responsibility in a challenging role where passion and the opportunity to enhance the 'Customer Experience' through data analysis are key. We are a flat organization where everyone knows each other and fun is a priority.




We offer:

24 vacation days per year (increasing to 27).
A monthly performance bonus.
Eligibility for an annual bonus.
A solid pension plan.
A company car or mobility scheme.
An annual trip abroad!

Title: Alternant Data Analyst HF
Description:
Au sein de l'équipe IT d'Acoem, vous participerez activement à 2 missions stratégiques :

- Migration de notre système ERP Sage X3 actuel vers la dernière version disponible intégrant de nouveaux process et de nouvelles fonctionnalités

- Mise en place d'un outil BI de pilotage de l’ensemble du groupe Acoem.

- Vous pourrez être amené à travailler sur d’autres projets d’analyse/transformation de données.

Missions :

- En tant qu'alternant Data Analyst, vos missions consisteront à :

- Analyser et assurer la qualité et la cohérence des données migrées vers le nouveau système ERP ou intégrées à notre plateforme BI

- Participer activement aux différentes phases des projets, depuis la conception jusqu'à la mise en œuvre, en passant par le test des fonctionnalités

- Contribuer à la création et au déploiement d'un outil de pilotage groupe, permettant une analyse fine des performances et une aide à la décision stratégique

- Élaborer des rapports périodiques et des dashboards dynamiques pour le suivi du projet et l'analyse des performances

- Assister les utilisateurs dans la prise en main des nouveaux outils, en fournissant formation et support technique

Ce que nous recherchons :


- Actuellement en cours de formation en Informatique, Data Science, Statistiques, Mathématiques appliquées, ou un domaine connexe, Bac+3 à Bac+5

- Une spécialisation en gestion de données, analyse de données ou Business Intelligence serait un plus

- Connaissance des principaux systèmes de gestion de base de données (SQL) et des langages de requête associés

- Capacité à transformer les données brutes en informations exploitables grâce à des techniques d'analyse

- Idéalement, une expérience avec les outils de Business Intelligence tels que Looker, Power BI, Tableau, ou équivalents pour la création de dashboards

- Autonomie et proactivité

- Esprit d'équipe et communication

- Bon anglais indispensable

Title: BI Data Analyst
Description:
Lisbon. 100% On-site position




(NOTE: all certificates must be attached to the application in order to be consider)




The BI Business Analyst will integrate our Quality Department and play a key role in analysing data and generating actionable insights to drive organisational decision-making.




Responsibilities

Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to identify their data needs and define clear analytics objectives that support business goals.
Design, develop, and maintain scalable analytics frameworks, leveraging SQL and Power BI to extract, transform, and analyse datasets.
Create compelling, clear, concise reports and dashboards using Power BI, ensuring business users can easily understand and act upon the insights provided.
Conduct data validation and error-checking processes to guarantee the reliability and accuracy of analytics outputs, thereby upholding the trust in data-driven decision-making.
Identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data to provide actionable insights that guide business strategies and decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data analysis needs and provide guidance on how best to use data to achieve objectives.
Keeping up to date with emerging trends and technologies in BI and data analysis and continually looking for ways to improve the organisation's data analysis processes and practices.

Requirements

Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Business Management, Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Analysis or related fields.
+1 year of experience in Power BI for developing reports, dashboards, and data visualisations.
Previous experience in data analysis, preferably in a corporate environment.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present analysis results clearly and understandably.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with a strong focus on results.
Fluency in English and Portuguese (written and spoken).




We Offer:

Attractive salary package;
Vibrant culture, in a company that is actively involved in social responsibility;
Integration in a dynamic, passionate and enthusiastic team;
Equal opportunity mindset and encouragement to be innovative;
Personal and professional development;
Contact to a demanding industry with challenging projects;
Company-sponsored events, parties and concerts;
Fruit basket, milk, coffee, tea, amazing wine and beer;
Lots of fun and games (Shuffleboard, Ping-pong, foosball, library, bingo, etc.).




Enjoy the unique experience of working at MULTIVISION! If you are interested in this role, please send us your CV and certificates (mandatory) motivation letter.







MULTIVISION is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and workplace. We value diversity at our company regardless of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, citizenship, marital status or disability status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst

Munich, 2 days a week in office

€70,000 - €90,000 per year




Venture Up are working with a leading travel tech company based in Munich and they are recruiting for a Senior Data Analyst to join their team on a permanent basis.




You will be part of the Data Analytics team where you will focus on supporting different departments in the company to continuously improve their product and operations by building data pipelines, defining and maintaining KPIs to create visualisations and performing ad-hoc analysis that help the organisation make data-driven decisions.




Tech Stack

Database: AWS Stack (Redshift, Athena, Glue, S3).
Data Pipelines: Airflow, DBT.
Data Visualization: Looker.
Data Analytics: SQL, Python.
Collaboration: Git.




Responsibilities

As a Senior Data Analyst in the team, you will work directly with stakeholders to assist with problem-solving, prioritization, and insights generation, including KPI definition and ad-hoc data analysis.
Own the end-to-end data flow to provide stakeholders with valuable insights: data collection, extraction, cleaning, and aggregation.
Build and maintain systematic reporting and dashboards in Looker to foster a self-service data culture.
Perform complex ad-hoc analyses and predictive analytics projects on large data sets using SQL and Python.




Experience required

4+ years of work experience in analytics with a proven track record of business impact. Experience in e-commerce analytics is a plus.
Advanced SQL skills, including experience with ETL pipelines and data modelling, to build systems supporting data analytics.
Proficiency in a structured programming language such as Python or R.
Ability to generate insights and tell a story from large data sets, using data visualization tools (Looker experience is a plus).




Senior Data Analyst

Munich, 2 days a week in office

€70,000 - €90,000 per year

Title: Data Analyst - Departamento Retenciones
Description:
🌍“Cuidar de las personas y empresas para hacer del mundo un lugar más seguro, manteniéndonos a la vanguardia de la innovación” es lo que nos motiva desde hace más de 40 años.

Y lo hacemos utilizando las tecnologías más punteras (IA, IoT, Data Science, Blockchange, etc.) para ofrecer soluciones disruptivas a través de nuestras cinco líneas de negocio: Security, Cash, Alarms, Cipher y AVOS.




Dentro de Movistar Prosegur Alarmas, queremos incorporar un Data Analyst que se encargue de la definición, elaboración, seguimiento e interpretación de los informes para dar soporte al equipo de retención y cobros.




Buscamos un profesional con marcada mentalidad analítica, enfocado en el detalle y con capacidad para trabajar en varios proyectos de manera simultánea gestionando los tiempos de entrega.




¿Qué responsabilidades va a tener?




· Contribución a la toma de decisiones relacionadas con el área de retención y cobros, aportando la información necesaria.

· Desarrollo de análisis a medida solicitados por el Comité de Dirección.

· Definición, diseño y desarrollo de KPIs e Informes de Seguimiento.

· Elaboración y mantenimiento de informes periódicos y cuadros de mando.

· Coordinación con el resto de departamentos para asegurar la correcta interpretación de la información y detectar posibles inconsistencias en los datos.

· Gestión de las peticiones y nuevos desarrollos solicitados a las áreas de BI e IT relacionados con el área.




¿Qué necesitamos?

· Formación Universitaria en Matemáticas, Estadística, ADE, Ingeniería o similar.

· Mínimo de 2 años de experiencia en posiciones relacionadas.

· Experto en el manejo de Excel.

· Conocimientos de SQL.

· Conocimientos de Power Point.

· Capacidad de trabajo en equipo y de gestionar varios proyectos de forma simultánea.

· Capacidad analítica, con mucho foco en el detalle.




¿Qué vamos a valorar?

· Formación complementaria de posgrado en Análisis de Datos.

· Conocimientos de Salesforce

· Experiencia en el manejo de Power BI.

· Experiencia en proyectos de Geomarketing.




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Contrato indefinido.
Salario según Valía del candidato: Fijo + variable
Formato Híbrido de teletrabajo.
Formar parte de un equipo internacional
Trabajar en un entorno dinámico con un excelente ambiente laboral
Participar en proyectos estratégicos y disruptivos
Crecer profesionalmente atendiendo a un plan carrera personalizado
Acceder a un plan formativo de primer nivel gracias a la Universidad Corporativa de Prosegur
Disponer de flexibilidad horaria y de interesantes beneficios sociales
Disfrutar de nuestro Programa Global de Bienestar
Colaborar con nuestra Fundación para crear una sociedad más justa







Si quieres convertirte en un auténtico Prosegurer, ¡aplica a esta vacante para comenzar tu aventura con nosotros! Estamos deseando conocerte.

· Experiencia en proyectos de Geomarketing.


¿Qué ofrecemos?

  • Contrato indefinido.
  • Salario según Valía del candidato: Fijo + variable
  • Formato Híbrido de teletrabajo.
  • Formar parte de un equipo internacional
  • Trabajar en un entorno dinámico con un excelente ambiente laboral
  • Participar en proyectos estratégicos y disruptivos
  • Crecer profesionalmente atendiendo a un plan carrera personalizado
  • Acceder a un plan formativo de primer nivel gracias a la Universidad Corporativa de Prosegur
  • Disponer de flexibilidad horaria y de interesantes beneficios sociales
  • Disfrutar de nuestro Programa Global de Bienestar
  • Colaborar con nuestra Fundación para crear una sociedad más justa



Si quieres convertirte en un auténtico Prosegurer, ¡aplica a esta vacante para comenzar tu aventura con nosotros! Estamos deseando conocerte.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re one of the world's leading carsharing platform, with millions of users around the world, sharing thousands of cars in over 950 cities across 8 countries.

Our mission is simple: Make our cities better places to live through carsharing.

Carsharing empowers people to move in a smarter and more sustainable way: studies show that one shared car replaces between 4 and 10 privately owned cars, which frees up space in our cities while giving communities 24/7 access to cars when they need them.

With our connected car technology, users can quickly and easily book and unlock a wide variety of vehicles directly from our app, without ever having to meet anyone in person, carry an access card, wait in line, or coordinate picking up keys.

To reach our vision of a world where all cars are shared, we need a strong team to help us disrupt car ownership. We look for people who are curious, positive, and engaged; who can adapt and learn quickly; who have the skills and smarts to reach their goals autonomously, while having the generosity and mindset to work collaboratively. No matter your role, background, or level of experience, we believe that every member of the team can have an impact.

We’re extremely proud to be certified in the “Best Workplaces” in 2023 !

The Opportunity


You'll belong to an international data team composed of 20 members, and will report to Isaure , our Head of Data Analytics for Demand & Marketing.
You’ll be a key member of our Demand tribe (focusing on our drivers), partnering closely with pricing, growth and product managers to steer the demand side of our business. You’ll take part in understanding the dynamics in our marketplace to actively contribute to its optimization.
As a data analyst, you’ll help build a comprehensive view of our users’ experience to understand the current challenges and solve complex problems through data. Your analyses will fuel the Demand team with data-backed insights that can have a direct impact on our users and market. You’ll also be in charge of designing and maintaining data tools to support and empower multiple stakeholders across the company.
We invite you to listen to our VP of Data & BI’s podcast with DataGen to better understand how our data organization works.


What You'll Do


You'll work on cross-functional analytics initiatives end to end:
Collaborate with engineers to make sure we structure, collect and process data in an accurate and timely manner. You'll own your processing pipelines (SQL) and be responsible for tests and documentation.
Conduct exploratory analysis: partner with relevant stakeholders to frame the business problem, deep dive into data to uncover insights, and discuss how to action themShare your recommendations to cross-functional stakeholders, using meaningful reports and visualizations.
Design KPIs and monitor their performance towards our objectives.
Empower the team by building ground truth data sets and evangelizing data tools to your stakeholders.


Example Of Projects You Will Work On


Be the analyst for strategic initiatives : monitor the performance of new business lines Provide advanced monitoring and data tools to support our revenue optimization business teams.
Help shape the roadmap to evolve our pricing algorithms through exploratory data analysis, data modeling and backtesting.
Build tracking specifications and features monitoring plans to monitor the performance of our Product releases.


Our Stack


Snowflake data warehouse, ELT managed with Airflow and dbt, our own Segment-like integrations, BI/visualization tools such as Tableau and Metabase, Python notebooks in Hex.


What You'll Bring


3 to 5 years experience in Data/BI roles in a tech environment.
Background in quantitative fields eg Maths, Statistics, Engineering or Business with very strong analytical skills and a willingness to learn more technical skills.
A strong interest in product: you think about possible product improvements in your day-to-day interactions with any app
Strong ability to turn complex data into actionable insights in a fast-paced environment
Strong experience with writing SQL queries, joining large datasets from multiple sources.
Experience with Python or other data-oriented programming languages is a strong plus.
Attention to detail: you like to understand the fine technicalities of things, and build reliable and resilient data models.
Communication: you’re excellent at summarizing any problem and explaining the big picture, both in written and verbal form. You share information proactively.
Fluency in English: you can work in English on a daily basis.


Would Be a Strong Plus


A prior experience with marketplaces or marketing analytics.
Environmental awareness/interest in mobility: interest in car ownership environmental impact and/or mobility is a strong plus.


👉 If your profile doesn't check all of the above yet, you can still apply, and we’ll let you know if we think this position can be a good fit for you

Why Join Us


🌎 Getaround Europe is a fast-growing startup located in the center of Paris, with global headquarters in San Francisco and an office in Oslo. We offer one of the most dynamic and diverse company cultures in town, and give every employee the opportunity to grow and the power to define their impact at Getaround.
🌱 The opportunity to have a positive impact on climate change. Cars are responsible for 17% of carbon emissions. In France, an independent study has shown that each connected car shared on Getaround replaces more than 5 self-owned cars.
🧠 A place to learn and grow with weekly 1 on 1 meetings with your manager, frequent 360° feedback from your teammates, personal objectives to develop your potential, optional annual training, plus a team wiki that you’ll contribute to improve
🌐 An international team and company: our product is live in the US, France, Norway, Germany, Spain, Belgium and Austria.
🏡 A remote friendly policy: this position is based in our Paris office with up to 3 days of remote work per week.
📝 A monthly subsidy to cover part of your work-related expenses at home
🤝 Getaround is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity, equity and inclusion of all our Getarounders
🗓 Unlimited 30% vouchers for your Getaround bookings
💫 Health insurance
🍽 A Swile lunch card
💻 Apple equipment


Come join us!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
#ThriveatMMDSmart

Would you like to build a career in a leading multinational IT company?

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team.

Since 2007, MMDSmart has been a leading supplier in cloud communications, delivering game-changing IT products to businesses in over 100 countries. Our success is fueled by the inspiration and innovative ideas of our team members, encouraging their growth and impacting our Messaging and Voice solutions. These empower our clients to communicate more effectively with their customers. Don't miss this chance to excel in a rapidly expanding tech company, where your potential and ambitions are not just recognized, but celebrated.

Requirements

What will you do at MMDSmart?


Communication with Business Process Owners, identifying KPIs;
Communicate with development teams to identify data sources, data lifecycle analysis;
Developing in collaborate with Data Engineer on the data storage structure in DWH, Data Lakes;
Developing dashboards in analytical platforms;
Presenting analytical results to customers;
Developing and supporting analytical systems for operational analysis and decision making


You are a perfect match if you have:


Experience as Data/Product/Business/BI analyst 1+ years;
Understanding the principles of business process analysis, KPI identification, AB tests, and auditory analysis;
Programming: SQL, Python as +, database principles;
Analytical mind, communication and presentation skill, team working skills



Benefits

Why do talents choose and stay at MMDSmart?

Embrace the opportunity to work in a company that cares about:

Your Wellness: Access to mental health programs, comprehensive medical insurance, and a sports card*.

Your Happiness: Enjoy the company of cool teammates, a friendly atmosphere, a strong mentorship, and a variety of bonuses & corporate gifts.

Your Development: Benefit from free educational events & courses, and English classes with native speakers.

Your Career: Focus on your professional development in a supportive environment.

Work-Life Balance: Choose your working format - remote, office-based, or hybrid and engage in team-building activities.

Think this role's got your name on it? Go ahead and apply, we'd love to see what you've got!

Equal-Opportunity Employment

We are an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.


Medical Insurance and Sport Card perks are available for employees located in Bulgaria

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us :

As the European market leader, NEXTLANE develops and delivers digital solutions for the automotive industry by connecting the systems of manufacturers and dealers.

We develop integrated end-to-end software and digital solutions that digitize and simplify the entire automotive customer journey.

Our mission is to empower our clients to boost their business operations and optimize their customer experience through innovative solutions. Our comprehensive software suite revolutionizes every aspect of new and used vehicle sales and management.







📋 Context of the Position :

Primary function is to collect, analyze, and interpret data to help the company make informed and strategic decisions. Use data analytics tools to examine trends, patterns, and correlations that can influence business performance.




Work closely with other departments to identify areas for improvement and opportunities to optimize processes and increase operational efficiency. Develop reports and presentations that clearly and concisely communicate the results of the analyses to senior management and other key stakeholders.




The role reports directly to the Chief of Staff of the CEO, topics are then very diverse and exposition to senior leadership is a given.







🎯 Your responsibilities :

As a key member of our team, you'll be responsible for...




Collect and analyze data related to the automotive sector, including sales data, inventory, marketing, and other key performance indicators.
Identify trends and patterns in data to provide valuable insights to product development and marketing teams.
Create clear and concise reports and presentations to communicate findings to management and other departments.
Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to improve data-driven decision-making.
Develop and maintain predictive models and data analysis to enhance operational efficiency and increase company profitability.
Identify opportunities for process improvement and optimization based on data.
Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in data analysis and apply them in the company.







🕵️ What we are looking for :




Experience:

Bachelor's degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science, or a related field.

Experience and skills in data analysis is a must have

Experience and skills in data science and AI is a nice to have




Languages:

Fluent level of English

Professional competency in French is a nice to have




Technical Skills:

Statistics, databases and information systems.

Professional level of Excel and PowerBI (or similar)

Advanced knowledge of data analysis tools (SQL, R and Python…) is a nice to have

Any knowledge of automation or data platform tools (DBT,Alteryx, Knime, Make, Snowflake, Databricks…) is a nice to have




Soft Skills:

Ability to work independently and in a team.

Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Ability to manage multiple projects and meet established deadlines.







🤝 Our Recruitment Process:

30-minute call with our Talent Acquisition Specialist.
Two interviews with our Hiring Managers to evaluate your technical and soft skills.




Join us and be part of the Nextlane adventure that is shaping the future of the automotive industry!







💎 Our Advantages

We value flexibility and trust within our corporate culture, offering benefits that reflect our commitment to our teams:

🏡 Possibility to telework up to 3 days a week!

🤝 €600 referral bonus for each talent you capture. (after the 6-month trial period).

🍱 Flexible Remuneration (COBEE).

👩 ⚕️ Medical Insurance (Adeslas).

📒 Access to a dedicated internal training platform for continuous learning.

🌴 23 days of vacation. Intensive day July and August.







🤝 Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging:




We are committed to enabling everyone to feel included and valued in the workplace. We believe that the company and its culture are strongest when they are made up of diverse experiences and backgrounds.

We welcome applications from people with disabilities. If you are a person with a disability and need help, please let us know so we can talk about how we can best support and make any adjustments that may be necessary.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of age, color, family, gender identity, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.







🌍 What does it mean to work at Nextlane?




Join a young and fast-growing company, where you can work on new and ambitious projects.

International and multicultural environment.

Collaboration between colleagues.




We truly believe that Nextlane is a great place to work and develop your talent! Sign up for our offer and find out why.

Title: Data Analyst I - PPC
Description:
The successful candidate will join the Data Science & Analytics team in PCC (Pay-per-click), where we develop strategies to manage Booking’s search engine marketing budget (one of the largest online advertising budgets in the world). The team supports the commercial and machine learning teams with reporting, insights and experimentation. The Data Analyst I will be responsible for analyzing and reporting on our Paid Search marketing channel & activities, leveraging the data from various proprietary models and experiments. Beyond the analytical aspect, they will be expected to effectively communicate with Senior stakeholders and technical peers and take part in strategic planning. They will be key in ensuring that data is leveraged with maximum impact, as well as take the lead on projects. Finally, domain knowledge of (Performance) Marketing is a big plus, but not a requirement.

Job Summary

Data Analysts I work on analytics tasks such as reporting, visualization and analysis within the scope of their team. They consult with stakeholders in problem-definition, setting success metrics and shaping the way forward through data insights and effective communication with their audience.

Data Analysts I have experience managing stakeholders and can do this largely autonomously (seeking for help in complex scenarios). They prioritize their work for business impact, efficiently adapt to business needs, and manage expectations accordingly.

They combine their understanding of the business with the knowledge of data, workflows, methods and tooling to largely autonomously drive analysis and reporting within the scope of their team. They can adapt existing tooling and approaches based on business and user needs. They collaborate with peers in their craft and follow best practices ensuring data quality and stability.

What You’ll Be Doing


Responsible for owning the design and delivery of parts of Data Analytics & Reporting solutions based on business requirements, contributing to bringing them from the initial idea-generation phase to implementation with some supervision.
Responsible for working independently on consuming data, preparing it for analytical use and translating business problems to data stories. Can ask for guidance on more complex tasks.
Responsible for working within the scope of their team and delivering work that informs business decisions for the product / business topic they currently work on.
Responsible for leveraging foundational skills in data analysis and data visualization to answer business questions. They incorporate stakeholder requirements when creating intuitive and insightful visualizations that translate data into actionable insights.
Responsible for connecting and collaborating with stakeholders in operational and project-based roles under the guidance of a manager. Uses effective communication to address their needs and presents data insights in an accessible, business-friendly manner.
Responsible for being flexible in adopting existing internal Data Analytics approaches and expanding their technical competencies when a more efficient way presents itself.
Responsible for growing their own craft skills while leveraging Data Analytics for impact on well defined business problems.
Responsible for supporting junior peers when opportunity presents itself through knowledge sharing and setting a good example.
Responsible for networking and proactively connecting with craft peers beyond the team's scope.
Must be familiar with the larger data ecosystem at Booking and how it relates to the work they do.
Responsible for connecting with peers in related crafts (ie. Data Engineering) as needed on specific projects to ensure successful outcomes.
Must have high level knowledge about the goals of their area (ie. track / vertical).
Responsible for ensuring quality of their own work by validating it through peer review.



What You’ll Bring


High SQL proficiency is essential (Python and/or R are beneficial) as well as data cleaning and preparation
Has strong data visualization skills and experience with dashboarding tools such as Tableau
Able and willing to develop and manage enterprise level performance reports
Capable of driving actions from stakeholders and providing self-service analytics & visualization tools
Strong analytical problem solving skills, especially unstructured problems
Ability to communicate recommendations in a compelling way that is tailored to the audience
Driven with a results oriented personality and curious mindset
Able to identify dependencies on other functions and align across these functions
Experience working in an experimentation culture and able to process & interpret results
Experience with analytics in decision making where AB testing is not possible
Can explain complex analytical findings/solutions to commercial and non-technical stakeholders
Open to feedback and always looking for ways to improve own performance
Able to understand details while keeping an eye on the bigger picture.
Able to spot opportunities to drive business growth from their craft.
Strong interpersonal skills
Open and friendly attitude
Strong data management skills with a focus on data quality (timeliness & correctness)



In return, we’ll provide


Headquarters located in one of the most vibrant cities in Europe: Amsterdam!
A fast-paced company that offers 29 vacation days, career advancement, and competitive compensation, including bonuses and stock potential
Training, occasional opportunities to travel and attend global conferences
Discount on Booking.com accommodations with the “Booking.com Benefit” besides other perks and benefits
Company-sponsored community and social activities to help our employees become integrated with each other and the Dutch culture
Diverse, unique colleagues from every corner of the world



Booking.com is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

Pre-Employment Screening

If your application is successful, your personal data may be used for a pre-employment screening check by a third party as permitted by applicable law. Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre-employment screening may include employment history, education and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the position.

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Responsible for owning the design and delivery of parts of Data Analytics & Reporting solutions based on business requirements, contributing to bringing them from the initial idea-generation phase to implementation with some supervision.
  • Responsible for working independently on consuming data, preparing it for analytical use and translating business problems to data stories. Can ask for guidance on more complex tasks.
  • Responsible for working within the scope of their team and delivering work that informs business decisions for the product / business topic they currently work on.
  • Responsible for leveraging foundational skills in data analysis and data visualization to answer business questions. They incorporate stakeholder requirements when creating intuitive and insightful visualizations that translate data into actionable insights.
  • Responsible for connecting and collaborating with stakeholders in operational and project-based roles under the guidance of a manager. Uses effective communication to address their needs and presents data insights in an accessible, business-friendly manner.
  • Responsible for being flexible in adopting existing internal Data Analytics approaches and expanding their technical competencies when a more efficient way presents itself.
  • Responsible for growing their own craft skills while leveraging Data Analytics for impact on well defined business problems.
  • Responsible for supporting junior peers when opportunity presents itself through knowledge sharing and setting a good example.
  • Responsible for networking and proactively connecting with craft peers beyond the team's scope.
  • Must be familiar with the larger data ecosystem at Booking and how it relates to the work they do.
  • Responsible for connecting with peers in related crafts (ie. Data Engineering) as needed on specific projects to ensure successful outcomes.
  • Must have high level knowledge about the goals of their area (ie. track / vertical).
  • Responsible for ensuring quality of their own work by validating it through peer review.


What You’ll Bring

  • High SQL proficiency is essential (Python and/or R are beneficial) as well as data cleaning and preparation
  • Has strong data visualization skills and experience with dashboarding tools such as Tableau
  • Able and willing to develop and manage enterprise level performance reports
  • Capable of driving actions from stakeholders and providing self-service analytics & visualization tools
  • Strong analytical problem solving skills, especially unstructured problems
  • Ability to communicate recommendations in a compelling way that is tailored to the audience
  • Driven with a results oriented personality and curious mindset
  • Able to identify dependencies on other functions and align across these functions
  • Experience working in an experimentation culture and able to process & interpret results
  • Experience with analytics in decision making where AB testing is not possible
  • Can explain complex analytical findings/solutions to commercial and non-technical stakeholders
  • Open to feedback and always looking for ways to improve own performance
  • Able to understand details while keeping an eye on the bigger picture.
  • Able to spot opportunities to drive business growth from their craft.
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Open and friendly attitude
  • Strong data management skills with a focus on data quality (timeliness & correctness)


In return, we’ll provide

  • Headquarters located in one of the most vibrant cities in Europe: Amsterdam!
  • A fast-paced company that offers 29 vacation days, career advancement, and competitive compensation, including bonuses and stock potential
  • Training, occasional opportunities to travel and attend global conferences
  • Discount on Booking.com accommodations with the “Booking.com Benefit” besides other perks and benefits
  • Company-sponsored community and social activities to help our employees become integrated with each other and the Dutch culture
  • Diverse, unique colleagues from every corner of the world


Booking.com is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

Pre-Employment Screening

If your application is successful, your personal data may be used for a pre-employment screening check by a third party as permitted by applicable law. Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre-employment screening may include employment history, education and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the position.

Title: Junior Analytics Consultant
Description:
Job Description

About the job

As a Junior Analytics Consultant you will be working with several FMCG Clients that operate in Poland. This role is designed to deliver industry insights and enable decision making and work independently or with support of senior person in delivering additional detailed, actionable recommendations to the FMCG Clients in response to their questions.

Responsibilities


Prepare sales data summaries and data interpretation
Analyze and interpret sales data to drive conclusions on market trends
Execute projects, with support of senior person, by compiling, analyzing, and interpreting sales data, writing Client reports, and constructing presentations
Delivering quantified recommendations and value added to the Clients
Present ready analysis in front of the Client
Generate leads for Account Development team via recommendations and deep understanding of Client needs


A Little Bit About You

Curiosity drives your interest in what moves the market. You find potential in percentages. Managing time and deadlines comes naturally to you. You want to make things better, easier, simpler. You are not waiting for somebody to do things for you, but you take the initiative and ownership, and you deliver.

Requirements


min. 1 year of analytical experience
Strong numerical, analytical and presentation skills
Very good knowledge of Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint
Very good written and spoken communication skills in English (B2 level) and fluent Polish
Results-oriented personality and ability to work to tight deadlines
Client-centric and solution-oriented approach
Strong interpersonal skills in a multicultural setting
Ability to work both independently and as an enthusiastic team player
Comfortable working in a virtual environment
Interest in the FMCG industry


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Visualization Analyst
HTML:
Are you constantly looking for ways to improve yourself? Find the opportunities you seek at AROBS! Connect to your passions! Do things differently.

We are looking for creative, smart, and passionate people who stand out for their expertise and good communication skills.

We admire people with ambition who constantly challenge their own limits to achieve outstanding results.


Responsibilities:


  • Transform data sets, quantitative and qualitative analysis into compelling visuals;
  • Provide visual, technical, and editorial guidance;
  • Storytelling through data visualization;
  • Operational Report and Dashboard (Power BI).


Qualifications:


  • Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Statistics, Advanced Analytics, or equivalent;
  • At least 2 years working in a similar position;
  • Previous experience with Power BI;
  • Fluency in English is required, French is a plus;
  • Advanced expertise in data visualization techniques;
  • Fundamentals of Mathematics and Statistics;
  • Strong knowledge of relevant KPI/dashboard definitions;
  • Strong SQL knowledge: complex querying and data management;
  • Strong Database knowledge: data modeling, querying performance optimization.


What we offer:


  • First, we'll be welcoming you with a pack of goodies;
  • Healthcare services at Allianz Tiriac;
  • Monthly meal tickets;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • Internal Training and Discipline-specific Events;
  • Referral bonuses;
  • Christmas party;
  • Annual training budget;
  • A well-defined career path.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data (Marketing) Analyst-Betting Company- SaaS- Hybrid- Amsterdam- 60k




My client is the premier destination for sports betting and the ultimate online (live) casino experience in the Netherlands. As pioneers in the industry, they are committed to reshaping entertainment while maintaining responsible gambling. Their goal is to create an environment where players can enjoy themselves responsibly without losing control.




Keywords: SQL, Python, GCP, Marketing Mix Models, B2C, Stakeholder Management, Analytical Skills.




An exciting opportunity awaits a Data Analyst to have a significant impact on attracting more consumers through online marketing campaigns in an Amsterdam-based online betting company. Collaborate closely with the Head of Data Analytics, who is enthusiastic about sharing knowledge with you.




In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing dashboards and data to understand where the customers are coming from and how to retain them. You will work on marketing mix models and marketing touch attribution to optimize our marketing strategies and improve player engagement.




The IT infrastructure is state-of-the-art, utilizing all that Google has to offer, including Google Analytics, cloud resources, and data warehousing. Your responsibilities include analyzing, building, and automating new solutions.




Requirements:

3+ years of experience in data analysis (SQL & Python)
Strong analytical mindset
Good communication skills and stakeholder management
Preferably experience working in a B2C environment




Benefits

Salary up to €60k
Travel allowance
27 vacation days
Hybrid work environment
Flat organizational structure
Social drinks and lunch events




Interested? Contact me via glenn@doghouse-recruitment.nl




Unfortunately, No Visa Sponsorship / Client is not IND registered yet

Title: Junior Data Analyst
HTML:
Chi siamo

Mavriq, divisione B2C di Moltiply, è la tech company a cui appartengono alcuni tra i più importanti brand di comparazione ed intermediazione online in Italia (MutuiOnline.it, Segugio.it, SOStariffe.it, Trovaprezzi.it e molti altri) e all’estero (LeLynx.fr, Rastreator.com e Rastreator.mx). I servizi offerti dai brand di Mavriq aiutano con trasparenza i consumatori a trovare ciò di cui hanno bisogno, al miglior prezzo. Mavriq conta oggi più di 800 persone distribuite in Europa, America Latina ed Asia.


Posizione

Il nostro team Operations è alla ricerca di un/una Junior Data Analyst.

Come Junior Data Analyst avrai il compito di supportare il team nella definizione e realizzazione di progetti strategici con l'obiettivo di garantire il miglior livello di servizio per rispondere alla crescente domanda dei nostri Clienti. Ti occuperai della creazione delle dashboard per il monitoraggio sull'efficacia dei modelli e dei strumenti implementati. Inoltre, sarai coinvolto nell’efficientamento dei processi di business e nella definizione dei modelli predittivi.


Più nel dettaglio:

  • Svilupperai ed implementerai le dashboard di monitoraggio dei KPI quantitativi volte a identificare l'efficacia dei modelli e processi operativi, confrontando i risultati effettivi con piani e previsioni;
  • Supporterai i direttori operativi nella definizione della pianificazione di dettaglio per garantire consistenza tra capacità produttiva ed esigenze di business attraverso la definizione di modelli predittivi e matematici per forecast di volumi e pianificazione risorse;
  • Lavorerai in sinergia con le diverse business unit aziendali per sviluppare, testare e rifinire i processi;
  • Supporterai il “change management” accompagnando gli utenti nell’adozione dei nuovi processi e delle procedure;


Cosa cerchiamo

  • Laurea in ambito scientifico/economico;
  • Esperienza lavorativa di almeno 2 anni in ruoli affini, preferibilmente in società di consulenza o aziende che operino in ambito operations;
  • Forte motivazione a intraprendere un percorso di rapida crescita, che ti vedrà gestire in autonomia progetti strategici per il business aziendale;
  • Ottime capacità analitiche e propensione all'implementazione di modelli matematici e predittivi;
  • Precisione e attenzione nell'esecuzione delle attività;
  • Conoscenza avanzata di Microsoft Excel;
  • Proattività, predisposizione al lavoro in team;
  • Conoscenza di R o Python, Tableau e SQL verranno considerati un plus.

Cosa troverai da noi

  • Un ambiente di lavoro giovane e stimolante;
  • Colleghi altrettanto appassionati con cui confrontarti e imparare (e anche a cui insegnare qualcosa di nuovo);
  • Possibilità di contribuire attivamente ai successi dell'azienda e di veder riconosciuti i tuoi meriti indipendentemente dalla tua seniority;
  • Flessibilità, smart working e welfare;
  • Incontri periodici di feedback che ti permetteranno di accrescere la tua professionalità e migliorare le tue performance;
  • Momenti di aggregazione, condivisione e celebrazione dei successi;
  • Iniziative volte alla formazione ed allo scambio di competenze.


Se credi che questa sia l'azienda giusta per te, mandaci il tuo CV!

Sede di lavoro: Milano, via Desenzano 2 (MM Gambara)


La ricerca è rivolta ad ambo i sessi (ai sensi delle Leggi n. 903/77 e n. 125/91).

Si richiede esplicito consenso al trattamento dei dati personali (ex D.Lgs. 196/03 e GDPR - Reg.UE. 2016/679).

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Europa Factor S.p.A. intermediario finanziario vigilato da Banca d’Italia, tra i leader nell'acquisto e gestione di crediti NPL nel mercato italiano, è alla ricerca di un Data Analyst.


Se sei un Data Analyst con comprovata esperienza nel settore, inviaci la tua candidatura.


Requisiti:

  • preferibile laurea magistrale in Matematica, Economia o Ingegneria Gestionale;
  • esperienza di almeno 3 anni in contesti aziendali;
  • capacità organizzative e gestionali;
  • capacità di raccolta e organizzazione dati;
  • capacità di analisi dati;
  • ottime capacità di utilizzo strumenti Excel, SQL, Access e Power BI;


Responsabilità:

  • creazione di report operativi e dashboard direzionali;
  • gestione e controllo delle attività operative;
  • gestione dei flussi informatici per aggiornamento pratiche;
  • monitoraggio processi;
  • analisi andamenti operativi;
  • supporto strategie direzionali.


I dettagli sui piani retributivi, il percorso di crescita e le opportunità di formazione continua saranno presentati durante il colloquio conoscitivo.


Unisciti a Europa Factor S.p.A. e porta la tua competenza al servizio dell'eccellenza nella gestione dei crediti.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Pluxee is a global player in employee benefits and engagement that operates in 31 countries. Pluxee helps companies attract, engage, and retain talent thanks to a broad range of solutions across Meal & Food, Wellbeing, Lifestyle, Reward & Recognition, and Public Benefits.




Powered by leading technology and more than 5,000 engaged team members, Pluxee acts as a trusted partner within a highly interconnected B2B2C ecosystem made up of more than 500,000 clients, 36 million consumers and 1.7 million merchants.




Conducting its business as a trusted partner for more than 45 years, Pluxee is committed to creating a positive impact on all its stakeholders, from driving business to local communities, to supporting wellbeing at work for employees while protecting the planet.




🚀 Your next challenge




Pluxee Data organization has chosen a decentralized Data Hub (central) & Data Spoke (local) organization where the Spokes are data factory teams covering multiple countries' Data needs and supporting business teams by delivering operations reporting, the ad-hoc analysis supporting decision making and advanced insights aiming at predicting clients, merchants, or consumers behaviors.




To support this objective, your responsibilities will encompass:

Data Analysis and interpretation: collecting and analyzing data from various sources to identify trends and insights relevant for business improvement.
Visualization and reporting: developing clear and informative dashboards and reports using data visualization tools to effectively communicate findings to business teams.
Decision support: providing ad-hoc analyses and statistical modeling to assist business teams in making informed decisions and defining key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure progress.




🌟 You’re a match




Technical Skills:

+3 years of experience as a Data Analyst (finance or payment services will be a plus).
SQL proficiency with demonstrated expertise in querying and managing data using SQL.
Power BI proficiency for KPI Definition and Visualization. Proficient in designing and developing dashboards in Power BI and defining and computing key performance indicators (KPIs) in DAX to measure business performance.
Statistical and Machine Learning: good understanding of statistical analysis and machine learning techniques, enabling advanced data analysis.
Bilingual in English and French.




Soft Skills:

Effective communication: strong verbal and written communication skills in both French and English, adept at interacting with diverse stakeholders with varying cultural backgrounds and technical expertise.
Analytical thinking: highly analytical and detail-oriented, with a knack for problem-solving and extracting insights from complex datasets.
Proactive and motivated: proactive attitude, hands-on approach, and a high level of motivation to learn quickly and adapt to new challenges in an ever-moving domain.




🔎 To get this challenge

Videocall with Talent Acquisition Expert.
Videocall with Hiring Manager (Data Spoke Manager).
Technical interview.




🏅 Your team

Reporting to Jean Francois Prince (Data Spoke Manager).




📍 Your Location

Central Paris, Paris.
Ability to work in a hybrid mode (3 days at the office and 2 days at home).




☀️ Happy at work

A meaningful job: build the future of employee benefits and contribute to the quality of life at work for others, you will impact positively local communities too. It counts!
A great culture: we respect and care authentically about our people, we embrace work-life balance, new ideas and we have a lot of fun!
Employee experience is what we do. So, you can expect a comprehensive package including benefits and an annual bonus based on performance.




About Pluxee

Working at Pluxee is joining a multicultural team that moves as one. It’s also a place where your individual ideas, perspectives, and input count. You’ll be given the freedom and autonomy you need to do impactful work, supported by a team that cares about your well-being, growth, and work/life balance.

It’s the agility you’d expect from a fast-growing small business, with the stability that only a globally renowned company with +45 years in the business can offer. Put a part of yourself into the future of employee benefits and meaningfully contribute to lives and communities worldwide.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join Revpanda.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data related to revenue, client, player behavior, registrations, FTD (First-Time Depositors), payback, and marketing efforts. Your insights will support strategic decisions and optimize our marketing and operational strategies.







Responsibilities:

Data Collection & Analysis: Gather, process, and analyze data from various sources, including player behavior, registration, FTD, payback, and marketing and financial campaigns.
Reporting & Dashboards: Develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and business metrics.
Insights & Recommendations: Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in the data, providing actionable insights and recommendations to improve business outcomes.
Collaboration: Work closely with marketing, product development, and operational teams to understand their data needs and deliver relevant insights.
Market Analysis: Conduct market and competitor analysis to identify opportunities for growth and optimization.
Data Integrity: Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular data quality checks and validation processes.
Visualization: Create clear and effective data visualizations to communicate complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.







Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in the iGaming, digital marketing, or related industries.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software such as SQL, Excel, Looker Studio, Power BI, or similar.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization techniques.
Familiarity with digital marketing metrics and iGaming industry trends.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data insights in a clear and concise manner.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and strategically.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.




Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge of web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics).
Experience with A/B testing and data-driven experimentation.




What we offer:

Friendly and supportive colleagues
Diverse opportunities for professional growth and career development
Possibility to take part in international conferences and online courses
Competitive salary
Birthday day off
"Refer a friend" bonus
Corporate events
LinkedIn Learning complimentary access

  • Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in the iGaming, digital marketing, or related industries.
  • Proficiency in data analysis tools and software such as SQL, Excel, Looker Studio, Power BI, or similar.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization techniques.
  • Familiarity with digital marketing metrics and iGaming industry trends.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data insights in a clear and concise manner.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and strategically.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics).
  • Experience with A/B testing and data-driven experimentation.


What we offer:

  • Friendly and supportive colleagues
  • Diverse opportunities for professional growth and career development
  • Possibility to take part in international conferences and online courses
  • Competitive salary
  • Birthday day off
  • "Refer a friend" bonus
  • Corporate events
  • LinkedIn Learning complimentary access

Title: Business Data Analyst - CRM
Description:
We are looking for a highly motivated and experienced Business Data Analyst - CRM to join our team based in Milan!




Reporting to the Business Data Manager, you will drive the strategic objectives of the company by leveraging data analytics and fostering a data-driven culture within the CRM team. You will be pivotal in transforming data into actionable insights. By collaborating with cross-functional teams and utilizing advanced data analysis techniques, the role aims to optimize customer engagement and business outcomes.




Key Responsibilities:

Participate in agile CRM meetings to define and prioritize the most impactful analyzes to achieve strategic objectives.
Develop comprehensive analysis to achieve the objectives set during the sprints, ensuring clarity in macro-objectives.
Interpret the results of the analysis and recommend the best next actions for the company.
Collaborate with data scientists and data engineers as needed to evolve analysis into more complex models or use artificial intelligence.
Promote a data-driven culture within the CRM team.
Support BI champions in using existing BI reports or creating new ones.
Using a data-driven approach identify and create new customer segments for new marketing campaigns
Become a champion in the adoption of the company Customer Data Platform - D365 customer insight data




Requirements:

Master’s Degree in STEM disciplines (Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering)
In-depth knowledge of SQL and scripting languages (e.g., Python) for data analysis and manipulation
Proficient in big data analysis
Proficiency in using Power BI for creating interactive dashboards and reports
At least 2 years of experience in CRM data analytics in a retail company or consultancy company on projects for retail customers
Proven experience working in cross-functional/agile teams (including data scientists, data engineers, and business stakeholders).
Fluent Italian and English
Familiar with generative AI tools (e.g. ChatGPT)
… and of course a chocolate and gelato lover!




Join us at Venchi, and through the innovative use of technology and collaboration across functions, help us transform insights into actions that achieve our business objectives and exceed customer expectations.




We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Data Analyst – Life Insurance
HTML:
Join our leading life insurance company, where innovation meets tradition. We are on a mission to redefine the future of life insurance, using data to tailor and enhance our services for our clients. At Metropolitan Life, we believe in empowering our employees with the tools and culture they need to thrive and innovate.


As a Data Analyst you will dive deep into our data, using dedicated tools to extract actionable insights that will drive our strategic decisions and keep us at the forefront of the life insurance industry. Some of the key skills required for this role include, but are not limited to, a strong customer focus, the ability to think analytically, effectively, creatively to analyze data and use it to drive decision-driven actions.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Data Management: Utilize MySQL, Power BI and other internal platforms for complex data querying, manipulation, and analysis across multiple databases. Ensure data integrity and accuracy, perform corrections in all reports and analyses.
  • Insight Generation: Use Power BI and other internal platforms to create compelling visualizations and dashboards that communicate trends, patterns, and insights to non-technical stakeholders to drive commercial impact.
  • Business Acumen: Understanding business processes, objectives, and key performance indicators (KPI) to contextualize data analysis with the business context.
  • Strategic Support: Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytics support that guides decision-making and strategy development to improve customer experience and commercial impact.
  • Continuous Improvement: Stay abreast of the latest trends and technologies in data analytics and visualization. Recommend and implement improvements to our data practices and tools.
  • Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills are necessary to explain technical concepts, present findings, and foster a collaborative environment where data insights and findings are shared and acted upon.
  • Time management: Efficiently managing time and priorities to meet project deadlines and deliver high-quality results.


Job requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in STEM, or a related field;
  • Proficient in SQL, Power BI, Tableau, Excel, CRM platforms;
  • Nice-to-have data base architecture knowledge;
  • Nice-to-have to have Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics knowledge;
  • Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within the insurance or financial services industry;
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Strong communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights for all levels of the company;
  • A team player who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.


We value your work, by offering:

  • Friendly environment with multiple career development opportunities;
  • Inclusive and multicultural team where you can create impact with your innovative ideas and creative personality;
  • Various learning & development programs adapted to your needs and goals;
  • Benefits (flexible hours, meal tickets, private medical subscription, insurance policy, Bookster subscription, additional holidays based on seniority, annual performance bonus, holiday bonus, etc);
  • Excellent location – close to public transport stations (bus & subway) & hybrid way of working.


At Metropolitan Life, part of MetLife, Inc, one of the largest life insurance companies in the world, we’re leading the global transformation of an industry we’ve long defined. Named a Certified Great Place to Work, we are united in purpose, diverse in perspective, and dedicated to making a difference in the lives of our customers.


Great Place To Work® Certified in Romania


Metropolitan Life is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer committed to attracting, retaining, and maximizing the performance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is Metropolitan’s Life policy to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment based on race, colour, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, genetic information, citizenship status, uniformed service member or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
TG Lab is a technology company that is fueling the biggest winners in sports betting and casino products. Working with professional sports betting and leading casino providers, TG Lab produce player account management and engagement technology to many of the biggest names in the industry - including Stake, STS Gaming Group, Belgium National

Lottery, Betsson Group (Betsafe) and many more. As a company, we are looking for data driven dreamers who want to make an impact on this industry and the world. We want people of integrity who are both open to learning and willing to challenge the norm. We want people who are curious, reliable, empathetic, and obsessed with quality.

TG Lab is known for its innovative yet practical products, operating world-class real money wagering technology for our partners who entertain more than 1 million players. We're hard at work creating iGaming software for distribution to casino and sportsbook operators in the EU, USA and other international iGaming markets and we are looking for likeminded people to join our team!




Job Responsibilities:

Build analysis, data visualizations, and multi-functional reporting using Tableau or similar (powerbi, metabase, etc.) that provides critical support to the operations and decisionmaking of the organization.
Use internal and external analytics tools, SQL, and scripting languages to access and
analyze multivariate data.
Exploring and developing innovative ways to visualize value-based care financial reporting.
Provide analytics expertise to key business partners regarding data & analytics questions.
Take personal accountability for delivery of projects and committed timelines.
Support business partners in adopting reporting solutions and business intelligence tools for self-service.
Build effective working relationships with team members.




Required Qualifications:

2+ of experience working with large data sets, reporting and dashboards.
1+ experience using Tableau or similar (powerbi, metabase, etc.).
Expert SQL skills for complex querying, analysis, performance optimization, and persisting data.
Understanding of data warehousing concepts, design, modeling, and data engineering
Solid skills in visualizing data.
Excellent analytical and creative problem-solving skills.
Logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience in iGaming industry.
Python experience writing, managing, and deploying code.
Effective presentation skills.




Working with us implies:

Competitive base salary and other benefits, including health insurance, employee referral program and additional training.
Memorable company parties and social activities like team buildings and monthly birthday celebrations.
New modern, bright, and comfortable office space in the center of Vilnius, with a great working atmosphere, in a collaborative team of amazing people, with forward-thinking managers.
Free parking for your car or motorcycle and showers if you prefer to cycle to work.
Opportunities to build valuable skills, work with unique and interesting projects for the sports industry, express and implement your ideas and grow your career!




Monthly salary range for this position: € 2500 - 5000 (before tax deduction). The final offer

will depend on the experience and competencies of the selected candidate.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst (450-475)




Really exciting 6-month contract opportunity for a strong Senior Data Analyst to join a Global Life Financial services company. This is a fully remote role anywhere in ROI.

The Senior Data Analyst will play a key role in a large-scale migration project, Strong SQL skills are therefore essential for this role. In addition to this any SSRS experience would be beneficial.

This role will begin on a 6 month basis but given the nature of the piece of work it is very likely to be extended.

Role/Opportunity:

6 Month Senior Data Analyst
Fully remote anywhere in Ireland
Work closely with Senior Leadership
450-475 EUR Per day
Social Team




Skills

5+ years as a Senior Data Analyst
Strong SQL
SSRS experience
Financial services




For more information please contact Kevin McGovern in confidence on 01 649 8515 or kevin.mcgovern@archer.ie

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Haarlem/Hybrid




As a Data Analyst/Engineer, you work with customer data to uncover valuable insights. Your goal is to visualize and present these insights in the most comprehensible way, ensuring that even those unfamiliar with data can understand. Your contributions drive the success of strategies and aid companies in their growth and innovation.




You propose improvements to the data landscape and data quality, aiming to create sustainable value in both the short and long term. You foster connections within the client's organization, engaging with both business and IT sectors. You swiftly identify which data analyses will be valuable, producing realistic and actionable insights.




If you thrive in a data-rich environment and enjoy extracting value from vast datasets, this role will suit you perfectly.




You have:

At least 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst in complex data environments.
A keen eye for detail and a passion for accuracy.
Strong communication skills and the ability to understand customer needs.
Experience with data analytics and visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, Oracle BI, Python, and R.
Familiarity with ETL, data modeling, data quality, and data visualization.
Proficiency in SQL.
Fluency in Dutch.




We offer a career with growth prospects within a vibrant community of enthusiasts. Your work directly impacts both our organization and our clients, giving you significant responsibility in a challenging role where passion and the opportunity to enhance the 'Customer Experience' through data analysis are key. We are a flat organization where everyone knows each other and fun is a priority.




We offer:

24 vacation days per year (increasing to 27).
A monthly performance bonus.
Eligibility for an annual bonus.
A solid pension plan.
A company car or mobility scheme.
An annual trip abroad!

Title: Alternant Data Analyst HF
Description:
Au sein de l'équipe IT d'Acoem, vous participerez activement à 2 missions stratégiques :

- Migration de notre système ERP Sage X3 actuel vers la dernière version disponible intégrant de nouveaux process et de nouvelles fonctionnalités

- Mise en place d'un outil BI de pilotage de l’ensemble du groupe Acoem.

- Vous pourrez être amené à travailler sur d’autres projets d’analyse/transformation de données.

Missions :

- En tant qu'alternant Data Analyst, vos missions consisteront à :

- Analyser et assurer la qualité et la cohérence des données migrées vers le nouveau système ERP ou intégrées à notre plateforme BI

- Participer activement aux différentes phases des projets, depuis la conception jusqu'à la mise en œuvre, en passant par le test des fonctionnalités

- Contribuer à la création et au déploiement d'un outil de pilotage groupe, permettant une analyse fine des performances et une aide à la décision stratégique

- Élaborer des rapports périodiques et des dashboards dynamiques pour le suivi du projet et l'analyse des performances

- Assister les utilisateurs dans la prise en main des nouveaux outils, en fournissant formation et support technique

Ce que nous recherchons :


- Actuellement en cours de formation en Informatique, Data Science, Statistiques, Mathématiques appliquées, ou un domaine connexe, Bac+3 à Bac+5

- Une spécialisation en gestion de données, analyse de données ou Business Intelligence serait un plus

- Connaissance des principaux systèmes de gestion de base de données (SQL) et des langages de requête associés

- Capacité à transformer les données brutes en informations exploitables grâce à des techniques d'analyse

- Idéalement, une expérience avec les outils de Business Intelligence tels que Looker, Power BI, Tableau, ou équivalents pour la création de dashboards

- Autonomie et proactivité

- Esprit d'équipe et communication

- Bon anglais indispensable

Title: BI Data Analyst
Description:
Lisbon. 100% On-site position




(NOTE: all certificates must be attached to the application in order to be consider)




The BI Business Analyst will integrate our Quality Department and play a key role in analysing data and generating actionable insights to drive organisational decision-making.




Responsibilities

Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to identify their data needs and define clear analytics objectives that support business goals.
Design, develop, and maintain scalable analytics frameworks, leveraging SQL and Power BI to extract, transform, and analyse datasets.
Create compelling, clear, concise reports and dashboards using Power BI, ensuring business users can easily understand and act upon the insights provided.
Conduct data validation and error-checking processes to guarantee the reliability and accuracy of analytics outputs, thereby upholding the trust in data-driven decision-making.
Identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data to provide actionable insights that guide business strategies and decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data analysis needs and provide guidance on how best to use data to achieve objectives.
Keeping up to date with emerging trends and technologies in BI and data analysis and continually looking for ways to improve the organisation's data analysis processes and practices.

Requirements

Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Business Management, Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Analysis or related fields.
+1 year of experience in Power BI for developing reports, dashboards, and data visualisations.
Previous experience in data analysis, preferably in a corporate environment.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present analysis results clearly and understandably.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with a strong focus on results.
Fluency in English and Portuguese (written and spoken).




We Offer:

Attractive salary package;
Vibrant culture, in a company that is actively involved in social responsibility;
Integration in a dynamic, passionate and enthusiastic team;
Equal opportunity mindset and encouragement to be innovative;
Personal and professional development;
Contact to a demanding industry with challenging projects;
Company-sponsored events, parties and concerts;
Fruit basket, milk, coffee, tea, amazing wine and beer;
Lots of fun and games (Shuffleboard, Ping-pong, foosball, library, bingo, etc.).




Enjoy the unique experience of working at MULTIVISION! If you are interested in this role, please send us your CV and certificates (mandatory) motivation letter.







MULTIVISION is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and workplace. We value diversity at our company regardless of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, citizenship, marital status or disability status.
