Title: Salesforce Data Analyst
Description:
MSR Technology Group DBA Infomatics has been an Inc 500/5000 corporation for the last 7 years in a row. We have an urgent need for Salesforce Data Analyst, and this is an Onsite role in Boston, MA. Please find the job details below.




Title: Salesforce Data Analyst

Location: Boston, MA

Duration: Long Term Contract




Data Analyst, Feld Center for Career and Alumni Engagement




Position Summary:

We are seeking an experienced and motivated Associate Director of Data Analytics for a temporary position in the Feld Center for Career and Alumni Engagement. This individual will be responsible for serving as primary liaison to Questrom IT during the buildout and implementation of a new and evolving Salesforce CRM. In addition, the Associate Director will provide strategic insight into opportunities for dashboard development and data collection and synthesis to improve data-driven decision making related to career development events, activities and student outcomes.




Key Responsibilities:

Database Administration:

• Serve as the primary liaison to Questrom IT and Salesforce consultants during the buildout the Feld Center instance of the Salesforce CRM to incorporate alumni engagement and action learning

• Work with the Questrom IT team and Salesforce consultants to facilitate integrations and plug-ins with Salesforce and LinkedIn, Handshake, Outlook, etc.

• Develop and document standard operating procedures (SOPs) for data management and administration workflows.

• Provide training and support for staff on effective use of Salesforce for career services, industry engagement, alumni engagement, and action learning activities.




Data Collection and Synthesis:

• Identify opportunities to optimize data collection and synthesis related to career services, industry engagement, alumni engagement, and action learning; including employer and alumni participation, student engagement, and data mapping to resulting internship and job outcomes

• Analyze industry and alumni engagement metrics to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement; suggest new metrics as data allows and as relevant to decision-making needs

• Collaborate with Questrom Decision Support (QRO to support data collection efforts related to national surveys and rankings




Key Skills:

• Expertise in Salesforce development, design, integration, and training

• Experience in conducting database training sessions and developing database training materials

• Experience or ability to develop proficiency with platforms including Handshake and PowerBI

• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

• Ability to work collaboratively with diverse stakeholders, including staff, students, employers, alumni, and faculty.

• Attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy and integrity.




Qualifications:

• Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Business, Information Technology, or a related field; Master’s degree preferred.

• Minimum of 3 years of experience in data analytics, preferably within higher education or career services.

• Demonstrated experience with Salesforce administration and data management.

• Proficiency in PowerBI, Handshake, and other relevant software and tools.

• R, Python, SQL, database management tools




Can be remote 2 days/week.




If you have the above skills/experience, please share your resume in confidence to:




Recruiter Name: Sravan







EOE

Title: Data Analyst I
Description:
The Division for Neuropsychiatry and Neuromodulation at the Massachusetts General Hospital, Harvard Medical School, is seeking a full time Data Analyst for a series of exciting large-scale projects aimed at understanding circuit dynamics underlying neuropsychiatric disorders and their treatments. The laboratory is a multidisciplinary group conducting clinical, translational and basic human neuroscience research with healthy and neuropsychiatric populations, using device-based neuromodulation interventions (TMS, tDCS, ECT, DBS, etc.), neuroimaging, EEG, behavioral and clinical methods. The program includes the Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (TMS) clinical service, tightly integrated with our research mission, where we provide individualized treatments for neuropsychiatric patients.

Duties And Responsibilities

The Data Analyst responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:


Implement and support statistical analyses, machine learning models, and processing pipelines/scripts for behavioral, EEG and multimodal neuroimaging analysis, including resting ‐ state and task-based fMRI, DTI and volumetric data.
Assist in the creation of databases, query tools for data mining, and documentation on their effective use. Behavioral (RedCap, etc.) and neuroimaging databases (BIDS, XNAT, etc.) are emphasized.
Maintain quality control and integrity of neuroimaging and behavioral data by developing, implementing and overseeing data entry and QC protocols.
Implement web-based behavioral questionnaires (e.g. RedCap) and program behavioral tasks with presentation software (e.g. Psychophysics Toolbox, PsychoPy, Presentation).
Provide programming and analysis support for lab members.
Coordinate general lab computer/network administration (including data management and archiving).
Assist with the preparation of scientific reports and publications.
Provide technical and logistical support for in-person study visits (data collection) as needed.
Provide training and backup support for CRCs on various projects as needed.
B.A., B.S. or equivalent with background in neuroscience, computer science, engineering or related fields. Masters or PhD degree preferred but not required. 2+ years of prior technical experience.
Proficient with multiple neuroimaging analysis platforms (e.g. HCP Pipeline and Workbench, FreeSurfer, SPM, FSL, AFNI, etc.).
Strong programming skills and comfort with diverse computing environments (Linux) required.
Strong background in statistics and statistical software scripting (R, Python preferred).
Strong background creating scientific figures and writing technical scientific reports.
Strong interpersonal skills and a high level of organization with careful attention to detail are absolutely required. This position requires a high degree of motivation and self ‐ sufficiency, although extensive training and supervision will be provided.
Experience with graph analyses, machine learning and modeling confer a significant advantage.
Graphic or Web design skills are considered a plus.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Fully remote in the USA

Job Overview

The Data Analyst will work under the direction of a Psychometrician using specifications to write and execute programs to perform psychometric analysis, scoring, and technical reporting using large datasets from large-scale assessments. This position requires proficiency and experience in working in a large-scale summative assessment environment where quality assurance, complex data sets, timely execution of tasks, and documentation of code are expected competencies.

Job Responsibilities


Maintains, updates, and operates existing code and develops new code as needed for review required for projects.
Develops rationale in programs to obtain required parameters to ensure data quality.
Applies given formulas to obtain required statistics for various types of psychometric data.
Maintains written documentation of all programming procedures and file structures for each project.
Assists with QC of data analysis results, applying prescribed criteria, and reporting questionable results.
Communicates concerns/insights to the project psychometrician.


Job Requirements


Advanced degree in statistics, mathematics, or a related field.
1+ years of statistical analysis experience. 1 year of psychometric programming experience with a testing company is preferred.
Must be proficient in R programming.
Experience with Winsteps and/or IRTPRO is preferred
Experience with R Markdown a plus.
Must be willing to continuously update knowledge and skills using new software applications available for test data analysis and efficiency enhancement.


Why Work With Us?

When you work with Cambium Assessment, you’ll be helping to design and build inspiring solutions that make a real impact on the online testing industry, as well as the educators and students we support.

Our Ground Breaking Work Includes


Advanced computer-adaptive algorithms
Mobile support of user interfaces
Learning management systems with social media features
Universally accessible user interfaces
Machine scorable items


In the 2021–2022 school year, we delivered more than 100 million online tests, successfully supported peak testing volumes exceeding 1.3 million simultaneous test takers, while ensuring an average response time of less than a tenth of a second. We have the most advanced features of any online testing system, and we continue to push boundaries to improve student performance measurement and enabling educators with actionable insights to drive better overall educational outcomes for our students. To learn more about our organization and the exciting work we do, visit www.cambiumassessment.com

An Equal Opportunity Employer

We are dedicated to fostering a culture that celebrates unique backgrounds, ideas, and experiences. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination on the basis of race, color, age, religion, sex, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

Title: Data Analyst Intern, application via RippleMatch
Description:
This role is with RippleMatch's partner companies.

About RippleMatch

RippleMatch is the recruitment automation platform changing how Gen Z finds work. By replacing job boards with matching and automation, RippleMatch eliminates the most time-intensive parts of the recruitment process for both employers and job seekers. Leading employers such as eBay and Teach For America leverage RippleMatch to build diverse, high-performing teams and Gen Z job seekers across the country trust RippleMatch to launch and grow their careers.

Requirements for the role:


Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Strong foundational knowledge in statistical analysis, data modeling, and data mining techniques.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, or similar.
Experience with data visualization tools and software (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or similar).
Ability to interpret complex data sets and provide actionable insights.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Effective organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with team members.
Eagerness to learn and apply new techniques and tools in the field of data analysis.

Title: HR Data Analyst, Talent
Description:
Are you ready to build America’s clean energy future with the team that will deliver? Form Energy is an American energy technology and manufacturing company. We are pioneering a new class of iron-air batteries to enable our electric grid to run on renewable, reliable, and affordable energy, every day of the year.

Form Energy has been recognized by TIME as “One of the Best Inventions of 2023” for its battery technology and by MIT Technology Review as a “Top Climate Tech Company to Watch”. We are making rapid progress on our mission of delivering energy storage for a better world, and are growing just as rapidly to meet demand. Our team has more than doubled in size in the past year, and continues to expand every day. We have signed contracts with leading electric utilities across the United States. Pilot production of our iron-air batteries has already begun, and later this year, production will take off to high volumes at our new factory in West Virginia.

Working for Form Energy is more than just a job, it’s a chance to be part of something extraordinary. And right now might be the most exciting moment in the company’s history to join. We are assembling a team of some of the most talented and motivated individuals across the country. Driven by our core values of humanity, excellence, and creativity, our team is determined to deliver on our mission and transform the energy landscape for the better.

Feeling energized to make a meaningful impact on the world? Then keep reading - you’ve come to the right place.

Role Description

Form Energy's talent function is a strategic partner to the business, implementing workforce strategies that attract, deploy & retain diverse and skilled talent. We are seeking a dynamic and analytical HR Data Analyst to join our Human Resources team. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in transforming our talent acquisition, talent management, and other people-related functions through insightful data analytics, storytelling, and the development of robust data dashboards. This role requires a unique blend of data expertise, business acumen, and the ability to translate complex data into compelling narratives that drive actionable insights.

Applicants must be in the eastern timezone with access to a Form Energy location.

What You'll Do


Collect, analyze, and interpret complex data sets related to talent acquisition, talent management, employee engagement, performance, and other HR metrics.
Identify key trends, patterns, and insights to support strategic decision-making.
Perform predictive analytics to anticipate future trends and provide actionable recommendations.
Develop and maintain interactive data dashboards that provide real-time insights and reporting for HR and business leaders.
Create compelling data-driven stories that communicate insights and recommendations effectively to non-technical stakeholders.
Implement data governance best practices to ensure high-quality and reliable data.
Partner with HR leaders and business units to understand their needs and provide customized analytical solutions.
Work closely with talent acquisition, talent management, and other HR teams to support their analytics needs.
Train and support HR team members in using data tools and interpreting analytics.
Support the optimization of Ashby ATS & Analytics platform.
Support and analyze the impact of various talent programs and initiatives.


What You'll Bring


Bachelor's degree with 3+ years of people analytics experience with experience in applicant tracking systems, HRIS tools and other people database technologies
Advanced excel skills and experience with data visualization tools (i.e. Tableau, Power BI, etc.);
Strong attention to detail to ensure data integrity and data governance and accuracy
Analytical and problem-solving skills to draw appropriate conclusions from data
Strong verbal communication skills in order to explain and present data visually in a clear, compelling manner.
Proven ability to handle highly confidential and sensitive information in a discreet manner
Ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic environment


Applications will be accepted until the job is filled.

Humanity is a cornerstone of Form Energy’s culture, and we make sure our compensation and benefits reflect that. Form Energy offers competitive salaries, stock options, and a holistic benefits package to ensure all employees have what they need to thrive while working here.

When it comes to you and your family’s health, we cover 100% of medical, dental, and vision premiums for full-time employees - and 80% of healthcare premiums for dependents. This starts from day one. We also offer at least 12 weeks of paid leave for new parents (up to 20 weeks for birthing parents), and generous vacation policies to give employees time to recharge when needed.

To build a clean and equitable energy future, we need everyone at the table. We strive to form a team as diverse as the communities we will serve with our technology, and are committed to maintaining an inclusive environment for all employees. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply to our open jobs.


Show more

  • Work closely with talent acquisition, talent management, and other HR teams to support their analytics needs.
  • Train and support HR team members in using data tools and interpreting analytics.
  • Support the optimization of Ashby ATS & Analytics platform.
  • Support and analyze the impact of various talent programs and initiatives.

What You'll Bring

  • Bachelor's degree with 3+ years of people analytics experience with experience in applicant tracking systems, HRIS tools and other people database technologies
  • Advanced excel skills and experience with data visualization tools (i.e. Tableau, Power BI, etc.);
  • Strong attention to detail to ensure data integrity and data governance and accuracy
  • Analytical and problem-solving skills to draw appropriate conclusions from data
  • Strong verbal communication skills in order to explain and present data visually in a clear, compelling manner.
  • Proven ability to handle highly confidential and sensitive information in a discreet manner
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic environment

Applications will be accepted until the job is filled.

Humanity is a cornerstone of Form Energy’s culture, and we make sure our compensation and benefits reflect that. Form Energy offers competitive salaries, stock options, and a holistic benefits package to ensure all employees have what they need to thrive while working here.

When it comes to you and your family’s health, we cover 100% of medical, dental, and vision premiums for full-time employees - and 80% of healthcare premiums for dependents. This starts from day one. We also offer at least 12 weeks of paid leave for new parents (up to 20 weeks for birthing parents), and generous vacation policies to give employees time to recharge when needed.

To build a clean and equitable energy future, we need everyone at the table. We strive to form a team as diverse as the communities we will serve with our technology, and are committed to maintaining an inclusive environment for all employees. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply to our open jobs.

Title: Entry Level Data Analyst, application via RippleMatch
Description:
This role is with RippleMatch's partner companies.

About RippleMatch

RippleMatch is the recruitment automation platform changing how Gen Z finds work. By replacing job boards with matching and automation, RippleMatch eliminates the most time-intensive parts of the recruitment process for both employers and job seekers. Leading employers such as eBay and Teach For America leverage RippleMatch to build diverse, high-performing teams and Gen Z job seekers across the country trust RippleMatch to launch and grow their careers.

Requirements for the role:


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Prior work experience or internships involving data analysis or related fields is a plus.
Proficiency in statistical analysis and the use of various data analysis tools and software.
Strong skills in programming languages relevant to data analysis, such as Python, R, SQL, or similar.
Experience with data visualization tools and software (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Ability to clean, manipulate, and analyze large datasets to derive actionable insights.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong organizational and project management abilities, capable of managing multiple tasks simultaneously.
Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex data in a clear and concise manner to non-technical audiences.
A proactive approach to learning and applying new analytics techniques and tools.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary

We are currently looking for an Data Analyst/Agile Program Manager. Must be in the Boston Metro Area - Hybrid model.

The ideal candidate will need a deep previous experience in the investment management industry and common applicable data domains (clients, portfolios, funds, holdings, transactions, trades, securities/investments, ESG, analytics, performance, IBOR/ABOR/TBOR, benchmarks/indices).

Deep understanding of business and the ability to translate them to conceptual, Logical and Physical data model designs when required.

If this is something you might be interested in, please apply!

location: Boston, Massachusetts

job type: Contract

salary: $55 - 65 per hour

work hours: 8am to 5pm

education: Bachelors

Responsibilities

The ideal candidate will need a deep previous experience in the investment management industry and common applicable data domains (clients, portfolios, funds, holdings, transactions, trades, securities/investments, ESG, analytics, performance, IBOR/ABOR/TBOR, benchmarks/indices).

Deep understanding of business and the ability to translate them to conceptual, Logical and Physical data model designs when required. Self-motivated to excel in a remote position, collaborating effectively with remote teams across the globe.

Focus on software development life cycle, you will collaborate with our Head of Technology Strategy, Head of Data, Solution Architects, Data Analysts, Data Team, and Portfolio Delivery function Leads to understand customer and technical needs to design and implement the Global Investment data platform, including Persistence, Integration and Services layers of the business solutions in compliance with architecture principles.

Qualifications


Experience level: Experienced
Minimum 4 years of experience
Education: Bachelors


Skills


Manager (4 years of experience is required)
Agile Methodology (4 years of experience is required)
Project Management (4 years of experience is required)
Technical Support (4 years of experience is required)


Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.

This posting is open for thirty (30) days.

Title: Data Analyst (Finance focused) | $100,000 - $150,000 | PE backed SaaS Company | No sponsorship offered | Remote (preferably in the Boston, MA area)
Company: Harmonic Finance Inc ™ | Certified B Corp
Description:
Data Analyst (Finance focused) | $100,000 - $150,000 | PE backed SaaS Company | No sponsorship offered | Remote (preferably in the Boston, MA area)




We are excited to partner with a hyper-growth, PE-backed SaaS scaleup that is poised to revolutionize how health professionals can track, manage, and communicate with their patients. The platform provides data, insights, and tools that they need to keep their focus on delivering top-tier care for their patients.




Backed by some of the most reputable PE firms in the country, this business currently boasts a headcount of 200 and revenues close to $80m ARR.




With a passion for empowering rehab therapy professionals and improving patient outcomes, the business is poised for its next phase of growth. As the company expands its impact, they are seeking a Data Analyst to join their finance team and are seeking a dynamic and driven individual.




The company’s commitment to innovation, customer success, and making a meaningful difference in SaaS offers a compelling opportunity for professionals looking to make a real impact in the industry.




The Role

Reporting into the VP of Finance, as a Data Analyst you will be comfortable working on your own and be confident to deliver findings to senior members of staff, making suggestion and recommendations to the business. You will be able to run queries in SQL database and confidential spot trends and opportunities, helping the company make proactive decisions that maximize revenue.




Responsibilities:

Distinguish between real movements in ARR vs billing issues and normalize as needed.
Where recurring billing / Salesforce issues exist, surface trends for correction.
Identify trends in downsell / churn by segment, product family and type.
Identify trends in upsell / new logo and provide feedback to sales.
Own and analyze Logo and Dollar-based retention company wide, breaking out by segment, product and service type.
Create and analyze cohort-based view of bookings and retention#
In addition to billings-based ARR cube, work through data issues to create bookings-based ARR cube for more leading-edge analysis.
Create true bookings-to-billings waterfall and integrate with backlog reporting.
Create and maintain RCM revenue forecast.
Maintain and analyze RCM capacity and productivity model.
Perform price increase data analytics work.
Support advanced GTM analytics requiring SQL (conversation and win rates by create date cohort and product)
Fuse KPIs into management dashboard and keep updated in real-time.
Run queries on SQL database




What you need:

2+ years’ BI & Data experience
Strong querying skills
SaaS experience
SQL experience
Working with Finance teams
Excellent communication skills for effective stakeholder engagement




What we’d like to see:

SaaS sector experience
Previous experience in a PE-backed business
Salesforce experience




Salary: $100,000 - $150,000

Location: Boston, MA




Benefits:

Unlimited PTO
6% 401(k)
Hybrid working
Full healthcare covered




If you are interested about this exceptional opportunity, please connect with Sean for further details. If you are a Data Analyst seeking a pivotal role in a dynamic, inclusive, and purpose-driven organization, we invite you to reach out. To apply or to explore more about this exciting role, please contact us at sean.obrien@harmonicfinance.com or call us at +1 (617) 861-2564 .




Feel free to share this remarkable opportunity with your network of friends and contacts who may be interested in shaping the future of the SaaS space.




At Harmonic, we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and equitable workplace. We actively welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds and assure you that every candidate will be thoughtfully considered for the roles we represent, without regard to race, religion, gender expression, disability, or sexual orientation.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst in Boston! $65,000 +
Description:
Description

Marketing Data Analyst in Boston! $65,000 +

Company Overview

Join us at ProPivotal, where data meets dynamism, and your career aspirations thrive! With a prestigious 28-year legacy, we have established ourselves as the premier choice for staffing solutions among mid-size organizations in the Boston area.

We provide temporary staffing, direct-hire staffing, managed staffing, and recruitment process outsourcing staffing. As a recognized leader in the staffing industry, ProPivotal is not just a workplace – it's a pathway to professional excellence.

Why Work at ProPivotal

At ProPivotal, we're pioneers of talent solutions! Our secret sauce? Deep-rooted relationships and tailor-made services that keep our clients coming back for more.

Team Spirit: Say goodbye to the isolation of remote work! At ProPivotal, you'll find yourself surrounded by a team that's not just colleagues but companions in your professional journey. Together, we celebrate victories, overcome challenges, and forge bonds that last a lifetime.

Transparent Leadership: Our management team isn't just at the helm; they're alongside you, guiding, supporting, and empowering you every step of the way. Experience the transparency, integrity, and dedication of ProPivotal's leadership firsthand.

Unparalleled Training: At ProPivotal, learning never stops. We offer personalized support and invest in your growth. Get ready to earn your stripes with the Certified Staffing Professional Certificate from the American Staffing Association, backed by ProPivotal's unwavering support.

15 Years of Excellence: ProPivotal's commitment to excellence is not just a promise; it's a legacy. With 15 consecutive years of winning the Best of Staffing industry award, we set the benchmark for excellence in the staffing realm.

Marketing Data Analyst Responsibilities

As a Marketing Data Analyst at ProPivotal, you'll be at the forefront of our data-driven revolution. Dive deep into candidate applications, harness the power of data analytics, and unlock the full potential of candidate leads. Your responsibilities will include:


Interpreting data to optimize candidate utilization.
Crafting search parameters to match candidates with client job openings.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to address business needs.
Delivering insightful reports and presentations to senior management.


Who We're Looking For


Experience: Bring at least 3 years of related experience in a corporate environment to the table, with exposure to talent acquisition being a definite plus.
Analytical Acumen: Demonstrate a keen interest in analysis, with familiarity in tools like R or Python considered advantageous.
Critical Thinking: Possess superior critical thinking and analytical skills, coupled with an impeccable attention to detail.
Location:. Do you want to work in person in our Boston office. Our approach (100% in-office) is an important facilitator of staff development. We typically employ professionals who have an easy commute to our Boston Office (located near South Station).
Team Player: Enjoy and contribute to a positive team environment. We want someone who gets along with a variety of people/personalities and someone who can positively impact the work environment of peers, direct reports, leadership, and all employees. In plain English, someone who is free of drama and a pleasure to work with in good times and bad.


Join ProPivotal: We celebrate uniqueness and welcome everyone to the table, ProPivotal is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, color, religion, disability, veteran's status, sexual orientation, or any other protected factor. #pando3-2

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Integrity Lab creates intelligent technology to foster integrity within the world’s leading organizations. Our data-driven advisory team analytically investigates the most pressing integrity challenges facing organizations, including fraud, bribery, and harassment. We employ cutting-edge approaches to proactively mitigate misconduct.




Our Cambridge-based team, led by a Harvard Business School Professor, has diverse expertise in data science, statistics, econometrics, engineering, and software design. We routinely support organizations facing significant public and regulatory scrutiny.




We are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our innovative and dynamic team. In this role, you will partner with industry-leading US multinationals to solve their critical compliance analytics needs. You will have the opportunity to work with rich, proprietary datasets to generate actionable managerial insights. You will communicate complex data insights through visualizations, reports, and presentations to senior stakeholders at our clients. You will further contribute to groundbreaking internal research projects to shape the future of compliance analytics.




This role would be especially well suited for a candidate who wants to pursue a graduate degree in a quantitative social science field.




What you’ll do

Draw inferences about behavior and organizational culture using various data techniques
Independently manage a diverse range of datasets, including conducting preliminary and exploratory analysis, merging datasets, and creating clear documentation.
Develop and present clear, concise visualizations to showcase findings
Communicate findings to internal and external stakeholders, including C-Suite leaders, through memos and presentations.
Collaborate on innovative R&D projects to shape the future of compliance and organizational culture analytics




What we’re looking for from you

An exceptional academic record with a bachelor's in Economics, Statistics, or a related quantitative field.
2-4 years of experience in quantitative data analysis, preferably within a consulting or tech environment.
Proficiency in Python for data analysis and modeling.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present data findings clearly and concisely.
Self-starter comfortable working in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment.




Some nice to-haves

Knowledge of Stata is highly desirable.
Experience in consulting, particularly in projects related to organizational culture or compliance.




What we offer

Competitive compensation package
A collaborative environment with a kind, dedicated, friendly team
The opportunity to engage in meaningful work that tackles significant integrity challenges facing organizations today
Opportunities for professional development, training, and career progression.
Paid time off
Health, vision, and dental insurance
401k plan




We value diverse viewpoints, and we do not discriminate based on one’s race, creed, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, handicap, disability, veteran status, or military obligations.

Show more

Title: Program Data Analyst/BI Engineer
Description:
Required Skills


In-depth exposure to data quality concepts, best practices, and tools.
Experience in designing, developing and deploying business analytics dashboards using PowerBI.
Experience in Cloud Data warehouses like Snowflake, Redshift.
Familiarity with Snowflake Data sharing, Snowpipe and Snowpark.
Experience in ETL tools such as Pentaho/Informatica and proficient in SQL.
Experience with Software as a Service cloud implementations particularly those in which legacy on premise applications have been migrated to cloud delivery options.


Additional Skills

Job DescriptionPosition Summary

The BEST Program Data Analyst/BI Engineer (DA/BI) will work with a Team comprised of BEST Program staff, agency business and technical SMEs and the new solution system integrator (SI) and product vendor to design and implement the data information management and reporting strategies, tools, and outputs to provide a robust reporting and data analytics capacity for users of the new Financials solution.The implementation of the new Financials solution will provide users with the ability to run queries and reports on the live data in this application directly rather than waiting for data to be available through warehouse reports. Data will be integrated across modules permitting more robust, real-time reporting and analytics capabilities.

The BEST Program Data Analyst/BI Engineer will work with the BEST Financials Data Lead to identify reporting, dashboard and business analytics needs that will drive the configuration of standard reports and dashboards delivered through the new Financials solution. The DA/BI Lead will assist in leading requirements sessions with BEST staff, agency staff and the system integrator and product vendor to review the reporting and analytics capabilities of the new solution and to identify available configuration options. The DA/BI Lead will develop and maintain a list of selected configurations for each report and dashboard and work with reports/dashboard developers during configuration to assist in translating business requirements to the configured reports. The DA/BI Lead will also participate in testing configured reports and dashboards and in organizing user testing of these items.

Whenever feasible, the BEST Program intends to adopt delivered reports and dashboards, but in instances where reporting requirements cannot be met by the delivered solutions, the DA/BI Lead will work with business and the system integrator and product vendor to identify requirements for future report development and participate in testing of these items when they are developed. The DA/BI Lead will work with business and the system integrator and product vendor to identify opportunities for improving the availability of data for reporting and analytics by understanding the solution’s capacities in this area, sharing that information with business and documenting implementation options with owners of other Commonwealth business intelligence and data analytics resources.

Financials

The DA/BI Lead will support data access for users in the following areas, working to improve data quality and access in the new solution:


Acquire to Retire (Capital Asset Management)
Cash Management
Cost Allocation
Debt Management
Grants Financial Management
Operating Budget Management
Order to Cash (Revenue/Accounts Receivable)
Procure to Pay (Accounts Payable)
Program Management
Record to Report (Financial Reporting)
Reporting/Analytics
Sub-fund Management
Vendor Management and Self Service


Operations


Maintenance and Warranty Management
Incident Management
Capacity Management
Availability Management
Performance Management
Security Management
Nightly Batch Jobs Management
Software Change Management and Testing
Disaster Recovery Testing and Management


Specific Duties


Contribute to the development of data reporting and data access through database queries, reports, and dashboards.
Gather information from agency business users and technical staff regarding the types of data, frequency of reports or dashboards, distribution of reports or dashboards, and other information as needed to understand the current reporting needs of agencies.
Participate in developing an approach to identifying reporting and data analytics needs across the new solution user community.
Document configuration decisions for each standard report and dashboard and provide guidance to report developers during the configuration stage.
Participate in testing of configured reports and dashboards and assist in coordinating user testing of these materials.
Support and manage enterprise architecture’s data operations (optimize data processing, query performance and data quality) and data pipelines.
Integrate data from diverse sources using ETL processes and transform raw data into datasets used for analysis.
Implement robust security measures, monitor data access and develop access policies.
Provide technological expertise to capture, store and employ data catalogue and lineage to support governance initiatives.
Understand business requirements in the BI context and design data models to convert raw data to meaningful insights.
Perform SQL, DAX queries and functions in Power BI.
Receive training and hands on guidance from the system integrator and product vendor in how to build queries, reports, and dashboards in order to assist reports developers in their work.
Assist in the creation of job aids and other training materials to support report writing by agency users.


Required Skills


Interviewing managers and other stakeholders to understand their data needs.
Interviewing users to understand what they need from data systems to boost their performance.
Translating business goals, user needs and process improvements into data management functions and requirements.
Explaining the capabilities of data systems to business managers and users as the new solution is designed and configured.
Providing guidance on project scoping to meet stakeholders' requirements.
Assessing whether data is fit for use by performing initial validation of data delivered as part of the project.
Exhibiting an excellent understanding of how data are used within business processes and its impact.
In-depth exposure to data quality concepts, best practices, and tools.
Experience in designing, developing and deploying business analytics dashboards using PowerBI.
Experience in Cloud Data warehouses like Snowflake, Redshift.
Familiarity with Snowflake Data sharing, Snowpipe and Snowpark.
Experience in ETL tools such as Pentaho/Informatica and proficient in SQL.
Well-developed system analysis skills.
Understanding and knowledge of IT standards and controls.
Proficient written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills.


Preferred Qualifications

Experience with Software as a Service cloud implementations particularly those in which legacy on premise applications have been migrated to cloud delivery options.

Minimum Entrance Requirements


Bachelor's degree in computer science, system analysis or a related study, or equivalent experience.
Minimum of 5 years of design and implementation experience in the areas of business intelligence/reporting and data warehousing.


Hybrid Work Model

Under this policy, employees are currently required to work a minimum of four business days per month (two set by management and two set by the employee) on-site at CTR’s Boston office and may work remotely the remainder of the time at a location approved by their supervisor, so long as they comply with the requirements of the telework policy. Under this policy, all employees must be able to report to the Boston office with little or no notice, even including the same workday should an exigent circumstance arise. Therefore, a reasonable proximity to the office is necessary. CTR does not reimburse for employees to travel to the office.

In addition, the successful candidate may be required to work primarily on site in Boston during the initial training and orientation period and/or for certain positions a primarily on-site role may be necessary.

Additional Skills

Job DescriptionPosition Summary

The BEST Program Data Analyst/BI Engineer (DA/BI) will work with a Team comprised of BEST Program staff, agency business and technical SMEs and the new solution system integrator (SI) and product vendor to design and implement the data information management and reporting strategies, tools, and outputs to provide a robust reporting and data analytics capacity for users of the new Financials solution.The implementation of the new Financials solution will provide users with the ability to run queries and reports on the live data in this application directly rather than waiting for data to be available through warehouse reports. Data will be integrated across modules permitting more robust, real-time reporting and analytics capabilities.

The BEST Program Data Analyst/BI Engineer will work with the BEST Financials Data Lead to identify reporting, dashboard and business analytics needs that will drive the configuration of standard reports and dashboards delivered through the new Financials solution. The DA/BI Lead will assist in leading requirements sessions with BEST staff, agency staff and the system integrator and product vendor to review the reporting and analytics capabilities of the new solution and to identify available configuration options. The DA/BI Lead will develop and maintain a list of selected configurations for each report and dashboard and work with reports/dashboard developers during configuration to assist in translating business requirements to the configured reports. The DA/BI Lead will also participate in testing configured reports and dashboards and in organizing user testing of these items.

Whenever feasible, the BEST Program intends to adopt delivered reports and dashboards, but in instances where reporting requirements cannot be met by the delivered solutions, the DA/BI Lead will work with business and the system integrator and product vendor to identify requirements for future report development and participate in testing of these items when they are developed. The DA/BI Lead will work with business and the system integrator and product vendor to identify opportunities for improving the availability of data for reporting and analytics by understanding the solution’s capacities in this area, sharing that information with business and documenting implementation options with owners of other Commonwealth business intelligence and data analytics resources.

Financials

The DA/BI Lead will support data access for users in the following areas, working to improve data quality and access in the new solution:

  • Acquire to Retire (Capital Asset Management)
  • Cash Management
  • Cost Allocation
  • Debt Management
  • Grants Financial Management
  • Operating Budget Management
  • Order to Cash (Revenue/Accounts Receivable)
  • Procure to Pay (Accounts Payable)
  • Program Management
  • Record to Report (Financial Reporting)
  • Reporting/Analytics
  • Sub-fund Management
  • Vendor Management and Self Service

Operations

  • Maintenance and Warranty Management
  • Incident Management
  • Capacity Management
  • Availability Management
  • Performance Management
  • Security Management
  • Nightly Batch Jobs Management
  • Software Change Management and Testing
  • Disaster Recovery Testing and Management

Title: Data Analyst II
Description:
Xometry (NASDAQ: XMTR) powers the industries of today and tomorrow by connecting the people with big ideas to the manufacturers who can bring them to life. Xometry’s digital marketplace gives manufacturers the critical resources they need to grow their business while also making it easy for buyers at Fortune 1000 companies to tap into global manufacturing capacity.

As a Data Analyst II, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our sales strategy by providing reporting and valuable insights on sales data and activities. You will directly support sales leadership while driving the development and implementation of our sales analytics and data strategy, while identifying trends and recommend solutions or processes to drive sales effectiveness.

Key Responsibilities:


Creation, analysis, and distribution of reports and dashboards for Sales
Create ad-hoc reports and analysis as needed
Problem-solving and troubleshooting data reporting inaccuracies
Assist in creating, maintaining, and optimizing analytic models
Follow and develop reporting best practices
Transform data into actionable insights and visualize it effectively using tools like Looker
Demonstrate a passion for working with data and the ability to turn raw data into actionable insights
Serve as a liaison between our data needs and what is currently available, guiding data cleansing efforts when necessary
Possess the ability to influence and persuade stakeholders with data-driven insights


Qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a relevant discipline. Master's degree preferred
3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst or Business Analyst, preferably with a focus on sales analytics
Advanced in SQL and Looker (not Looker Studio), and preferably LookML
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
Ability to communicate complex findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders
Ability to independently source and assess data for relevance
Familiarity with data cleansing processes and experience in data cleaning is a plus
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to influence and persuade stakeholders.
Able to solve complex problems and successfully manage ambiguity and unexpected change
Nice to have experience using: Snowflake, Salesforce, dbt (data build tool), GitHub, Excel
Must be a US citizen or Green Card Holder (ITAR)


Here at Xometry we believe in diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging. We are committed to welcoming, respecting, and valuing people for who they are as individuals, learning from their differences, embracing their uniqueness, and providing a positive workplace for all.

Xometry is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

Xometry participates in E-Verify and after a job offer is accepted, will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.

Title: Compensation & Data Analyst (Boston-Hybrid)
Description:
About SimpliSafe

We're a high-tech home security company that's passionate about protecting the life you've built and our mission of keeping Every Home Secure. And we've created a culture here that cares just as deeply about the career you're building. Ours is a no ego culture of collaboration and innovation where those seeking their next challenge can find big opportunities and make a huge impact on the lives of all those who we protect. We don't just want you to work here. We want you to grow and thrive here.

We're embracing a hybrid work model that enables our teams to split their time between office and home. Hybrid for us means we expect our teams to come together in our state-of-the-art office on two core days, typically Tuesday and Wednesday, to work together in person, and teams can choose where they work for the remainder of the week. We all benefit from flexibility and get to use the best of both worlds to get our work done.

Why are we hiring?

Well, we're growing and thriving. So, we need smart, talented, and humble people who share our values to join us as we disrupt the home security space and relentlessly pursue our mission of keeping Every Home Secure.

What You'll Do

The Compensation & Data Analyst plays a crucial role across our People team. Their primary responsibilities will include conducting compensation analysis in support of our compensation programs and assisting in the design/analysis of various compensation strategies. This role also includes audit and analytical support for our Total Rewards and Payroll function.

In addition to compensation support, the analyst will collect, structure, analyze data and create reports for stakeholders across the People team to better support the insights the People team provides to the business.. With stellar data reporting acumen and sharp analytical skills, they arm the People team with data needed to implement and measure the impact of our programs and overall organizational health and support decision-making.

Primary responsibilities include:

Compensation


Conducting Compensation Analysis: This involves researching and analyzing compensation data, both internally within the company and externally in the industry. This analysis helps in determining appropriate salary ranges, bonuses, and other forms of compensation.
Salary Surveys and Benchmarking: Gathering data from salary surveys and benchmarking studies to compare the company's compensation packages with those of competitors and industry standards. This helps in ensuring that the company remains competitive in attracting and retaining talent.
Supporting Compensation Reviews and Budgeting: Assisting with annual compensation reviews and budgeting processes. Providing insights and recommendations to management regarding salary adjustments, bonus payouts, and budget allocations.
Communication and Education: Communicating compensation policies and practices to employees and managers. Providing guidance and education on compensation-related matters, such as salary negotiations, benefits enrollment, and incentive programs.
Developing tools and reports for People Partners and Talent Acquisition to help with self-service.
Data Analysis and Reporting: Analyzing compensation data to identify trends, whether our programs are performing as planned and areas for improvement. Generating reports and presentations to communicate findings to key stakeholders.


Data & Reporting


Gather HR data from various sources, such as HRIS, employee surveys, and performance management platform.
Clean and validate data ensuring accuracy, consistency, and integrity
Analyze data looking for trends and patterns in data related to recruitment, hiring practices, motivation, turnover, and compliance.
Prepare reports translating complex HR data into meaningful reports and presentations that senior leadership can understand
Create and maintain People data tools, reporting and dashboards; produce and deliver standard (monthly, quarterly, and annual) and customized People data reports
Example reports include: DEI, attrition, and talent management;monthly payroll reporting for Finance
Collaborate across the People Team responding to ad hoc data requests and partnering on projects requiring data analysis.

What You'll Bring


Advanced Excel knowledge, experience building models
Strong data analytical skills and experience
Strong communication skills
Highly detail oriented and organized in a fast-paced environment
A proven performer who is motivated, focused, passionate, and inspires confidence in employees and senior management, and
Highest level of integrity in all dealings with people inside and outside the Company, exemplifying high moral and ethical behavior
Experience with Tableau a plus
Experience with UKG Ready a plus


What Values You'll Share


Customer Obsessed - Building deep empathy for our customers, putting them at the core of our work, and developing strong, long-term relationships with them.
Aim High - Always challenging ourselves and others to raise the bar.
No Ego - Maintaining a "no job too small" attitude, and an open, inclusive and humble style.
One Team - Taking a highly collaborative approach to achieving success.
Lift As We Climb - Investing in developing others and helping others around us succeed.
Lean & Nimble - Working with agility and efficiency to experiment in an often ambiguous environment.


We wholeheartedly embrace and actively seek applications from all individuals, no matter how they identify. We are committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we believe our work is enriched when we incorporate a multitude of perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences. We want everyone who works here to thrive and contribute to not only our mission of keeping every home secure, but also to making our workplace safe and supportive for others. If a reasonable accommodation may be needed to fully participate in the job application or interview process, to perform the essential functions of a position, or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact careers@simplisafe.com.

If a reasonable accommodation may be needed to fully participate in the job application or interview process, to perform the essential functions of a position, or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact careers@simplisafe.com.

Title: Analyst I, Risk Analytics
Description:
We’re defining what it means to build and deliver the most extraordinary sports and entertainment experiences. Our global team is trailblazing new markets, developing cutting-edge products, and shaping the future of responsible gaming.

Here, “impossible” isn’t part of our vocabulary. You’ll face some of the toughest but most rewarding challenges of your career. They’re worth it. Channeling your inner grit will accelerate your growth, help us win as a team, and create unforgettable moments for our customers.

The Crown Is Yours

As an Associate Analyst, Risk, you will heavily support fraud operations management through the use of data and analytics in order to assess the effectiveness and efficiency of our agents. Risk Analytics works to prevent account takeovers, identify stolen credit cards used on the DraftKings platform, to identify and prevent check kiting, and more. You will lean in on supporting fraud incident responses by assessing data and finding signals to better detect new threats. Through cross-functional collaboration and analytical problem solving, you will enable teams across our organization to make smarter, better, and faster decisions.

What you’ll do as an Associate Analyst, Risk


Analyze data to support data-driven decision-making. For example: optimize risk thresholds, evaluate alert performance, and interpret trends while collaborating with team members and senior leadership to ensure effective risk management.
Build and maintain a reporting suite to support critical initiatives and inform stakeholders.
Collaborate with data engineering to stitch various disparate data sources together, enhancing insights across the entire risk department.
Dive into databases, CRMs, and bespoke internal tooling to understand and explain how DraftKings systems holistically interact.
Drive process improvements through data powered recommendations.
React real-time to various threats to the business by evaluating alerts, assessing capacity and priorities, and delivering recommendations to drive value.
Create high-quality communications to align key stakeholders across the business.
Work cross-functionally to analyze and highlight important customer behaviors.



What you’ll bring


At least 1 year of professional analytics experience.
Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Finance, or a related field preferred.
An analytical mindset and experience with analyzing and interpreting large data sets.
Experience in data manipulation required, such as SQL, python, R, etc.
Experience in data visualization (Tableau) required.
Experience building simple frameworks and finding solutions to complex problems.
Demonstrated ability to create and deliver compelling, data driven presentations.
Ability to work autonomously in a fast-paced, ever changing environment.



Join Our Team

We’re a publicly traded (NASDAQ: DKNG) technology company headquartered in Boston. As a regulated gaming company, you may be required to obtain a gaming license issued by the appropriate state agency as a condition of employment. Don’t worry, we’ll guide you through the process if this is relevant to your role.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $62,400.00 - $93,600.00, plus bonus, equity, and benefits as applicable. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range and how that was determined during the hiring process.


Show more

Title: Analyst, Advanced Analytics
Description:
Pay Philosophy

The typical starting salary range for this role is determined by a number of factors including skills, experience, education, certifications and location. The full salary range for this role reflects the competitive labor market value for all employees in these positions across the national market and provides an opportunity to progress as employees grow and develop within the role. Some roles at Liberty Mutual have a corresponding compensation plan which may include commission and/or bonus earnings at rates that vary based on multiple factors set forth in the compensation plan for the role.

Description

The Strategy and Insights team within the Enterprise Transformation Office is actively searching for a highly motivated analyst to join the Procurement Analytics team. This position will provide analytical support and insights to Enterprise Procurement to help generate value from Liberty Mutual’s supplier relationships. This person will be required to frame and answer operational and strategic questions from senior management and executive leadership. The ideal candidate possesses advanced analytical abilities and will be able to work collaboratively & independently.

Responsibilities


Perform analysis and recommendations to influence Enterprise Procurement strategies and goals.
Will be asked to present analysis in an understandable and concise manner to effectively influence others.
With guidance, develop and produce dashboards/reports to support assessment and monitoring of operational and expense/spend metrics.
Assist in maintaining and improving the current reporting infrastructure.
Identify issues within existing tools, processes, data sources and voice suggestions to the team to improve accuracy, decrease latency, and reduce inefficiencies.
Stay informed about procurement category market trends, identifying drivers for expense saving opportunities.
Maintains close working relationships with data providers and partners.
Query and validate large and complex datasets to deliver analytically sound insights.
Support an inclusive, equitable, and high-performing culture.


You will be required to go into the office twice a month if you reside within 50 miles of one of the following offices: Boston, MA; Seattle,WA; Portsmouth,NH; Plano,TX. Please note this policy is subject to change.

Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree plus 2-4 years of experience, or master’s degree with no professional experience, or equivalent.
Proficient in Excel, Power BI, PowerPoint, and statistical software packages (e.g. SAS, Emblem).
Knowledgeable in data query languages and tools (e.g. SQL, DAX, Snowflake, Python)
Must have good planning, analytical, decision-making and communication skills.
Knowledge of data sources, tools, statistical principles, methodologies, and techniques.


About Us

**This position may have in-office requirements depending on candidate location.**

At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently pursue tomorrow. That's why we provide an environment focused on openness, inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you'll discover our expansive range of roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding profession.

Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a "Great Place to Work" by Great Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also selected as one of the "100 Best Places to Work in IT" on IDG's Insider Pro and Computerworld's 2020 list. For many years running, we have been named by Forbes as one of America's Best Employers for Women and one of America's Best Employers for New Graduates as well as one of America's Best Employers for Diversity. To learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit: https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-inclusion

We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits

Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran's status, pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or local law.

Fair Chance Notices

San Francisco
Los Angeles
Philadelphia

Title: Production Support ETL Data Analyst
Description:
POSITION

Production Support ETL Data Analyst

LOCATION

Hybrid 3 Days onsite: Boston, MA; Charlotte, NC; Colorado Springs, CO; Conshohocken, PA; Dallas, TX; Fargo, ND; Florham Park, NJ; Garden City, NY; Houston, TX; Jacksonville, IL; Lenexa, KS; Los Angeles, CA; Lubbock, TX; Mt Juliet, TN; New York, NY; Purchase, NY; Topeka, KS

DURATION

6-12 Months ++

C2C PAY RATE

$60/hr C2C

INTERVIEW TYPE

Video

VISA TYPE

Any

Required Skills


Proven 3+ years’ experience of data analysis within an enterprise data warehouse.
Possess 2 years of Policy & Claims Insurance subject-matter expertise.
Candidate has advanced level SQL knowledge.
Possess optimal knowledge for concepts and frameworks for Data Warehousing, ETL, and BI Architectures.
Candidate is capable of creating and tuning Semantic layer Reporting Views.
Able to facilitate data discovery sessions, which will include an audience of business subject-matter experts.
Proven knowledge of RDBMS platforms (e.g., SQL Server, DB2), with experience in generating DDL.


Possess knowledge of Guidewire Policy Center, Guidewire Claims Center, SAP FS-RI & SAP FS-CD applications with their data is considered a plus.


GENERAL QUALIFICATIONS
Candidate has strong interpersonal skills, including both written and verbal communication skills.
Possess the ability to work as part of a team.
Candidate has strong organizational skills and analysis skills.
EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS
B.S. Degree in Computer Information Science, Information Management, or Statistics.

Title: Junior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
This role is with EF Education First. WayUp is partnering with EF Education First to hire top talent.

Junior Business Intelligence Analyst

EF Explore America

Boston

Application deadline: 8/9

Start date: 9/1

Overview:

Do you find yourself dreaming of how automations and reports could make your life easier and wishing you had the skills to make these ideas a reality? Do you look at spreadsheets and Power BI reports and get inspired to make data driven decisions? Do you want to learn more about our business, such as where the numbers behind sales goals and strategy come from?

Join the EA FAST team to learn these data and analysis skills and develop Power Platform tools that will empower EA sales. As a Junior Business Intelligence Analyst for EF Explore America, you will be in a pivotal role between our in-house tech teams, our sales and production workforce, and our customers. You will be working to ensure customers and staff have the tools, resources, and trainings they need to use our technology for business development. In this role, you will learn core skills such as SQL, DAX, Azure, and Power Platform to help you build a career in business intelligence and analysis.

Responsibilities:

Business Intelligence


Trouble-shoot incoming bug reports and know when to escalate an issue
Provide final testing sign-off on new features for Explore America
Learn best practices for analysis tools such as SQL, DBT, Power BI, and Power Automate
Use newly gained skills to develop reports and dashboards, complete data requests, and provide end user access to reporting tools.


Systems Support


Lead our team of Systems Power Users
Support on-going trainings with the sales floor to ensure staff are maximizing their use of our software
Deliver general systems support for our Boston, Austin, and Denver workforce as well as our remote users, serving as the main point of contact for system and web questions


Skills:


At least two years’ experience in sales or service is preferred
A drive to always be learning
Strong attention to detail
Thrive on working with multiple projects simultaneously
Superior communication skills
Embrace a collaborative working style
Solve problems independently, but will ask for help and leverage the knowledge and experience of others to overcome tough obstacles
Passion for maintaining high standards in their work


Compensation $60,000-$65,000

About EF Education First

At EF we believe that the world is better when people try to understand one another. Since 1965, we have helped millions of people see new places, experience new cultures, and learn new things about the world and about themselves. Our culturally immersive education programs-focused on language, travel, cultural exchange, and academics-turn dreams into international opportunities.

When you join EF, you join a multicultural and diverse community working across more than 600 schools and offices in 50 countries, all with one shared mission of opening the world through education. Whoever you are, whatever you are passionate about-we welcome you and want you to bring that to work every day. EF is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to inclusion and belonging across race, ethnicity, gender, age, religion, caste, parental status, identity, experience and everything else that makes you unique.

Founded in Sweden in 1965, EF has schools and offices around the world, including hubs in Boston, London, Mexico City, São Paulo, Shanghai, Stockholm, Zürich, and more. Learn more at https://www.ef.com.
Show more

Title: Salesforce Data Analyst
Description:
Salesforce Data Analyst

This individual will be responsible for serving as primary liaison to IT during the buildout and implementation of a new and evolving Salesforce CRM. In addition, the candidate will provide strategic insight into opportunities for dashboard development and data collection and synthesis to improve data-driven decision making related to career development events, activities and student outcomes.




Responsibilities:

• Expertise in Salesforce development, design, integration, and training

• Experience in conducting database training sessions and developing database training materials

• Experience or ability to develop proficiency with platforms including Handshake and PowerBI

• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

• Ability to work collaboratively with diverse stakeholders, including staff, students, employers, alumni, and faculty.

• Attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy and integrity.




Must Have:

• Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Business, Information Technology, or a related field; Master’s degree preferred.

• 3 years of experience in data analytics, preferably within higher education or career services.

• Demonstrated experience with Salesforce administration and data management.

• Proficiency in PowerBI, Handshake, and other relevant software and tools.

• R, Python, SQL, database management tools

Title: Reporting Analyst
Description:
The Health Connector is seeking a Reporting Analyst to work with Health Connector staff and stakeholders to produce accurate, validated, sustainable, and timely reports. The Reporting Analyst is a member of the Data, Analytics & Reporting team within the Operations department and is the interface with stakeholders to ensure reports and data requests are managed and delivered timely and accurately. The Reporting Analyst reports to the Director of Data & Analytics, while working closely and collaboratively with a variety of teams in support of Health Connector programs.




Key Responsibilities Include:




Ensure reporting deliverables are met, and any issues escalated appropriately.
Work with Health Connector staff and stakeholders to define, document and communicate business and report requirements, expected outcomes, results, and other preferences.
Develop and maintain user guides for all reports.
Demonstrate reporting best practices to ensure the accurate collection, analysis, and distribution of reports such that the enterprise report catalog is manageable and sustainable.
Ensure that data is validated, reconciled and contextually consistent across all internal and external reports.
Ensure all reporting deliverables are tracked, managed, accurate and on time.
Interpret data, analyze, and validate results, and help develop ad hoc and recurring reports to support strategic, operational, and financial decision-making in a timely manner.
Identify opportunities to standardize, automate and provide self-service reports in response to and in anticipation of business needs.
Understand Health Connector program requirements, business processes, and systems management.




Basic Requirements:




Bachelor’s degree in business administration, economics, finance, information technology, computer science or related field.
3+ years of progressive experience and skill with business requirement gathering, report development, communication of findings, data analysis.
Ability to collaborate with subject matter experts, data analysts, and technical resources.
Advanced Excel skills (preferably in a healthcare setting), and reporting and analytical packages (Tableau preferred).
Strong customer focus with the demonstrated ability to build strong working relationships.
Experience working with large amounts of complex relational data from different databases and data sources.
Excellent technical writing skills to prepare outward facing publicly available analytical documents and reports and ability to explain results accurately and concisely to both technical/non-technical colleagues and stakeholders.
Excellent presentation and data visualization skills.
Excellent time management skills and ability to manage competing priorities.







If interested: Send a cover letter and résumé to Connector-jobs@mass.gov.




Salary: $80,000-85,000/year




Please note:

Due to the requirement of 268A, please complete the Applicant Disclosure Form and return it with your application. Link - https://www.mahealthconnector.org/wp-content/uploads/ApplicantsDisclosureForm.pdf




All Health Connector employees are required to provide satisfactory proof of eligibility to work in the United States




All Health Connector employees are required to provide satisfactory proof of full COVID-19 vaccination.




The Health Connector is operating on a hybrid work arrangement with 2 days in the downtown Boston office and 3 days working from home.




Employee may be requested to work an extended day and weekends to meet deadlines




About the Health Connector:

The Commonwealth Health Insurance Connector Authority (Massachusetts Health Connector) is an independent public authority serving as the Affordable Care Act (ACA)-compliant marketplace for the Commonwealth. The organization is charged with providing subsidized and unsubsidized health insurance to individuals and small employers. The Health Connector also oversees policy development related to health care reform under both state and federal laws, as well as conducting public education and outreach about health care reform and coverage opportunities.

The Health Connector is an equal-opportunity employer that values diversity as a vital characteristic of its workforce. We consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual identity, gender identity, national origin, or disability.

Title: Claims Data Analyst
Description:
The Claims Data Analyst’s mission will be to provide support to the IA Claims Analytics Team, the Claims Department’s Operations and Management Teams and Departments as needed. The successful candidate will participate in a broad range of data management, reporting and analytical activities designed to help Plymouth Rock maintain and extend its competitive edge with respect to loss management, claims customer service, expense control, and employee engagement.

Job Responsibilities


Work closely with Claims Department management and other business functions producing both recurring (production) and ad hoc reports and analyses
Develop and maintain an efficient and sustainable data structure and environment to support automated reporting, business intelligence, analysis and predictive modeling
Monitor company performance relative to history, targets and the competition through internal data sources, industry data and other publicly available data
Work with the Claims Department’s management team to continually develop the best possible set of metrics that enable maximum executive understanding of how Claims is performing relative to our objectives and relative to the competition. Produce and analyze monthly results reports against operational metrics and deliver same to senior management.
Assist in business research by participating in hypothesis generation, gathering data, identifying root causes of problems or opportunities and proposing solutions, on the basis of analytic findings
Document and communicate project quality over the course of testing, including readiness for release using our standard test process and status reporting template
Provide feedback and recommendations to business on report usability and functionality
Provide other Claims Department analytical support as needed


Qualifications


Prior Property & Casualty Insurance experience preferred
Comfort in working with relational databases and an education in predictive modeling.
Excellent skills as a communicator and facilitator, both written and oral; to effectively communicate results and ideas to Claims leadership, and to other audiences outside the department
Advanced knowledge of Excel and proficiency in other Microsoft Office suite products
Skilled in SQL, preferably experienced in SQL Server Management Studio
Knowledge of one or more of the following: MS Access, DB2, Hyperion, R, Python, Tableau, Power BI or similar business intelligence tool(s)
Ability to manage structured and non-structured data from multiple sources
Ability to work independently and within a team to accomplish a common goal
Intellectually curious and interested in exploring new ways to analyze data and effectively deliver findings to both technical and non-technical audiences
Intrinsic sense of urgency with ability to prioritize workload, meet project deadlines and drive results


Education And Experience


Bachelor’s Degree in either business, analytical or system development discipline desired (engineering, statistics, economics, mathematics, computer science, software development)
Prior SQL coding experience required
Prior claims and/or insurance experience preferred but not required
Project management experience (even small scale) preferred but not required


About The Company

The Plymouth Rock Company and its affiliated group of companies write and manage over $2 billion in personal and commercial auto and homeowner’s insurance throughout the Northeast and mid-Atlantic, where we have built an unparalleled reputation for service. We continuously invest in technology, our employees thrive in our empowering environment, and our customers are among the most loyal in the industry. The Plymouth Rock group of companies employs more than 1,800 people and is headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts. Plymouth Rock Assurance Corporation holds an A.M. Best rating of “A-/Excellent”.
